loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina O. is from the village of Minsalag, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 58 years old, married, and has ten adult and infant-aged children. To make a living, Avelina owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community. Avelina has been engaged in her business for a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2007, Avelina joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Avelina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael is 34 years old and a mother of three children, the youngest of whom is just 13 months old. Rachael's husband sells lubricants to support the home while Rachael sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers. Before now, she hawked cooked foods from one place to another. However, with a loan from Kiva partner, LAPO, she was then able to get a stall and sell foodstuffs. Rachael opens her stall daily from 8am to 6pm. She is now requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and to LAPO.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores S. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, widowed, and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Dolores owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community. Dolores has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2001, Dolores joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Dolores is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her tenth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Charity Group

texts.en:
Jhona A. is from the village of Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Jhona is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jhona A. Group. 

Jhona is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jhona owns and operates a business selling a variety of daily use products and providing load for cellular communication in the local community. Jhona has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $65 a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Jhona joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Jhona is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Iris Marinella

texts.es: Iris Marinella Y. F., de 37 años de edad, posee una pupusería en la cual se encarga de elaborar y comercializar pupusas de diferentes sabores como pupusas de queso, chicharrón y frijol con queso. Desde hace nueve años que ella elabora este tipo de alimentos en su hogar, el cual esta ubicado en Cojutepeque, departamento de Cuscatlán, en donde vive junto a su familia, la cual esta conformada por sus padres de avanzada edad y su único hijo de cinco años. Por el exquisito sabor que poseen las pupusas que Marinella elabora, cuenta con muchos clientes en el lugar, a pesar de tener bastante competencia. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, queso, chicharrón, frijoles y otros ingredientes más los cuales son fundamentales para hacer las pupusas, platillo muy famoso en El Salvador. Tanto para Marinella como para su familia es de mucha importancia el aumentar sus ventas, esto debido a que es ella la única que cuenta con trabajo, debido a la avanzada edad de sus padres, Marinella debe trabajar arduamente por obtener el sustento diario para ellos y su pequeño hijo, el cual depende absolutamente de ella.
texts.en:
Iris Marinella Y. F. is 37 years old and owns a pupuseria (an eatery where pupusas are sold) wherein she makes and sells pupusas (typical, popular El Salvadorian dish comprised of stuffed flatbreads) filled with cheese, or stuffed with a combination of ingredients such as pork scratching, beans and cheese. Marinella has been selling pupusas from her home for the last nine years. Marinella lives in the town of Cojutepeque, in the district of Cuscatlán where she lives with her senior citizen parents and her only child, a son of five years. In spite of much competition, Marinella has built up a sizeable clientele due to the exquisite taste of her pupusas. She requires a loan to purchase more corn, cheese, pork rind, beans and other ingredients, which are necessary to make the pupusas. The need to increase sales is of equal importance to Marinella and her family due to the fact that she is the sole provider for her family. Due to the advanced age of her parents, Marinella has to work extremely hard to support her parents and her young son who is completely dependent on her.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more corn, pork rind and cheese to make her restaurant's signature dish.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith loves cooking and that is why she commercialized her cooking skills to earn a living in Lagos state, Nigeria. She cooks mouth watering Nigerian foods that keep her customers coming back for more. She hopes to own a world class restaurant in the future. She hopes for a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

She is married to a commercial driver and they have four children. Her youngest child is nine years old and her children are excelling in school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Irma Concepción

texts.es: Irma Concepción F. S. de 39 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a sus padres, su hermana, abuela y un sobrino. Irma es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada, quien posee una venta de ropa para niños y niñas, así mismo comercializa cosméticos y artículos para regalo para toda ocasión. Desde hace más de cinco años que Irma se dedica a este trabajo el cual le ha permitido obtener muy buenas ganancias. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de Cojutepeque, en el sector de cosméticos, lugar muy estratégico ya que ella posee uno de los puestos más surtidos y que cuenta con mayores ganancias. Irma solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder aumentar su inventario, sobre todo de productos para regalos, esto debido a que en este mes sus ventas aumentas por el día del amor y la amistad, Irma desea poder aprovechar esta fecha del año y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan poder aportar a su hogar y así mismo solventar sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Irma Concepción F. S. is 39 years old and lives in Cojutepeque, located in the district of Cuscatlán. Irma lives with her parents, sister, grandmother and nephew. Irma is very hard-working and committed and owns a stall where she sells children’s clothes, cosmetics and gifts for all occasions. Irma has been involved in this business for the past five years, allowing her to make good profits. Her business is located in Cojutepeque market, in the cosmetics’ section, a very strategic location since her stall is one of the most widely stocked and successful. Irma requests a loan to increase her stock, particularly of gifts, due to a potential increase in sales from Valentine’s Day. Irma wishes to take advantage of this day of the year to make maximum profits, which will allow her to help support her family and settle some personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her gift supplies for her business.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es: María Rosario S. de 52 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Armenia, ubicado en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposo, su madre y dos nietos de 10 y 8 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María es una mujer muy emprendedora quien vela por el bienestar de su familia, y quien cuenta con el deseo de contribuir junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar de manera que puedan solventarlos todos. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos, así mismo vende cosméticos como gel para el cabello, esmaltes y desodorantes, lo cual le permite contar con un extra en su negocio. Irma solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder aumentar sus productos, esto debido a que ya cuenta con cinco años de poseer la tienda y hasta este momento le ha sido muy difícil surtirla con todo lo necesario, es por esto que ella desea contar con productos los cuales son muy solicitados, tales como granos básicos, bebidas gaseosas y carne de res y de pollo, todo esto es con el fin de aumentar sus ventas, de manera que pueda brindarles una vida mejor a su familia la cual necesita mucho de ella y de su esposo para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria Rosario S. is 52 years old and resides in the Municipality of Armenia, located in the Sonsonate Department. She lives with her husband, her mother, and her two grandchildren, one 10 and the other 8 years old, both of which attend school. Maria is a very enterprising woman, whom watches over the wellbeing of her family and wishes to contribute just as much as her husband towards their household expenses in order to never have to be in debt. She owns a store that sells perishable products. In addition, she sells comestics such as hair gel, nail polish, and deodorants, which allows her to earn some extra income. She is seeking out a loan so that she can increase the quantity of products in her store. She has owned her store for five years and even now, she finds it difficult to stock it with all of the necessary items. For this reason, she hopes to obtain products that are in high demand, such as basic grains, soft drinks, and meat. Ultimately, she wants to increase sales so that she can provide a better life for her family, who depend heavily on her and her husband to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food products.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has a shop where she sells drinks to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Grace is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She hopes to own a world class drinks shop in the future. 

She is married to a commercial driver and they have four children. She hopes to provide a quality education to her children. She says thank you and promises to repay her Kiva loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase drinks to sell

loans.name: Sovannarith

texts.en:
Mr. Sovannarith S. (shown in the photo), 42 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Kimheang Hi, 40 years old, were married in 1991 and have two sons, both of whom are in school. They are living along National Road Number Six about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sovannarith and his wife have been farming for ten years. They grow rice and vegetables on their farmland in the village. The couple doesn’t have enough capital to maintain their vegetable and rice farm, so Sovannarith is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seed.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and seed

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia M. Z. de 30 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. Ana posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad para el hogar. Este negocio es el cual le ha permitido poder contar con ganancias extras lo que le brinda la ayuda necesaria tanto a su esposo como a ella para pagar su casa a tiempo, y así mismo contar con los alimentos y todo lo necesario para vivir dignamente. Es por esto que Irma desea contar con más productos en la tienda, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, lácteos y otros más los cuales son necesarios en una buena tienda. Esto es muy importante para Ana ya que cuenta con mucha competencia en el lugar, es por esto que debe contar con todo lo necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes y así ganar otros más los cuales prefieran comprar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia M. Z. is 30 years old and resides in the Municipality of Lourdes Colón, located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and her four-year-old son, whom attends school. Ana owns a store that sells perishable products and common household items. This business has allowed her to earn an extra income which contributes just as much as the earnings of her husband in the timely payments towards their house, their food, and other necessary expenses that they have in order to lead a dignified life. As such, she wishes to be able to add more products to her shop. This is why she has sought out a loan, with which she plans to purchase rice, beans, sugar, dairy products, and other necessary items to make her store a well-stocked one. This is very important for Ana because she is well-established in her area and she wants to be able to have everything that she needs to satisfy her customers and hopefully gain new ones that prefer to shop at her store.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perishable products.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 28 years old and married with a one-year-old child. He is a farmer in the Nyamira area of Western Kenya. He's been farming for three years and already employs six people. He sells milk, tea, and cereals locally. He also earns income from selling clothes. He says that the main challenges to growing his business are poor market conditions, lack of financing, and diseases that strike his livestock.

He requested this loan through the Kiva field partner, Juhudi Kilimo, for 60,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 45,000 KES.  He says this new loan will help him better provide for his family's needs because of the increased milk production. In the future, he'd like to produce at least 50 litres each day.

About Juhudi Kilimo
Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers life insurance and a medical aid program. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús M. M. de 42 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a sus tres hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales con mucho esfuerzo por parte de su madre, se dedican a estudiar. Teresa posee un comedor en el cual se encarga de hacer desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales comercializa con trabajadores de las diferentes fábricas del lugar, así como también con habitantes de la zona del pueblo de San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella es una persona que cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de los mismo comerciantes del lugar, ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora y esforzada, quien se ha dedica por completo al bienestar de sus tres hijos los cuales depende por completo de ella. Es por esto que Teresa solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda comprar más verduras, pollo, pan, bebidas, y todo lo que le permita elaborar más alimentos y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús M. M. is 42 years old and resides in the Municipality of Lourdes Colón, located in the Department of La Libertad. She lives with her three children, all of whom are minors and attend school, which requires a great deal of effort on her part. Teresa owns a food stall where she is in charge of making breakfast and lunch. It is frequented by the workers of the different factories in the area and also by the residents of the town, San Juan Opico, located in the Department of La Libertad. She is greatly recommended by the business owners of the area, being a very hard-working and determined woman, whom has dedicated herself completely to the well-being of her three children, all of whom depend solely on her. As such, she is seeking out a loan, with which she will be able to purchase vegetables, chicken, bread, refreshments, and anything else she might need to be able to create more dishes and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables, chicken, bread, and refreshments.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Fumi

texts.en: Fumi is 34 years old and married to a mechanic. She has 3 children and her eldest child is 10 years old. She lives with her family in Lagos State, Nigeria. Fumi sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a super market in the future. She promises to pay back her loan promptly and she says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en: Sera is 28 years old and married to a teacher. Her husband also supports the home. She has 4 children and her eldest child is 9 years old. She lives with her family in Lagos State, Nigeria. Sera  sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a super market in the future. She promises to pay back her loan promptly and she says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ishenbubu Isagalieva's Group

texts.ru:
Исагалиева Ишенбубу 47 лет, она замужем, проживает вместе с семьей в селе Кочкорка Нарынской области. У нее двое сыновей, оба школьного возраста.Вместе с супругом она занимается перепродажей скота на местном рынке. Торговля осуществляется в выходные дни, когда работает рынок. Обычно за выходные они перепродают в среднем по 2 бычка. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса примерно равен 200 долларам. Данный кредит будет использован для увеличения товарооборота, а именно для закупа 2 бычков. 

Умут 26 лет, несмотря на свой молодой возраст, она является матерью двух сыновей: старшему 7 лет, а младшему 3 года. Ее супруг работает на стройке рабочим. Сама она присматривает за детьми. Кредит будет использован для лечения старшего сына. 

Жаныл 27 лет. Она также замужем, имеет двух дочек. Супруг занимается производством металлических печей. Кредит будет оплачиваться от бизнеса супруга, сама она домохозяйка. Кредит будет использован для лечения супруга. 

Назгул 32 года. У нее 5 детей. Супруг работает строителем. Кроме этого, семья клиента имеет свое хозяйство, где они выращивают скот. Кредит будет использован для закуп МРС.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Ishenbubu I. is 47 years old, married and lives with her family in the Kochkor village in the Narynsk region. She has two sons, both of school age. Ishenbubu and her husband are involved in livestock sales at the local market. The sales happen on weekends, when the market is open. Usually, they resell 2 bulls on average during a weekend. Their monthly business income equals approximately 200 dollars. The current loan will be used for increasing product turnover and, specifically, for the purchase of 2 bulls. Umut is 26 years old, and despite her young age, she is already a mother of two sons: the oldest is 7 years old, and the youngest is 3 years old. Her husband works as a construction worker. Umut looks after the children. The loan will be used for medical treatment for their oldest son. Janyl is 27 years old. She is also married and has two daughters. Her husband is involved in manufacturing of metal ovens. The loan will be repaid from her husband’s business income, since Janyl is a homemaker. The loan will be used for her husband’s medical treatment. Nazgul is 32 years old. She has 5 children. Her husband is a construction worker. Besides his work, the family has their own household, where they raise livestock. The loan will be used for the purchase of small livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two bulls

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 53 year-old woman who lives in Gaza, Palestine. She is married and has four children. She has owned a store, since 2008, where she sells home-made dairy products. Zeinab works to support her children and her husband, who is too old to work. She needs a loan of $3000 to buy the needed equipment to help her maintain her production line, and to help her stock the goods that she makes. This project is special because it is a family business in which Zeinab works along with her daughter and her son-in-law .

loans.use: to buy equipment that would help her increase her profit.

loans.name: Junushalieva Gulzat's Group

texts.ru:
Гулзат является лидером этой группы. Ей 38 лет, она замужем и воспитывает 4 сыновей. Супруг работает водителем, сама же занимается  животноводством. В данное время у нее в хозяйстве имеются на откорм 3 головы КРС, которые весной будут реализованы. Наш кредит позволит ей приобрести для дальнейшего откорма 4 головы МРС. В этом бизнесе она уже на протяжении последних 16 лет, ежемесячный доход составляет около 150 долларов.  В следующем году второй сын поступит  в ВУЗ, и семья клиента копит сбережения для оплаты учебы сына.

Рысбеку 42 года, он женат, а также является отцом 2 детей. Сам клиент занимается откормом и реализацией скота в Кочкорке, а у супруги имеется свой собственный бизнес по продаже муки. Животноводством занимается с 1996 года. Именно за счет доход от животноводства  купили контейнер для реализации муки и таким образом увеличили семейный доход. 

Салтанат 38 лет. Она также замужем, имеет 3 сыновей. Супруг является членом фермерского хозяйства. Кредит будет использован для увеличения поголовья скота, в данное время она откармливает двух бычков. За счет бизнеса в прошлому году они смогли построить себе 3 комнатный жилой дом.

Жаныл замужем, ей 41 лет. Она воспитывает 4 детей: два сына и две дочери. Она вместе с супругом занимаются животноводством. Бизнес был начат сравнительно недавно, а именно в начале 2009 года. Начальный капитал был равен 200 долларам, в данное время ее капитал равен примерно 2 000 долларам. Как видно это очень эффективный бизнес. Кредит позволит ей купить 2 овец для откорма. 


This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Gulzat is the leader of this group. She is 38 years old, married and is raising 4 sons. Her husband works as a driver, and Gulzat is involved in animal husbandry. Currently, she has three heads of cattle to be fed and sold in the spring. Our loan will allow her to obtain 4 heads of small livestock for further feeding. Gulzat has been in this business for the last 16 years. Her monthly income is about 150 dollars. Her son will start a university next year, and the family is saving money to pay for the son’s education. Rysbek is 42 years old. He is married and is a father of 2 children. The client is involved in raising and selling livestock in Kochkor, and his wife has her own flour sales business. Rysbek has been involved in animal husbandry since 1996. They were able to purchase a container for selling flour precisely from the income from his business and, thus, increased the family’s overall income. Saltanat is 38 years old. She is also married and has 3 sons. Her husband is a member of a farmer enterprise. This loan will be used for increasing livestock headcount. Currently, Saltanat is raising two bulls. Last year, Saltanat and her husband were able to build a three-bedroom house for themselves due to the income from the business. Janyl is married. She is 41 years old. She is raising 4 children: two sons and two daughters. Janyl and her husband are involved in animal husbandry. They started the business relatively recently, precisely at the beginning of 2009. Their starting capital was 200 dollars, and the current capital is about 2000 dollars. As you can see, this is a very effective business. This loan will allow Janyl to purchase 2 sheep to feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 sheep

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en:
Abiola is 30 years old and married and she has three children. Her youngest child is only 2 months old. Her husband is a sales representative and he also supports their home. She is a LAPO client. 

Abiola sells jewelry at retail prices to make a living. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more jewelry to sell. She says "thank you" and promises to repay her Kiva loan promptly.

About LAPO:
Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: 029 Quang Hung Group

texts.en:
H"Hoa N. T. (90) is a 30-year-old woman who lives in the town of Thanh Hoa. Hoa is the group leader of a 5-member loan group sponsored by the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 029 Quang Hung (029 Quang Hung).

Hoa is married and has 2 young children. To making a living, Hoa owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members. Hoa has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hoa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2442600 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND to purchase materials needed to provide service. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. N. T. Chung (93) is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her general store.

2. P. T. Thu (95) is a 62-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her livestock business.

3. C. T. Phuc (89) is a 61-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her food stall.

4. Q. T. Tien (94) is a 30-year-old woman who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoa N. T. (90) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 029 Quang Hung (029 Quang Hung).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ sửa chữa cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 2000000 VND. Vào 2007, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2,442,600 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vật tư cần T.ết để mở rộng dịch vụ được cung cấp. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1. N. T. Chung (93) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2. P. T. Thu (95) là 62 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3. C. T. Phuc (89) là 61 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4. Q. T. Tien (94) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas Al- B. is looking for a good sustainable project to start, as are all other Palestinians from Gaza. Grocery stores are easy to start, because Gaza is known for its high population.

Anas took a loan from FATEN to purchase goods for his store, which will increase sales and enable him expand his business. Anas tells us that his store is in a high population area of Deir A.Balah\ Gaza Strip with few stores to provide its inhabitants with their needs.

Anas is an employee of the government and, like everywhere else, his government salary doesn't cover his life expenses.

loans.use: Purchase Goods

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is a 30-year-old man who lives in Ramallah, Palestine. He is married and has one daughter. He owns a store where he sells aluminum. He started his business in 2008. He needs a loan of $3000 to buy the equipment he needs to be able to develop his store and to improve his services.

loans.use: To develop his shop

loans.name: God Wonderers Group

texts.en:
Marget D. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Wonderers. She is 58 years old and married, and has ten children ranging in age from 27 to 47 years old. She also has ten siblings as well as many grandchildren.

Marget owns a dry fish business in the Thinker Village market. She has had this business for over ten years. She attracts customers by selling quality goods in a friendly manner. 

Marget plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry fish and goods for her business. She hopes that one day she will be so successful that she’s able to have a bigger dry fish business. She wants to be able to take care of her grandchildren’s schooling and health.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Marget is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more dry fish

loans.name: Yinka

texts.en:
Yinka is a tailor who makes lovely Nigerian and western designs for her customers. She also sells cooking oil at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. 

Yinka is 32 years old and married to a carpenter. They have three lovely children who are in a private primary school. Her youngest child is 3 years old. She is happy because her children are excelling in their school work. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders and promises to repay her Kiva loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Akram

texts.en: Akram is a 41-year-old man who lives in Gaza, Palestine. He is married and he supports his wife and five children. Two of his children are students. He has owned a store that manufactures cleaning products since 2008. Akram needs a loan of $3000 to buy the needed raw materials. What makes this project special is the experience needed to be able to manufacture these products. Akram hopes that his business will grow larger and that he will be able to send his children to college.

loans.use: Buy material to enhance his cleaning supplies production business

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 48 years old and married. He has with five children, ages 26, 25, 23, 20, and 12. Four of the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer in the Kitale Region of Western Kenya. He's been farming for 15 years and sells eggs and poultry at the local market. He says that the main challenge to his business is the spread of disease among his stock of chickens, which can cause a lot of losses.

William has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 46800 to purchase a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him provide for his family's basic needs. In the future, he would like to be a major supplier of his produce in his hometown market and beyond.

William also added that he is thankful for Juhudi Kilimo's loan because he is now economically empowered.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Without Money Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Without Money group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni City, in Northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are borrowing from SMT/Kiva.

Memuna C. is the leader of the group. Memuna was born in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is fifty-five years old. She is married and has 4 children. Memuna’s husband is a farmer and her children attend schools. Two of her children are in secondary school and 2 are in primary school. Memuna sell dishes, rubber bowls, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, etc. She has been running this business for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in wholesale quantities.

loans.use: Buy dishes, rubber bowls, palm-oil, rice etc. in wholesale quantities to expand her business

loans.name: Vannurn's Group

texts.en:
The loan group, which consists of five people, is located in Prasat Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Vannurn H. was selected by the members to be the group leader. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Vannurn H. is 49 years old. She sells rice in front of a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Seym Touch, is a driver who earns a small salary. To improve their family's living conditions, Mrs. Vannurn H. wants to expand her business, but she does not have enough money. Thus, she decided to apply for a loan to buy more cooking rice to sell. She is the mother of two children. One of her children is employed in garment factory and the other attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more cooking rice to sell

loans.name: Sothun's Group

texts.en:
The loan group, which consists of four people, is located in Anlong Romiet Khang Tbou Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Sothun L. was selected by the members to be the group leader. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Sothun L. is a grocer in local village and her husband, Mr. Vudoeng Roeun, is a construction worker. Although this family tries to work hard in their careers, they earn less money than they need. So, to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Sothun L. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to re-sell so she can expand her business. This couple has two children who are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to re-sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 56 years old. She is divorced and has four children, ages 33, 29, 23 and 21. She is a farmer in the Nkubu Area in the Eastern Province of Kenya. She's been farming for 30 years. She sells milk through the Kenya Cooperative Creameries and cultivates tea as a cash crop. She says that the main challenge to her business is expensive dairy feed.

Josephine has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 47,700 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her pay the education fees for her family in the future. She also plans to expand her dairy farming business and acquire more land.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more used shoes

loans.name: Tas-Wop N'sorbeh Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Tas-wop N’Sorbeh Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni City in Northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. Consequently, they will make more sales and better profits. As their profit-to-sales-margin increases, they will be in a better position to support themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Isatu K.. Isatu was born in a place called Sanda in Northern Sierra Leone. She is 42 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her children attend school – 2 are in primary school and 2 are in secondary school. Isatu has been a businesswoman for 3 years. She sells "gara lappers" (locally dyed clothes, sometimes with fabricated designs), fish, rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) etc. With this loan, Isatu will improve her business by buying the above mentioned items in wholesale quantities to add to her business. 

(Attached to the left of the group photo is a photo of group member who was not present for a group snapshot)

loans.use: Buy white cottons, fish, rice, and palm-oil in wholesale quantities to expand her business

loans.name: Fight For Progress Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Fight For Progress Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,200,000.00 each to enable them add more goods into their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and in their academic pursuits. 

Fatmata K. is the leader of this group. She is 37 years old and was born in Makeni. Fatmata is married to a businessman and they have 4 children. One of her children is in college, 2 are in secondary school and 1 is in primary school. Fatamta has been a businesswoman for 2 years. She sells rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) oranges, etc. Fatmata will use this loan to expand her business by buying the above goods in wholesale quantities to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: Buy palm-oil, rice, and oranges in wholesale quantities

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara is 39 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. Her eldest child is 17 years old. Her children are doing well in their school work. She sells text books to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more text books to sell. She is, indeed, grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more text books to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old single man. He lives in Ramallah, Palestine. Ahmad has owned a bakery since 2002. He supports his mother and younger brothers and sisters. 

Ahmad needs a loan of $3000 to buy the essential equipment to improve his bakery. Ahmad’s bakery is special because he uses wood to cook the baked goods. It would be nice to see this successful business grow even larger.

loans.use: Buy equipment to improve his bakery

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhom P. (pictured here), age 49, and his wife, Mrs. Sam-un Nao, age 32, have been married since 2001. They have two children, a son who attends school and one young daughter. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sokhom has been a silk weaver since he was sixteen years old. He sells his finished products to the middleman in the village who then, in turn, sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Mrs. Sam-un has been selling groceries for one year. 

Sokhom does not have enough capital to purchase silk materials for his weaving business, so he is requesting his first loan of $200 to provide capital for his business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for his weaving business.

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en: Ifeoma is a widow with 3 children. Life as a widow has not been easy for her because she cares for her children alone. She sells mouth-watering Nigerian foods to her customers, who are usually residents and friends. She hopes to own a big restaurant in the future. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more food to cook and sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food to cook and sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen M. M. is forty-five years old. He is married and his wife is a shopkeeper. They have two children whom they hope to educate to university level. 

His business is located at Kitengela on the outskirts of Nairobi. It is situated behind a hotel and it is well known by the name Kitengela Steel Works. He does welding on window panes, doors and gates and sells them to constructors in the nearby industries and to the local people. He has been in this business for two years and he says that his major challenges are the fluctuating prices of materials and lack of funds to expand his business. 

He is using his loan to buy more welding materials. In the future, he hopes to buy a plot of land and build rental houses. He also sees himself employing more people, in addition to the four he has, and having his own "go down" to be able to reach as many customers as possible. He is a very hardworking, honest and social person.

loans.use: Windows, doors and gates

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
Mr. Rithy Y., 48, and his wife, Mrs. Touch San, 38, have been married since 1985. They have two children. All of them are in school. The family lives suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Rithy has been driving taxi for ten years. He drives passengers everywhere around Phnom Penh, and sometimes to the beach town of Sihanoukville and Kosh Kong. His wife stays at home. 

Under his raised house is open air space, an area that partially sheltered but still is exposed to the elements. It’s difficult for him to find a proper place to keep his taxi. So, Rithy is requesting his first loan of $500 to build a concrete walls to make a place to keep his taxi.

loans.use: To build a storage room to keep his taxi.

loans.name: Olumide

texts.en:
Olumide is 32 years old and married with a child. Her child is 14 years old and he attends school.

She sells rechargeable phones and accessories at retail prices to her customers to earn a living. She sells for long hours to enable her support her husband. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more rechargeable phones and accessories to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phones and accessories to sell

loans.name: Molayo

texts.en: Molayo makes a living selling frozen fish, a business she very much enjoys being in. She sells her fish to customers in Lagos state, Nigeria, and hopes to expand her business in the future. She is married, has two children, and is very pleased because they are doing extremely well in school. Molayo says that her children give her peace, courage and hope for the future. She has applied for a loan of NGN 120,000 to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She hopes to live a long and peaceful life, and extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen fish to sell

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen N. was born in 1971 in Kapan and was able to go to school for several years before he began to work. He lives with his parents, wife and two sons, both of whom are in school. Armen's father is retired, and he supports the family by working as a wood-cutter and a farmer. In his work, he gets help from his parents and wife, all of whom help him produce meat and milk. They begin work at 6 a.m. and continue until 9 p.m. Armen has applied for a loan to buy young pigs, calves and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy pigs, calves and fodder

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena makes a living selling groceries, foodstuffs and cosmetics. Her goal is to meet the basic needs of her family members, and she has requested a loan for NGN 80,000 to buy more groceries, foodstuffs and cosmetics to sell. Her goal in the future is to own a world-class store. She is married and has six children, all of whom go to school. She hopes to be able to support them through graduation, and extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support in making this possible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries, foodstuffs and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Best Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs has chosen the name of the Best Group. They are all small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs have tried to secure from SMT/Kiva, and with this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

Isatu K. leads this group. She was born in Kono, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is 35 years old, married and has five children. Two of her children are in secondary school and three are in primary school. For the last four years, she has made a living selling baby clothes. She will use her portion of this loan to  buy more baby clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy baby clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Zinabu

texts.en: Zinabu I. is married, has two children and has received a junior high school education. For the last several years, she has made a living cooking and selling rice and beans at Elmina. Her husband makes a living as a poultry farmer.  Zinabu uses her income to help her husband pay school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to buy more beans, rice, oil and other items to sell. With the new profits made possible by this loan, Zinabu plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more beans, rice, oil and other ingredients to sell

loans.name: Bivamuntuuyo Group, Mukono

texts.en:
M. Jackie is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a hard working and married lady with two children all in primary section. Jackie is into the business of making bricks and selling clothes from Seeta for 7 years from which she is able to make 200,000 Ugandan shillings as profits a month.

She ensures that she has good quality products and she hopes to expand her businesses and have more clothes plus being able to make as many bricks as possible as well as having a good health and educating her children to the last level.

Jackie needs a loan to buy more clothes for resale and to use as working capital for her brickmaking business.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for resale and to get working capital her brick laying business.

loans.name: Abiodu

texts.en:
Abiodu is a 30 year-old single mother with a two year-old child. She sells drinks and groceries to make a living. She is very friendly and hard working. She hopes to expand her business by having a supermarket in the future. She will use this loan to buy more soft drinks and groceries to sell.

Abiodu is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organisation) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries for resale

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en:
Theresah A. sells oil, onions, tomatoes and other food supplies at Elmina. She is married and has two children and received no formal education. Her husband is a reporter for a local FM station.

Theresah has been selling oil, onions and tomatoes for some time now. She supports her husband with paying school fees and family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more red oil, cooking oil, tomatoes, and other food supplies for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to support her husband building their house.

loans.use: To buy more red oil, cooking oil, tomatoes and other food supplies for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 33 years old and married with three children. Her youngest child is three years old. Her husband is a business man and he also supports the home. She sells foodstufs to make a living in Nigeria. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is very positive about utilizing this loan to ensure that it improves her business and extends to her family.

Rose has a good relationship with LAPO. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organisation) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Mureed

texts.en: Mureed is a 30 year-old married man who lives in Gaza. He supports his wife and five young children. Since 2006, he has owned a bookstore where he also sell kids' supplies. He needs a loan of $2000 to buy more books and toys to display in his bookstore. Mureed is a successful and motivated man who is aiming to develop his business, and he is grateful for all the help he can get.

loans.use: To buy more stock of supplies for his bookstore.

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine G. is 28 years old and she has school education. She lives in Vanadzor with her mother, son and husband. Her mother is jobless and her son is a schoolboy.

Heghine and her husband, Tigran, manage their own butcher’s shop, which they run in their own shop. Heghine has a verbal agreement with villagers about buying meat. Now she needs an 800,000 AMD loan to buy meat from villagers to increase the volume of her business.

loans.use: To buy more meat for her butcher's shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk for resale

loans.name: Tigo Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Tigo group. They are small scale businesspeople in the northern City of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and a better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve, they can at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills in case any of them fall sick.

Isatu K. is the leader of this group. Isatu was born in Makeni. She is 36 years of age and married to a farmer. They have four children: two in secondary school and two in primary school. For ten years now, Isatu has sold foofoo (food made out of cassava roots). With her share of this loan, she will buy a large amount of foofoo to sell.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of foofoo to sell.

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en:
Modupe loves sarongs and tailoring and that is why she is in the business. She makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers and she also sells sarongs at retail prices to her customers.

Modupe hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

Modupe is married with four children, her eldest child being 22 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad is a 27 year-old man who lives in Gaza, Palestine. He is single and he lives with his family of eight. He supports his parents and members of the family. He has owned a mobile booth in which he sells clothes since 2008. He needs a loan of $2000 to increase the stock in his booth. He aims to own a fixed store in which he could sell clothes.

loans.use: To buy more wholesale clothes to sell in his booth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase soy beans in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fresh eggs in bulk

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 22 year-old young man who lives in Gaza, Palestine. He has owned a shop that sells cell phones and electronics since 2005. He has no family to support him, and he needs a loan of $3000 to buy more stock of electronics and cell phones to develop his project. Mohammed is ambitious, motivated, and honest and would be very pleased if he gets this needed help.

loans.use: To buy stock and evolve his business.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Ngozi sells cooking oil at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. Cooking oil is used in the preparation of Nigerian foods and soup and the demand for cooking oil is high in Nigeria.

Ngozi hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She is married without children. She is 41 years old and hopes to have children some day. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to excel in her business and family life. She is thankful in anticipation of your support.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pharmaceutical drugs for resale

loans.name: Believing God Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Believing God group. They are small scale entrepreneurs in Makeni City, who want a loan of SLL 2,500,000 to enable them to improve their businesses. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs will be accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, sales will thus improve, and so will be their sales-to-profit-margin. With a larger profit at their disposal, they will be able to better look after themselves and children.

The leader of this group is Yeabu K., who was born in a place call Robuya about 45 years ago. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending school. Two are in secondary school and two in primary school. Yeabu sells ground-nuts (peanuts) for 15 years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of ground-nuts and sell them retail.

loans.use: Buy bags of ground-nuts

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en: Yahya is a 31-year-old man who lives in Gaza. He is married with five children. He has owned a supermarket since 2005. He needs a loan of $2,500 to buy the equipment and groceries. This loan will help increase his family's income. Yahya is an honest, motivated man who is seeking help to continue his successful business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fresh fish and spices in bulk

loans.name: Mahran

texts.en: Mahran is a 30-year-old man who lives in Ramallah. He is married and supports his wife and young children. He has owned a successful store where he sells shoes since 2001. He needs a loan of $2,500 to increase the stock in his store. This business is special because it occurs in the center of Ramallah city. Mahran is a hard working, motivated man who is seeking help to continue working on his successful business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in bulk for resale

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en: Mahdi is a 21-year-old young man who lives in Ramallah, Palestine. He is single. He lives with his family, which consists of seven members. He and his brother are supporting the family. He owns a supermarket where he sells groceries. He needs a loan of $3,000 to increase the stock in his store. Mahdi is a motivated young man who is willing to expand and improve his business

loans.use: To buy more stock for his shop

loans.name: Kiddawalime Group, Mukono

texts.en:
K. Joyce is 52 years old and a widow with 7 children, who also takes care of 5 orphans. Joyce has had businesses managing a bar as well as having rentals in Bulindo for 4 years, and she is happy that she is able to make 50,000/= as profits a week.

Joyce says that although she has inadequate capital, she ensures that she takes care of her customers, hence prospering. Her goal is to ensure that she accesses school fees for her children and with the loan, she hopes to expand her businesses by buying more crates of beers, wine, and sodas for sale.

loans.use: Buying more beers, wine, and sodas for resale

loans.name: Devine Grace Group, Mukono

texts.en:
M. Jane is 47 years old and married with 6 children, aged 21 – 14 years, all in school; she also takes care of 3 orphans. Jane is a business lady with a poultry business in Kireku for the past 2 years, as well as dealing in the sale of flowers from the same area. She says that although her business is mostly affected by the bad debtors, she is able to make 150,000/= as profits a week and this is basically due to the quality of her chickens and the eggs that she sells.

Jane hopes to expand her gardens so that she can have more flowers to sell as well as building her own house in the near future. She needs a loan to be able to boost her flower garden business as well as buying more feed for her poultry farm.

loans.use: Buying more chicken feed and boosting her flower garden business with more fertilizer

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna N. est âgée de 52 ans, est mariée et mère de 11 enfants dont 6 filles. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a été 4 fois de suite bénéficiaire de prêts. Son activité princiale est l'élevage de poulets et par ailleurs elle est détentrice du boutique où elle vend des produits divers tels que du riz, du sucre, du lait des effets de toilette etc. Son objectif est la création de l'emploi pour l'entretien de son poulailler en même temps renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Sokhna N., 52, is married and the mother of 11 children, among them 6 daughters. She has been a member of her Village Bank for two years, and she has received four consecutive loans. Her main business is poultry-raising, but she also has a small store where she sells various items such as rice, sugar, milk, toiletries, etc. Her goal is to be able to hire someone to oversee her poultry-raising business and at the same time, add to her savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: extend her little business raising poultry

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou K. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a été 4 fois de suite bénéficiaire de prêt. Elle fait un petit commerce de produits halieutiques (huitre sèches, poissons séchés et fumés etc.) Elle cherche à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou KENE, 53, is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of her Village Bank for two years and has received four consecutive loans. She has a little business selling seafood products (dried oysters, dried fish, smoked fish, etc.) She wishes to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital

loans.name: Namwezi Development Group, Mukono

texts.en: N. Teopista is 35 years old and married with 6 children aged 20 – 4 years, all in school; she also takes care of her parents. Teopista has had a cosmetics shop in Kiwango – Namwezi for 1 year although her business is mostly affected by seasonal changes. From her shop, she is able to make 60,000/= as profits every week, and this has helped her to grow in addition to the loan. She hopes to expand her shop further as well as educating all her children to the university level. Teopista needs a loan to be able to restock her shop with more cosmetics so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: Buying more weaves, chemicals, and body lotions for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Gaye

texts.fr: Gaye B. est âgée de 46 ans est elle mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a été 4 fois bénéficiaire de prêt. Elle développe un petit commerce de bijoux, de tissus et de jus naturels faits à partir de produits locaux. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gaye B., 46, is married and the mother of 8 children. She has been a member of her Village Bank for two years and has received 4 loans. She is working at expanding her little business selling costume jewelry, cloth, and natural drinks made from local products. She is helping to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital

loans.name: Alinyikira Kazinga Group, Mukono

texts.en:
B. Teo is 46 years old and a single mother of eight children, who also takes care of one sibling. Teo has a retail shop in Kazinga that she has had for 4 years, plus having another business of brick laying. From her businesses, she is able to make 170,000/= as profits every week, and these help her in taking care of her family, mostly the children, and recapitalizing her businesses. She hopes to expand further in business and dreams of being able to pay her children’s school fees with much ease.

Teo is a hard-working, friendly, and determined lady and would like to buy more goods for her shop as well as securing more land for making bricks and completing payments for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop and securing more land for making bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Youmou

texts.fr: Youmou S. est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de SANTHIABA-SUD depuis 2 ans et a eu 4 expériences avec le crédit. Elle développe un petit commerce de tissus et de denrées alimentaires tel que du riz, du sucre et de l'huile végétale. Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa famille et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Youmou S. is a 60 year old woman, she is married with 2 children. She has been a member of the "Banc villageois" of SANTHIABA-SOUTH for the past 2 years and has had 4 loans. She is building up a small business selling fabrics and food staples such as rice, sugar and vegetable oil. Her goal is to support her family and increase her savings.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her capital investment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase assorted fish in bulk

loans.name: Panama Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Prossy is 38 years old and married with 6 children, aged 20 – 2 years, and she also takes care of her parents. Prossy has a retail shop in Kireku that has been in operation for 7 years from which she is able to make 60,000/= as profits a week. Prossy says that her business is mostly affected by limited capital and inadequate space, and she continues to say that she is making it in business because of the availability of good customer care and good quality products.

Her goal is to ensure an increase in the stock of her shop as well as constructing her own house. Prossy needs a loan to be able to restock her retail shop with more goods. She is a hard-working and devoted lady.

loans.use: Buying more goods for her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty es una joven madre de un niño de 12 años, tiene 30 años y está muy dedicada a su negocio. Por el momento vive con su pareja e hijo en la casa de su madre.

Desde hace 7 años tiene una bodega, la cual implementó en su actual vivienda. Todas las mañanas, a partir de las 6 Betty limpia y ordena los productos de su tienda, además de preparar los condimentos que vende molidos. Al comienzo no le gustaba moler las especias porque se maltrataban sus manos y le parecía muy difícil, pero como le es bastante rentable, ya se acostumbró a esa labor. Betty tiene el concepto de que “en su bodega no deba faltar nada y debe estar muy limpia”, por ello se esmera todo el tiempo para que su tienda tenga un buen aspecto, pues así atrajo la atención de sus vecinos. Generalmente trabaja sola, ya que su esposo se dedica al transporte en motocarro. 
Para este año, ambos se han propuesto ahorrar dinero para comprar un terreno donde puedan construir su casa propia para el bienestar de su hijo.

Este es la tercera vez que tiene crédito con MFP y sabe que si es responsable seguirá contando con posteriores préstamos que le permitirán crecer en su negocio y hacer realidad su sueño. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en el incremento de productos para su bodega, para que de ese modo capte mayor clientela y sus ganancias aumenten.
texts.en:
Betty is the young mother of a 12 year old. She is 30, and she is very devoted to her business. For the moment she lives with her life partner and son in her mother’s house. She has had a convenience store for seven years. She set it up in her current house. Betty cleans and arranges the products in her store starting at six in the morning. She also prepares the condiments that she sells ground. When she started she did not like to grind the spices because it hurt her hands and it seemed very difficult. But, as it is profitable, she is now accustomed to the work. Betty has the motto, “My store needs to have everything and needs to be very clean”. That is why she works so hard all of the time for her store to look good. This attracts the neighbors’ attention. She generally works alone because her husband works in transportation with his “motocarro” (three wheeled motor vehicle). This year both of them have proposed saving money to buy a piece of land where they can build their own house for their son’s well-being. This is the third time that she has had a loan with MFP. She knows that if she is responsible she will continue to get loans, which will allow her business to grow and make her dream come true. The money she is now requesting is to get more products for her convenience store. That way she will get more customers and her income will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia A. is married and has five dependents. She has received a junior high school  education.  She sells fish and octopus at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. Her husband is a security man.  Cynthia uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees, utility bills and other family expenses.  She will use the loan that she has requested to buy more fish and octopuses for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cynthia plans to save so she can further educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish and octopuses for resale

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer D. 61 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y 4 D. sus 6 hijos, quienes viven en su casa, pero ya son mayores e independientes.

Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado al comercio y ha vendido infinidad D. cosas. Esta actividad le fascina porque conversa muchísimo con la gente, mientras obtiene ganancias económicas. 
A inicios preparaba algunos postres y los vendía por porciones; D. ese modo, poco a poco, fue avanzando y con la ayuda D. su esposo lograron obtener y construir su casa, donD. hoy alquilan un espacio como local comercial. Pero Blanca no ha dejado D. vender sus dulces ambulatoriamente, recorre todas las calles, especialmente donD. hay más jóvenes, quienes son sus mayores consumidores. A su vez, estar ocupada es lo que más le agrada, ya que D. ese modo obtiene ganancias y no se estresa. 
Sus planes a futuro son D. terminar D. construir tres cuartos más en su casa, para alquilarlos y cubrir sus necesidades en su vejez.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, donD. ratifica su compromiso D. seguir trabajando responsablemente, ya que este préstamo es D. mucha ayuda para la marcha y el crecimiento D. su negocio. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. materiales D. construcción para su casa y golosinas para seguir trabajando como comerciante ambulante.
texts.en:
Blanca is 61 years old and lives with her husband and four of her six children, who live at home but are adults on their own. All her life she has been in business and has sold many different things. She really enjoys her work because it allows her to have conversations with many people while bringing her an income. She started out making and selling various desserts. She moved forward little by little, and together with her husband, they were able to build their home, which includes a small retail space that she rents out. Blanca has not stopped selling her treats on foot. She walks all of the streets, especially those where there are more young people, who are her biggest customers. Being busy what she likes to do the most, especially since this way she is able to earn an income without stress. Her plan is to build three more rooms onto her home so she can rent them out and be able to cover her needs in her old age. This will be her third loan through MFP, and she reiterates that she will continue to work responsibly and that this loan will be very helpful for the advancement of her business. She will use this loan to buy building supplies for her house and also candy and treats that she can continue to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials and candy for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food ingredients like maize, fish, and spices

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer que irradia mucha alegría, a sus 40 años está muy dedicada en la atención de su esposo y sus hijos de 20 y 10 años, con quienes vive en su casa propia.

Su buen carácter le permite ganar muchos amigos, por lo que decidió sacarle provecho a ello, iniciando un negocio de venta de ropa, lo cual le resultó muy bien. Desde entonces, ya lleva 8 años con esta actividad y siempre se la ve con su bolso lleno de ropa, pues siempre encuentra el momento para ofrecer sus prendas. Generalmente vende al crédito, prefiere trabajar con esta modalidad porque gana mucho más, aunque inicialmente perdió parte de su capital por la falta de pago, pero gracias al apoyo de su esposo y al pasar de los años aprendió a seleccionar a sus clientes, lo que ha logrado que su negocio sea rentable. 
Cristina está muy contenta con lo que hace, porque tiene clientes fijos y muy puntuales, por ello para el futuro piensa instalar una tienda de ropa en su misma vivienda, pero sin dejar su actual modo de trabajar.

Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP y promete, una vez más, ser puntual en sus pagos. Asimismo, manifiesta trabajar en plena armonía con su grupo, ya que los integrantes son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita incrementará su capital comprando prendas exclusivas para la estación de verano.
texts.en:
Cristina is a woman who radiates a lot of happiness. Age 40, she is very dedicated to the care of her husband and her children, age 20 and 10 years, with whom she lives in their own house. , Her good character wins her many friends which she decided to build upon, starting a clothes sale business, which has gone very well. She has operated this business for 8 years. She is always seen with her full bag of clothes and therefore she always finds a moment to offer her garments. Generally she sells on credit. She prefers to work in this manner because she earns a lot more, although initially she lost part of her capital from lack of payment. But, thanks to the support of her husband and from experience, she learned to select her clients and make her business profitable. Cristina is very pleased with what she does, because she now has very responsible and regular clients. Because of this, she would like to setup a clothing store in her home in the future, but without abandoning her current way of working. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP and she promises, once more, to be punctual in her payments.
