Likewise, she plans to work in full harmony with her group, since the members are responsible and very hard-working people. With the money that she requests this time, she will increase her working capital to buy summer garments.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer clothing for resale.

loans.name: Kito Development Group, Mukono

texts.en: N. Passy is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She is a strong lady who has had a tailoring business for 4 years. She is able to make 50,000 UGX a week in profits and would like this to increase. She hopes to attract new customers to her business by including the sale of clothes and clothing materials. She needs a loan to help buy more clothes for sewing as well as to finish paying her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her tailoring business

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua T. is single and has three children. She has received no formal education.  She sells smoked fish at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. Efua uses her income to pay school fees and bills.  She will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to process (smoke) for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to process (smoke) for resale

loans.name: Katia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Katia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Trigales.
Katia es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Katia vende cosméticos por catálogos, de 3 distintas líneas, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayoría de las ventas son al crédito.
Katia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos que están en oferta.
Katia sueña con educar a sus hijos y mejorar como persona.
texts.en:
Katia is an associate of the Los Trigales (wheat fields) Communal Bank. Katia lives in a shared home. She is 30 years old and has 3 children. Katia sells cosmetics from e different lines of catalogues, products that she offers friends and family. The majority of her sales are on credit. Katia needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of products on promotion. Katia dreams of educating her children and improving as a person.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics currently on promotion for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Liberadas 1 Group

texts.en:
Tanya is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Liberadas (Liberated Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizzos, an industrial town north of the capital where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their six children.

Tanya is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling bed covers and pillows by purchasing more merchandise. She also plans to purchase an oven with which to make sandwiches to sell. She will use the profits to save for her children's education. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to purchse bed covers, pillows and a stove

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es socio del Banco Comunal Los Trigales.
Mario es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Mario tiene una mototaxi con la cual realiza transporte publico en la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Mario tiene un grupo musical llamado Los Imbatibles.
Mario necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de otra mototaxi.
Los sueños de Mario son educar a sus hijos y tener una empresa de motos.
texts.en:
Mario is a member of the Communal Bank “Trigales” (Wheat Fields). He is 37 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Mario has a motorcycle taxi that he makes available for public transport in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, he has a musical group called “Los Imbatibles” (The Unbeatables).

Mario needs a loan of 1500 soles to be used a partial payment of another motorcycle taxi. His dreams include educating his children and owning a motorcycle business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partial payment for another motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Fatim

texts.fr: Fatim S. est âgée de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a une ancienneté de 2 ans dans le Banc Villageois de SANTHIABA-SUD et y a reçu successivement 4 prêts qu'elle a toujours régulièrement remboursés. Elle développe diverses activités, d'une part elle fait de l'élevage de mouton et de volaille, d'autre part elle développe un petit commerce dans une boutique où elle vend divers produits tels que du riz, de l'huile végétale, du sucre etc. Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatim S. is 55 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. She has a two year history with Banc Villageois of South Santhiaba, having received four consecutive loans from them which she always repaid on time. She is developing different types of work, from raising sheep and poultry to building a small business in a shop where she sells various products such as rice, vegetable oil, sugar, etc. Her goal is to increase her capital and to contribute to taking care of the family.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase investment capital

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora tiene 62 años, es una mujer muy hábil como madre y esposa y gracias a su perseverancia en el trabajo logró tener el dinero para construir su casa, donde ahora vive con su familia.

Su negocio es la venta de productos de belleza de una marca muy reconocida, esto le permite tener buena demanda. Anteriormente vendía salchipapas (salchichas y papas fritas) en la puerta de su casa, pero no le resultó rentable. Por ello dio un giro a su actividad, inclinándose por la venta de cosméticos, lo cual le es menos estresante, pues menciona que sólo debe organizarse muy bien para lograr visitar a la mayor cantidad de personas al día.
Actualmente está muy contenta con la cantidad de productos que tiene vendidos, eso le avizora que tendrá muy buenas ganancias con las que podrá hacer mayores pedidos.

Ella es una de las fundadoras de su banco comunal, menciona que años atrás eran un grupo más numeroso, pero fueron saliendo por incumplimiento de pago. En su caso, fue diferente porque siempre demostró responsabilidad porque siente gratitud por la oportunidad brindada. El dinero que esta vez solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más productos de belleza, pues desea ganar los premios que da la empresa por mayor cantidad de pedidos. Estos productos son en su mayoría de uso doméstico, y Flora piensa que podría venderlos y obtener ganancias extras.
texts.en:
Flora is 62 years old and a very capable woman in her roles as wife and mother. Thanks to her perseverance in her work, she was able to earn enough money to build the house where she now lives with her family.

Flora sells a well-known brand of cosmetics that is in high demand. Previously she sold “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes) on the doorstep of her house, but the results were not profitable. In order to give a boost to her business activities, she started relying on the sale of cosmetics because less stress is involved. It only requires that one must be well-organized in order to visit with numerous people each day. At the moment, she is very happy with the amount of products she has sold. She envisions earning good profits, which will help her fulfill more orders.

Flora is one of the founders of her Communal Bank. Years ago, the group was much larger but there were several members who had to leave because they were not able to complete their payments. In her case, Flora was different because she always demonstrated responsibility and expressed gratitude for the opportunities provided to her. The money she is requesting this time will be used to buy more beauty products, since she hopes to win the prize for the salesperson that gets the most orders. Since these products are mostly for home use, Flora believes she can sell them and earn extra profit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of beauty products

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi es socia del Banco Comunal Los Trigales.
Deysi es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Deysi se dedica a la venta de queques que ofrece a tiendas, cafetines en la ciudad, además Deysi tiene un pequeño bar en un local alquilado.
Daysi necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y cerveza.
Los sueños de Deysi son trabajar para sus hijos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Deysi is a member of the Communal Bank “Trigales” (Wheat Fields). She is 26 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Deysi sells cupcakes to shops and cafes in the city. In addition, she operates a small bar at a rented location.

Deysi needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase sodas and beer. Her dreams include working to support her children and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & beer

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier es socia del Banco Comunal Los Trigales.
Javier es soltero, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Javier tiene equipos de sonido que alquila para diferentes eventos, además Javier tiene un grupo musical llamado Son Caribe.
Javier necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mas equipos.
Los sueños de Javier son ampliar su negocio, tener mas equipos.
texts.en:
Javier is a member of the Communal Bank “Trigales” (Wheat Fields). He is 39 years old, single, and has two children. Javier has sound equipment that he rents out for different events. In addition, he has a musical group called “Son Caribe” (Caribbean Sound).

Javier needs a loan of 1500 soles to invest in more equipment. His dreams include expanding his business and having more equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional sound equipment

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith es una mujer de buen carácter, tiene 64 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, en su cómoda casa (propia) de material noble y prime piso. 

Lo que más le gusta hacer a Judith es tejer y lo hace muy bien, todos los días de la semana, sobre todo por las tardes, se sienta a tejer chompas, ya sea a palitos o a crochet. 
Con un sin número de coloridos hilos, poco a poco, va dándole forma a diferente modelos y tamaños de prendas, las cuales son muy solicitadas por sus clientes.
En este negocio lleva aproximadamente 10 años, y ya cuenta con dos ayudantes tejedoras con quienes trabaja para cumplir con sus pedidos.
Judith está muy contenta con lo que hace, jamás imaginó que el arte que su madre le enseñó en hoy sea su soporte económico. 
Su deseo a futuro es construir varios cuartos en su casa para posteriormente rentarlos y de ese modo generarse ingresos sin demasiado esfuerzo.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y renueva compromiso de seguir siendo muy responsable en sus pagos, ya que le gustaría seguir contando con posteriores créditos. Asimismo  dice sentirse muy bien con sus compañeras de grupo, a quienes les tiene mucho aprecio. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de hilos de diversas variedades, para tener en stock y tenga la seguridad de poder crear cualquier prenda.
texts.en:
Judith is a woman of good character. She is 64 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a comfortable one-story home that they own and is made of solid materials.

What Judith enjoys most is knitting and she does it very well. She engages in this activity every day of the week, especially in the evenings. Her creations are mainly sweaters made using knitting needles or by crochet. Using an endless number of colorful yarns, Judith gives shape to different styles and sizes of garments. Her products are highly sought after by her customers. She has been in this business for approximately ten years and she has two assistants who help with completing her orders.

Judith is very happy with what she does. She never imagined that the skill that her mother taught her would one day help provide financial support. Her wish for the future is to build various rooms to her house that can be rented. This will help generate income with little effort.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Judith has renewed her commitment to continue being responsible with her payments because she would like to receive subsequent loans. In addition, she gets along well with the other members of her Communal Bank, who have much appreciation for her. Judith will use the money to purchase yarns of different varieties so that she will have it on stock for making any type of garment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase yarn

loans.name: Ruly Mary

texts.es:
Ruly es socia del Banco Comunal Los Trigales.
Ruly es conviviente, tiene 33 años, 2 hijos y esta esperando a su tercer hijo, Ruly se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos de manera artesanal en la comunidad de Compañía, sus productos lo vende en el mismo lugar y también los lleva a las obras. Además Ruly vende comida.
Ruly necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y ladrillos crudos para quemar.
Los sueños de Ruly son ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ruly is an associate of the Los Trigales (wheat fields) Communal Bank. Ruly lives in a shared home. She is 33 years old, has children and is expecting her third child. Ruly is dedicated to the production of bricks by hand in the community of Compañía. She sells her products from her workplace and also carries them to worksites. Ruly also sells food. Ruly needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and raw bricks to fire. Ruly hopes to expand her business and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and raw bricks to be fired.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort B. sells materials and clothes at Elmina.  She has received a junior high school education.  She is single and has three children, and is responsible for paying her children’s school fees and bills. Comfort has been selling materials and clothes for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy more material to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more material to sell

loans.name: Geannice Melissa

texts.es:
Melisa es socia del Banco Comunal Los Trigales.
Melisa es conviviente y tiene 23 años, Melisa tiene un restaurante llamado OKEY, que esta ubicado en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días y cuenta con la ayuda de 2 personas,  además Melisa es cantante folklórica.
Melisa necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la grabación de su disco.
Los sueños de Melisa es crecer como artista y ampliar su negocio con una sucursal.
texts.en:
Melisa is an associate of the Los Trigales (wheat fields) Communal Bank. Melisa lives in a shared home and is 23 years old. Melisa has a restaurant called OKEY, that is located in a rented building. She runs the restaurant every day and relies on the aid of 2 people. In addition, Melisa is a folk singer. Melisa needs a loan of 2500 soles, money that will be invested in making a recording of her music. The dreams of Melisa are to grow as an artist and to expand her business with a branch location.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make a recording of her music

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 36 años, está casada y es madre de un pequeño hijo, quien es su mayor motivación. Gracias al trabajo de su esposo y al de ella, lograron reunir el dinero necesario para tener su casa propia, donde hoy habitan.

Pero actualmente, Luisa está pasando malos momentos debido al abandono de su esposo y quizás eso haya provocado la rebeldía de su hijo. A pesar de ello, sabe que tiene afrontar esta situación con mucha paciencia y sapiencia, siendo ahora ella, el único pilar del hogar.
Desde hace 16 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, con lo que logra solventar los estudios de su hijo, está conciente que ahora debe trabajará más, por ello la mayor parte de su tiempo lo está empleando en su negocio. Cuando ofrece sus productos, siempre tiene una sonrisa para cada cliente y aprovechando su habilidad persuasiva siempre logra buenas ventas.
Para el futuro, Luisa desea terminar de arreglar la infraestructura de su casa y comprar vitrinas donde pueda exhibir sus productos, pues está segura que el comercio es la actividad que quiere seguir realizando.

Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP y promete seguir siendo responsable en sus pagos. En su banco comunal se siente muy cómoda, ya que la han apoyado muchísimo en las circunstancias que le tocó vivir, por lo que está muy agradecida con sus compañeras. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido en el incremento de sus productos de belleza, para que de ese modo siga trabajando en lo que más le gusta.
texts.en:
Luisa is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of a small son, who is her great motivation. Thanks to the work of her husband and herself, they managed to earn the money necessary to have their own house, where they live today. But at present, Luisa is having a bad time, due to the abandonment of her husband and perhaps that has caused the defiance of her son. In spite of this, she knows that she has to confront this situation with a lot of patience and knowledge, since she is now the only pillar of the home. For 16 years she has been dedicated to cosmetic sales, with which she manages to pay for the studies of her son. She is aware that she will now have to work more. Because of this most of her time is spent in her business. When she offers her products, she always has a smile for each client and takes advantage of her persuasive ability to achieve good sales. For the future, Luisa desires to finish fixing the infrastructure of her house and to buy showcases where she can exhibit her products. She is sure that this business is the activity that she wants to continue pursuing. This is her fifteenth credit with MFP and she promises to continue being prompt in her payments. She feels very comfortable in her communal bank, since they have supported her a lot in the circumstances that life has given her, for which she is very thankful to her companions. The money that she now requests will be invested in adding to her beauty products, so that she can continue working in the manner she likes.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for resale

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer muy emprendedora, tiene 38 años, está feliz con su matrimonio, es madre de 3 hijos: Cristian (17), Noé (9) y Daniela de 1 año y dos meses. Por el momento viven en la casa de su madre.

Todos los días por la noche se dedica a licuar hierbas y especias frescas, pues su negocio es la venta de condimentos en un mercado cerca a su casa. En esta actividad lleva 13 años y durante este tiempo el crecimiento de su negocio ha sido notable y con esas ganancias logra sostener su hogar. Debido a que su esposo no cuenta con un trabajo estable, eventualmente le ayuda en su puesto de venta.
Luz se siente muy feliz por lo que sabe hacer y sobre todo porque es rentable, cuando se siente cansada de preparar los condimentos sus  hijos la ayudan y eso la motiva a seguir trabajando. 
Su deseo es comprar un terreno y construir su casa, pero sola no puede, es por eso que han decido que su esposo se encargará de la venta de condimentos, mientras que ella empezará a vender ropa, y así podrán ahorrar para hacer realidad su deseo de una casa propia.

Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP y siempre ha sido responsable con sus pagos, además es la secretaria de su grupo y sabe que no debe defraudar la confianza depositada en ella. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de prendas de vestir para incursionar en su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is a very enterprising woman. She is 38 years old and is a happily married mother of three: Cristian (17), Noé (9) and Daniela (1 yr and 2 mos). At the moment they live in her mother’s house. She spends every evening blending herbs and fresh spices, as her business is the sale of condiments in a marketplace near her home. She has been doing this for 13 years and during that time she has had a noticeable increase in business and is able to maintain her home with this income. Because her husband does not have a steady job, he works with her in her market stall. Luz is happy about what she knows, above all because it is profitable. Whenever she is tired from preparing her condiments, her children help her. This motivates her to keep working. One day she would like to buy some land and build a home, but she can’t do it alone, so they decided that her husband would be in charge of selling the condiments while she begins selling clothing. This way they will be able to fulfill their dreams of owning their own home. This is her twelfth loan through MFP and she has always been responsible with her payments. She is also the secretary of her group and knows that she must not lose the trust that she has earned with the other members. She will invest the money that she is requesting in clothing items to start her new business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand into a new business venture

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is forty years old. She is married with three children. All children are in school. Dora lives with her family in a rented apartment.  

Dora is a hair dresser. She does both plaiting and perming. She graduated from the apprenticeship training fifteen years ago and has since trained ten young ladies in hair dressing who have started their own businesses. She has her saloon on one of the principal street of her town and business is mostly brisk on weekends when most women style their hair for many occasions.  Dora is requesting for a loan to enable buy assorted hair creams, weavons, shampoo, etc to improve her services to her customers. She hopes to increase her income to enable her save more to support her children education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted hair creams.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Norma es conviviente, tiene 47 años y 1 hijo, Norma tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lencería.
Norma sueña con salir adelante, tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the “Banco Comunal Sonrisa” (Smile Communal Bank). She is 47 years old and has one son. Norma has a stall in the “April 12 Market” where she sells a variety of clothing items daily. She needs a loan of 1000 soles ($350) which she will invest in lingerie for resale. She hopes to someday have a clothing store of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lingerie for resale

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Liz es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Liz tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su mama, además Liz tiene un kiosco escolar en un colegio.
Liz necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y golosinas.
Los sueños de Liz son que tener una tienda de ropa, zapatos y sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Liz is a member of the “Banco Comunal Sonrisa” (Smile Communal Bank). She is 22 years old and has one son. She has a restaurant in a rented location and works daily with her mother’s help. She also has a snack stand at a local school. Liz needs a 1000 soles ($350) loan to invest in soft drinks and snacks. She dreams of one day having her own clothing and shoe store and to be able to help her son get ahead

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Dionisa

texts.en:
Dionisa is a special loan client with Esperanza and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the town of El-Seibo, an agricultural town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their child.

Dionisa is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her auto repair business by purchasing spark plugs, tires, oil, and brake pads. She will use the profits in her home by purchasing a more secure metal door and adding a room for her child. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy brake pads, spark plugs, tires and oil.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Genoveva es soltera, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Genoveva tiene un restaurante llamado Miski Mikuy que significa Comida Rica en quechua, actividad que realiza todos los días, cuenta con 2 personas que trabajan con ella.
Genoveva necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de un horno.
El sueño de Genoveva son terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Genoveva is an associate of the Sonrisa (smile) Communal Bank. Genoveva is a single woman. She is 50 years old and has 3 children. Genoveva has a restaurant called Miski Mikuy, which means Rich Food in Quechua. She runs her restaurant every day and relies on 2 people that work with her. Genoveva needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of an oven. The dream of Genoveva is to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an oven for her restaurant.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es un mujer muy alegre, de buen trato y conversadora, tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa humilde, pero muy acogedora.

Desde las 3 de la tarde es imposible hallarla en casa, ya que sale a recorrer las calles de su localidad cargando su bolso de cosméticos, perfumes y demás accesorios de belleza. De este modo trabaja como consultora de belleza desde hace 3 años, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos y amistades que no le fallan en el pago, por ello se siente una mujer realizada con la labor que realiza. Además su horario lo tiene bien planificado, sin descuidar sus responsabilidades en el hogar. Inicialmente le ha costado mucho adaptarse a esta actividad, pero la insistencia y el deseo de progreso la llevaron a crecer con su negocio.
En este momento, la meta de María es terminar de construir su casa con todos los detalles necesarios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Este es su cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y reanuda su compromiso de puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos, también manifiesta su conformidad en el trabajo de su grupo, donde se siente como en familia. El dinero que ahora solicita es para el incremento de sus productos de belleza, de ese modo tendrá un variado stock que podrá vender sin necesidad del catálogo.
texts.en:
Maria is a happy woman, pleasant and conversational. She is 53 years old. She lives with her husband and her 4 children in a humble, but very attractive home. From 3 in the afternoon it is impossible to find her at home. She travels the streets of her town, carrying her bag of cosmetics, perfumes and other beauty accessories. In this way, she has acted as a beauty consultant for 3 years. She has many steady clients and friendships sho never fail to pay her. This is why she feals like an accomplished woman with the work she does. In addition, she has a well planned schedule, without neglecting her responsibilities at home. At first, it was very hard for her to adapt to this activity, but her insistence and the wish to get ahead led her to grow her business. At this time, Maria's goal is to finish building her house with all of the necessary details to improve her family's quality of life. This is the fourth loan that she has had with MFP and she renews her committment of punctuality and responsibility with her payments. She also affirms her dedication to the work with the group, where she feels like she's with family. The money she is asking for now is to increase her beauty products. this way she will have a variety of stock that she can sell without needing a catalogue.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Nelida es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Nelida vende DVD, en un local propio, además vende útiles escolares, actividad que realiza todos los días junto a su esposo.
Nelida necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de DVD y útiles.
Los sueños de Nelida son implementar una sala de grabación y surtir con otros productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelida is a member of the communal bank Sonrisa. She is 42 years old, lives with a partner, and has 2 children. She sells DVDs in her own place of business. In addition, she sells school supplies, and she carries out this activity every day along with her husband. Nelida needs a loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles to invest in the purchase of DVDs and school supplies. Nelida dreams of being able to establish a recording studio, and being able to stock her business with other products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy DVDs and school supplies

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick T. is married. He has received a senior high education. Patrick sells music, video cassettes and CDs at Elmina, which he has been doing for some time now. His wife is a trader. Patrick uses his income to pay for rent and the general upkeep of the house. Patrick will use the loan to purchase more music, video cassettes, DVDs and CDs for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Patrick plans to save to build his own house where he will be living with his family.

loans.use: To purchase more music, video cassettes, DVDs and CDs for sale.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Olga es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Olga tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende pollos, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pollos.
Los sueños de Olga son terminar de construir su casa y vender pollo al por mayor.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Sonrisa ("Smile") communal bank. She is 31 years old and has a live-in partner and 2 children. Olga operates a stall in the Nery García market, where she works every day selling chickens. Olga needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in purchasing chickens. Olga's dreams are to finish constructing her house and to sell chicken on a wholesale basis.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chickens

loans.name: Rubilma

texts.es:
Rubilma, con sus 62 años tiene espíritu muy jovial y todas las ganas de seguir progresando en la vida. Desde hace varios años está separada y actualmente vive en su casa con sus dos hijas ya adultas.

Cada día se levanta muy temprano para compartir su tiempo con la cocina y la venta de sus productos de belleza. Durante 8 años viene trabajando como promotora de esta línea de cosméticos muy reconocida en el mercado nacional. Rubilma está muy contenta con lo que hace, sobre todo lo que le gusta es orientar a sus clientes de los beneficios de sus productos de a acuerdo a su tipo de piel, pues tuvo capacitaciones acerca de ello, de ese modo sus clientes la prefieren.
Durante la temporada de verano no le gusta caminar porque se sofoca demasiado, por eso prefiere ofrecer sus productos a partir de las 4 de la tarde, de esta manera no pierda a sus clientes. Su mayor aspiración es tener un gran stock de estos productos para que pueda incrementar sus ventas sin depender del catálogo y obtenga mayores ganancias.

Este es el doceavo crédito que tiene con MFP y se compromete, una vez más, a pagar sus cuotas en las fechas exactas, pues como presidenta de su banco comunal pregona con sus acciones. Con el dinero que ahora solicita incrementará sus productos de belleza, en especial maquillaje, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes son mujeres.
texts.en:
Rubilma, 62, has a very cheerful spirit and a strong desire to continue to advance in life. She separated from her husband a number of years ago, and currently lives in her home with her 2 adult daughters. Every day she gets up very early to divide her time between cooking and the sale of beauty products. For 8 years she has been working as a cosmetics promoter for a national brand. Rubilma is very content with her work; what she likes most of all is to guide her customers to the best products for their skin types. She has been trained to do this work, and for this reason her customers prefer to do business with her. During the summer months she does not like to walk because of the stifling heat. For this reason she prefers to offer her products after 4 in the afternoon; in this way she does not lose her customers. Her greatest aspiration is to have a large supply of these products so that she could increase her sales without relying on a catalog, and in this way increase her earnings. This is her twelfth loan with MFP, and she pledges, once again, to make her payments exactly as scheduled, since as president of her communal bank she must practice what she preaches. With the money that she requests now she will increase her stock of beauty products, especially makeup, since the majority of her customers are women.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise (buy more makeup and other beauty products)

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
La Sra. Jessica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 02 hijas que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando. La Socia presenta Estudios Superiores Técnica en  Forestal.

Jessica, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron muy buenos resultados y hoy en día, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas, lleva 05 años en el negocio, que hoy en la actualidad le esta dando muy buenos resultados,  se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. Se encuentra ubicada en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, con la amabilidad y carisma, que siempre la ha caracterizado. 

Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con un capital de  S/. 200.00 Nuevos Soles  iniciándose  con 02  paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo más. 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará más bebidas gasificadas  como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Jessica, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando más necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así, su sueño es tener una Distribuidora de bebidas gasificadas y vender al por mayor y menor.
texts.en:
Jessica belongs to the “Las Aguerridas” ("The Brave Women") communal bank, in the Tarapoto district of San Martin province, in the Department of San Martín. She is 30 years old and has a live-in partner. She is the mother of 2 daughters, who are in school and still dependent on her. Jessica has studied forestry at a technical institute of higher education. Jessica is a woman who has succeeded in overcoming many difficulties during her life. Her desire to get ahead has served her well, and today she operates a business selling soft drinks. She has had this business for 5 years, and today it is quite successful; she feels very satisfied with what she has achieved. The business is located in a well-equipped space within her own home, where she serves her customers with the friendliness and charm which have always characterized her. Jessica runs the business herself, without a boss or a fixed schedule. She tells us that she began with working capital of 200 Peruvian new soles, starting with 22 cartons of soft drinks. Seeing that the business was going well, she gradually invested more and more in it. With this loan for 1000 Peruvian new soles, she will buy additional cartons of soft drinks in various flavors, brands and sizes, as well as carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. Jessica is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement organization for helping her when she needed it most. She is responsible with her payments and plans to continue in the same manner. Her dream is to become a soft drink distributor and sell her products on both a wholesale and retail basis.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks to stock her business

loans.name: Frida Esther

texts.es:
Frida es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Frida es conviviente, tiene 60 años y 8 hijos, Frida se dedica a la compra y venta de tara y cochinilla, también cosecha de sus tierras, productos que vende a intermediarios en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Frida vende leña.
Frida necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la  compra de tara y cochinilla.
Los sueños de Frida son superarse mas y ahorrar para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Frida is a member of the Sonrisa (Smile) Community Bank. She is married, 60 years old, and has eight children. Her job is buying and selling tara pods and cochineal; she also grows crops on her land and sells the produce to middlemen in the town of Ayacucho. She sells firewood as well. Frida needs a loan of 2,600 soles to buy tara and cochineal. Her dream is to make a better life for herself and also to save enough to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tara pods and cochineal

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita acaba de cumplir 40 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos; Juan de 11 y Dora de 8.
Su negocio es un bazar, donde vende desde ropa hasta cosméticos. Su local está situado en el mercado de su distrito, lugar muy concurrido. Cuando empezó fue muy difícil porque sus hijos estaban pequeños y se enfermaban constantemente, por lo que el dinero no le alcanzaba para pagar todas sus cuentas. Pero su perseverancia, más el apoyo de su esposo, la ayudó salir adelante; ahora está más tranquila y su negocio es más estable. 
Empieza sus labores a las 7 de la mañana y termina a las 8 de la noche, pese que este negocio absorbe todo su tiempo, se siente bien con lo que hace, ya que desde niña su madre le enseñó a trabajar en el comercio.
Para el futuro, Sarita planea construir varios pisos en su casa, pues en su vejez quiere vivir del alquiler de sus habitaciones.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP e indica que será puntual, como siempre lo ha sido en sus pagos, ya que desea salir adelante para educar a sus hijos. La organización de su grupo la tiene muy contenta porque son personas responsables y no la hacen quedar mal, pues ella es la coordinadora. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cuadernos y otros útiles escolares, pues se viene la temporada escolar y estos artículos serán muy demandados.
texts.en:
Sarita has just had her 40th birthday, is married, and has two children: Juan aged 11, and Dora aged 8. She runs a store where she sells everything from clothing to cosmetics. It is situated in the district market, a busy location. When she started the business, it was very difficult as her children were small and were often sick, so the money she earned wasn’t enough to pay all the bills. But she persevered, her husband helped out, and she got through that period. Now her life is calmer and her business more stable. Sarita begins work at 7 in the morning and finishes at 8 in the evening. In spite of the fact that her work takes up all her time, she is happy with what she does as her mother taught her when she was a young girl how to run a business. As for the future, Sarita plans to add several floors to her house, as when she is older, she wants to earn money by renting out rooms. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She says that she will be punctual with her loan repayments--which she always has been in the past--as she wants to get ahead and provide a good education for her children. She is very happy with the organisation of her group as they are responsible people and she doesn’t want to cause any problems for them. Sarita is the coordinator. The money she is asking for will be used to buy notebooks and other school supplies because the back-to-school season is approaching and these items will be much in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Paulina es casada y tiene 34 años, Paulina tiene un taller de confecciones que implemento hace 3 meses y le esta yendo bien, anteriormente compraba la ropa y vendía en las ferias, ahora produce polos variados.
Paulina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Paulina son ampliar su empresa y comprar mas maquinas.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Sonrisa (Smile) Community Bank. She is married, 41 years old, and has a workshop making clothing. She started the business three months ago and it is going well. She used to buy the clothing and then resell it in markets, but now she makes a range of t-shirts. Paulina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy material. Her dream is to expand her business and buy more sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Jose Miguel vive en anticrético con su mama en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como locutor en una radio de mucha audiencia.

El crédito que solicita es para el pago del costo de matricula y pensiones  para continuar sus estudios en la carrera de comunicación y poder acceder a un mejor trabajo.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Jose Miguel lives in “anticrédito” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia) with his mother in the Miraflores area of the city of La Paz. He works as a radio announcer for a radio station with a big audience. The loan he is requesting is to pay the registration fee and boarding house fees to continue his communication career studies. That way he will be able to access a better job. He is a client of Impro, and he pays very well. Therefore, he can have access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay registration fee and boarding house fees to continue studies at the university

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Lucia es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Lucia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales y los comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Lucia necesita un  préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Lucia son ampliar su negocio y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the communal bank Sonrisa. She is married, 45 years old, and has 4 children. Lucia travels to the different markets in the region where she buys cereals that she sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Lucia needs a loan of 1,600 Peruvian soles that she will use to buy cereals. Lucia dreams of expanding her business and buying a car to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Teresa Natividad

texts.es:
Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Teresa es casada, tiene 52 años y 4 hijos, Teresa tiene un puesto en el mercado artesanal de la ciudad en donde vende artesanía variada, además Teresa se dedica a la producción de artesanía en piedra de huamanga.
Teresa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de retablos.
Teresa sueña con aumentar su mercadería y equipar su taller.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Sonrisa Communal Bank. She is 52, married, and has four children. Teresa has a stand in the handicraft market in the city. She sells various handicrafts. Teresa also devotes herself to the production of handicrafts from alabaster. Teresa needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy “retablos” (small, brightly painted wooden altarpieces depicting scenes of traditional Ayacuchan life). Teresa dreams of increasing her merchandise and equipping her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy “retablos” (small, brightly painted wooden altarpieces depicting scenes of traditional Ayacuchan life)

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan vive en casa de sus padres en la zona Belén de la ciudad de La Paz; desde niño se dedicó a la pintura de obras de arte y en la actualidad pinta cuadros y los vende en una zona comercial; también elabora carteles para los cines con ayuda de su padre.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar material (pinturas, lienzos y otros) y continuar con esta actividad ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Juan lives in his parents’ house in the Belén area of the city of La Paz. Since he was a little boy he has devoted himself to painting works of art. He currently paints pictures and sells them in a commercial zone. He also makes, with help from his father, posters for movie theaters. The loan he is requesting is to buy material (paints, canvasses, and others) to continue with this activity because it is his only source of income. He is a client of Impro, and he has a very good payment history. Therefore, he is able to access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy paints, canvasses, and other supplies for his business of painting pictures and other things

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is a thirty eight years old woman. She is married with four children. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like beans sauce and fried plantain popularly as “red red” etc. She is constantly disturbed by price hikes since she is not able to buy food ingredients in bulk. This adversely affects her business progress. She needs the loan to enable her inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and improve her meals quality.  She would be buying food ingredients like beans, palm oil, spices and firewood in bulk. She is expecting to increase her profit to support her family finances.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Loydith

texts.es:
La Sra. Loydith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 59 años y 03 hijos todos ya independientes, presenta Estudios Superiores es Profesora D. Primaria, pero no ejerce, por que se dedica a trabajar.

Loydith,  se dedica a la venta D. Bocaditos y se inició con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00  Nuevos Soles y por iniciativa propia, implemento su pequeño negocio, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, donD. venD. sus bocaditos  como, dulces, keke, suspiros, budín y otros dulces más.

Con este crédito  D. S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para sus bocaditos como: harina en sacos, mantequilla en kilos, azúcar rubia y blanca, huevos en jabas, leche en cajas y parte del dinero lo invertirá  en utensilios D. cocina para brindar un servicio D. calidad.  

Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas D. bocaditos. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con ella y otras mujeres que la necesitan, su meta es tener su Refrigerio bien surtido.
texts.en:
Ms. Loydith belongs to the Communal Bank 'Las Brisas", District of Bellavista, Province of Bellavista, Department of San Martin. She's married, 59 years old and has 3 children who are all independent. She has a college education and is an elementary school teacher, although she doesn't practice because she works. Loydith sells confections. She started with her first loan of S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles. By her own initiative, she started her small business in a well equipped locale to attend to her client. At present, she continues with the same business where she sells confections such as: candies, cake, merengues, pudding, and other sweets. With this loan of S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy ingredients for her confections, such as : sacks of flour, kilos of butter, brown and white sugar, cases of eggs, and crates of milk. She will invest part of the money in kitchen utensils to offer a quality service. She has the strength to continue with selling her confections. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her and other women who need it. Her goal is to have a good selection in her cooler.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy ingredients for her confections.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
La señora Marcia es empleada de Cotel (Compañía de telefonos), entidad que le proporciona la vivienda, en este lugar ella no paga alquiler y vive con toda su familia; el trabajo que realiza es de mensajera y limpieza, además de esta actividad ella vende comida a los mismos empleados para aumentar sus ingresos.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar los estudios de su hijo mayor el cual está por terminar la carrera de ingeniería en sistemas.

No es cliente de Impro pero por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito, además de que el flujo de fondos le permite efectuar los pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
Ms. Marcia is an employee of the phone company, Cotel, an organization that provides housing for its workers. She does not have to pay rent and lives with her entire family. She works as a courier and also cleans. In addition, she sells food to her fellow employees to increase her income. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for her eldest son's studies. He is finishing his degree in systems engineering. She is not a member of IMPRO (Kiva Field Partner), but her high moral character has allowed her a line of credit. Additionally, the cash flow will allow her to make monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay her son's university tuition

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to six children.  Currently, only one is still in school and the rest are independent. She lives together with her husband and her last child in a family house.  Esi operates a cold store and sells frozen chicken, fishes and meat for the past two years. She procures fresh fishes and chicken from big time cold store operators at the fishing habour at wholesale volumes and retail to her customers. She sells her products to households and food vendors. She seeks the loan to support her business to purchase stock in bulk.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve larger market and eventually, help improve her family finances.

loans.use: To purchase frozen fishes and chicken in bulk.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar vive en casa propia con su esposa e hija en la zona de alto San Pedro de La ciudad de La Paz; de profesión maestro jubilado al igual que su esposa, percibe una renta jubilatoria con la cual mantiene a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para poner un taller de joyería con ayuda de su yerno y de esta manera tener nuevos ingresos.

No es cliente de Impro pero por la actividad puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar lives in his own home with his wife and daughter in the Alto San Pedro region in the city of La Paz. He is a retired teacher, just like his wife, and receives a retirement pension with which he supports his family. The loan he has requested will be used to open a jewelry store with his son-in-law's help. In this manner, he hopes to increase his income. Oscar is not a member of IMPRO (Kiva Field Partner), but for his endeavor he has been able to obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: start up costs to open a jewelry store

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La Sra. Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 27 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella. La Socia presenta Estudios Superiores de Auxiliar en Contabilidad.

Maribel, es una mujer joven y trabajadora, lleva 02 años en el negocio y ahora tiene como meta, seguir prosperando e implementándose más en su negocio. Hoy en día le esta yendo muy bien, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas, ubicada en su misma casa. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró bebidas gasificadas de diferentes sabores tamaños y marcas.

Manifiesta que con el negocio que ejerce se siente muy tranquila y contenta, es ella quien administra su negocio. Se siente muy capaz y responsable con las cuotas que debe pagar mensualmente al Banco Comunal.

Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio,  ya es muy conocida en el barrio; y cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario consumen sus bebidas, ya que las vende bien heladitas al gusto del cliente.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará bebidas gasificadas de diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas. Así como agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Se siente orgullosa por haber logrado implementar su negocio. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a superarse y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y a defenderse como mujeres. Su sueño es tener una Distribuidora de bebidas gasificadas y ser reconocida
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the “Las Aguerridas II” Communal Bank, in the Tarapoto, District of the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 27 years old, married, and has two children who depend on her. She is trained to work as an assistant accountant. Maribel is a hard working young woman and has been working in her business for two years. Her goal is to continue to prosper and work her business. At the moment she is doing well, selling soft drinks from her home. She invested the money from her first loan of 300 PEN in soft drinks of different flavors, sizes and brands. She says that she feels very comfortable and happy with the business she runs. She feels that she will be able to afford the monthly payments to repay the communal bank. She is well known in her neighborhood and has regular customers who buy her soft drinks daily, which she sells nice and cold the way her customers like. With this 1,330 PEN ($475) loan, she will buy more soft drinks of different flavors, sizes and brands and also mineral water and bottled water. She is proud for having succeeded at starting her business and is thankful to the “Manuela Ramos” movement for helping her and other women to get ahead. She would like to one day run a soft drink distributorship and become well recognized.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Teresa Hermelinda

texts.es:
Teresa Hermelinda O. tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, y vive con su esposo y 3 hijos que se llaman Maria Jose de 15 años, Andres Joselito de 13 años, y Danya Victoria de 2 meses.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maíz como los principales cultivos.

Teresa trabaja comprando grano, maiz, frejol, y trigo.  Compra los cultivos de los agriculores y los vende.  Hace las compras en los pueblos en la comunidad y en las ferias y vende a un comerciante mayoritario.  Solicita el crédito para comprar grano para el negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro es que superen sus hijos y dependan de ellos mismos y no a otra persona.  Asimismo quisiera ganar una casita propia para mantener los hijos ya que actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres.

A Teresa le gusta cuidar de su hijita y mantener la casa.
texts.en:
Teresa Hermelina O. is 38 and married. She lives with her husband and their three children. Maria Jose is 15, Andres Joselito is 13, and Danya Victoria is two months. She belongs to the San Jose de las Orquideas Communal Bank, which is located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the San Jose de Palmas community. Farmers make up a big part of the community, and their main crops are potatoes and corn. Teresa works buying grains; corn, beans, and wheat. She buys the crops from the farmers and she sells the crops. She makes her purchases in the villages in her community and in the fairs. She sells to a wholesale merchant. She is asking for a loan to buy grains for her business. Her dream for the future is that her children succeed and depend upon themselves and no one else. She would also like to get a little house of her own in which to raise her children. She currently lives in her parents’ house. Teresa likes taking care of her little daughter and keeping house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains for her business

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes P. tiene 70 años, es casada, y vive con su esposo y 2 hijos.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maíz como los principales cultivos.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura y siembra maiz, papas, y frejol.  Sembró poquito esta temporada porque no avanza su terreno para sembrar más.  Hace todas sus compras y ventas en la ciudad de San Pablo.  Crece animalitos como otra actividad productiva y actualmente tiene 2 ganado.  Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos y urea para la agricultura.

Su sueño es que sus hijos trabajen para que salgan adelante.  En sus ratos libres, le gusta mucho trabajar en la casa y hacer los deberes domesticos.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes P. is 70 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children. She belongs to the rural bank "San Jose de las Orquideas," which is 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel, in the community of San Jose de Palmas. Most of the people in the community are farmers who grow potatoes and corn. Maria is a farmer who grows corn, potatoes, and beans. She did not plant much this season because she is running out of space to plant on her land. Maria makes all of her purchases an sales in the city of San Pablo. She raises little animals on the side and currently has two cows. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and urea for farming Her dream is for her children to work and get ahead. She likes to work in the house doing her domestic chores when she has free time.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertalizer and urea

loans.name: Working For Success Group

texts.en:
Gabriel M. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Working for Success. He is 23 years old, single and a high school graduate waiting to enter university. He doesn’t have a child.  Gabriel lives and works on the 20th Street in Sinkor, a community that is mixed with both poor and middle class Liberians in the capital, Monrovia.

Gabriel’s business is a motorcycle taxi service. He transports people from one location to another in Monrovia. He has been running this business for one year and six months and hopes to own a car in the near future. Gabriel started by selling rice but realized that transportation was more profitable than rice sales.

He gives his customers good service and drives them with care in order to encourage them to continue patronizing his business.  Gabriel needs this loan to purchase spare parts and service for his motorbike. He dreams of improving his living conditions.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Gabriel is the one holding the sign. Yawa F. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and service for a motorbike.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Otilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 51 años y es madre de 04  hijos, 01 que  aun depende de ella y esta estudiando, la socia presenta Secundaria Completa.

Otilia es una mujer alegre, perseverante y capaz, nos cuenta que poco a poco ha ido cumpliendo algunos de sus  metas y sueños que quería realizar,  en la actualidad se dedica a venta de ropas usadas y le esta yendo muy bien, en este tipo de actividad, ya que tiene clientes fijos que la conocen y saben de su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un lugar muy bien acondicionado. La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará mercaderías de ropas como: pantalones, shorts, snikers, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para niñas. Ella manifiesta que siente mucho orgullo por ella misma, por lo que logro y lo hizo con mucho entusiasmo y optimismo.

Otilia Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me ofrece el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos,  de  contar con los préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria
texts.en:
Otilia belongs to the Las Aguerridas II Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 51, married, and has four children. One child is still dependent upon her and goes to school. She has a high school education. Otilia is very happy, persevering, and capable. She tells us that, little by little, she has been reaching her goals and dreams. She currently sells clothes, and it is going very well for her. She has regular customers who know her and know about her business. The business is located in her house in a well-equipped area. Her characteristic strength and perseverance helped her to grow as an independent woman. She is very proud of what she has accomplished. She will use this loan for 800 PEN to buy merchandise like pants, shorts, sneakers, blouses in all sizes and styles, polo shirts, and dresses for girls. She feels very proud of herself for what she has achieved, and she did it with a lot of enthusiasm and optimism. Otilia says, “I am grateful for the opportunity that the Manuela Ramos Movement offers me, to be able to have loans that help me to develop as a woman and a small businesswoman.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like pants and shirts, etc.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina is a special loan client with Esperanza and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. She is located in El Seibo, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.

Alejandrina is excited to be taking her fifth individual loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing blouses, skirts, pants, underwear and shirts in the capital to sell at a profit. She will use the profits to invest in her home by replacing the wooden walls with cement block which is more hurricane resistant and termite resistant. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Alondra Jacqueline

texts.es:
Alondra Jacqueline G. L. tiene 26 años, es soltera, y vive con sus padres y 3 de sus 5 hermanos.  Tiene un hijo que se llama Danny de 5 años.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maiz como los principales cultivos.

Alondra se encuentra ayudando a su mama en la casa con los deberes domesticos.  Su papa trabaja en la agricultura todos los días y siembra maiz, papas, y otros vegetables.  Venden los productos en las ferias de San Pablo semanalmente.  Estudiaba Comercio de Administración en la Universidad de Bolivar y ya acabó sus estudios.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos y urea para ayudar a su padre con los cultivos.

Su sueño en la vida es seguir adelante y tener un puesto fijo en su profesión.  En sus ratos libres, se dedica a escuchar música y salir de paseo con su familia.
texts.en:
Alondra Jacqueline G. L., 26, is single; she lives with her parents and 3 of her 5 siblings. She has a son, Danny, who is 5 years old. She is a member of the "San Jose de las Orquideas" communal bank, which is located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the San Jose de Palmas community. Most of the residents of the community are farmers who grow potatoes and corn as the main crops. Alondra helps her mother with the domestic chores. Her father farms corn, potatoes and other vegetables daily. They sell their products weekly in the San Pablo market. She used to study Business Commerce in Bolivar University but she has finished her studies. She is asking for funds to buy fertilizers and urea to help her father with the crops. Her dream is to continue forward in life and to have a steady job in her profession. In her free time, she listens to music and goes on family outings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and urea.

loans.name: Ambrosio Irineo

texts.es: El señor Ambrosio Irineo E. es casado con la señora Juanita Elizeth y son una pareja joven pero muy trabajadora, el labora para una empresa como supervisor, y su esposa es enfermera de una fabrica. Ellos son clientes distinguidos de nuestra Institución ya que anteriormente se les otorgo un crédito para mejoramiento de vivienda proyecto que ya fue finalizado, pero nuevamente están tramitando para la colocación de una barrita en el área de su cocina.
texts.en:
Ambrosio Irineo E. is married to Juanita Elizeth; they are a young, hard-working couple. He is employed as a supervisor and she is a nurse in a factory. They are distinguished clients of our intitution in that they were granted a prior loan which was used for home improvements. They have repaid it and are requesting new funding to build a little wall in their kitchen area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a little wall in the kitchen area.

loans.name: Bertha Julia

texts.es: La señora Bertha tiene la edad de 31 años, mujer sobresaliente en el negocio, el cual ha sido el medio de apoyar a sus tres hijos ya que es madre soltera, se dedica  ala venta de madera y alquila cuartos, pero en estos meses no hay nadie alquilando lo que es una perdida. Solo se esta ayudando con la venta de madera. Lo que desea hacer con esta inversión es  una división de la sala ya que es grande, separar la cocina de la sala, para poder estar en mejores condiciones y mejor higiene lo cual es de mucha necesidad. El cual comprara materiales de construcción como: bloques, arena, cemento y hierro para comenzar la obra. Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a los cuartos de alquiler para a traer a los clientes y poder dar un mejor servicio, y ayudarse en su economía. Estos beneficios lo ha logrado con los financiamientos de Afodenic el cual esta muy contenta por lograr las mejoras.
texts.en:
Bertha, 31, has been outstanding in her business, which has been the means through which she, as a single mother, has supported her three children. She is a lumber merchant and she rents out rooms. However, these last few months she has had no renters, which has meant a loss of income. Her only source of income right now is the sale of lumber. What she wants to do with this funding is build a room division in her living room, because it is large. She will divide the kitchen from the living room so that she will have better conditions and improved hygiene, which is sorely needed. She will buy building materials like: concrete blocks, sand, cement, and iron to start the project. Her plans are to make improvements in her rental rooms so that her better service will attract customers, thus improving her economy. She has attained these benefits through Afodenic's loans and she is happy to have attained these improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Wilma Onorieta

texts.es:
Wilma Onorieta G. tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, y viven con sus dos hijas y una nieta.  Su hijas son Rosa Ortega de 25 años y Carmen Raquel de 34 años.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maiz como los principales cultivos.

Wilma cultiva maiz, trigo, papas, coles, y frejol como su principal fuente de ingresos para su familia.  Asimismo, crece animales y actualmente tiene ganado, pollo, cuyes, y conejos.  Para incrementar sus ingresos, se encuentra también con una pequeña tienda en su casa y vende colas, azucar, sal, etc.  Hace todas sus compras y ventas en la ciudad de San Pablo.

Solicita el crédito para la agricultura para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, etc.  Su mayor sueño es poder tener su terreno propio y casa propia.  Actualmente el terreno en el que viven es la herencia de sus padres y comparten el terreno con sus otros 10 hermanos.

En sus ratos libres, se dedica a leer la Biblia y dialogar con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Wilma Onorieta G., 50, is married and lives with her two daughters and a granddaughter. Her daughters are: Rosa Ortega, 25, and Carmen Raquel, 34. She is a member of the "San Jose de las Orquideas" communal bank, which is located 15 minutes away from the city of San Miguel in the San Jose de Palmas community. Most of the community's residents are corn and potato farmers. Wilma grows corn, wheat, potatoes, cabbage and beans, which are her family's main source of income. In addition, she raises small farm animals. She currently raises cattle, chickens, guinea pigs and rabbits. To increase her earnings, she's also set up a small grocery store in her house where she sells colas, sugar, salt, etc. All her commercial transactions are in the city of San Pablo. She is asking for funding to buy fertilizers and manure. Her greatest wish is to own her own land and have her own house. Currently, the land they live on is an inheritance from her parents and is shared with 10 siblings. In her free time she likes to read the Bible and chat with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Celia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Celia Elizabeth P. al igual que su esposo el señor Marco Antonio García están tramitando este crédito para la inversión en su negocio que lleva por nombre “Papelería Colors” establecido desde hace  1 año para la compra de papelería tales como papel de regalo, lápices, etc.  
Su esposo labora para una negocio de un centro comercial cuenta con una antigüedad de 1 año. Son una familia muy unida y estable que emprendió un negocio para tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Celia Elizabeth P. and her husband, Marco Antonio García, are requesting funding to invest in their stationery store, called “Papelería Colors," which has been in operation for a year. They stock stationery items like: gift-wrap, pencils, etc. Her husband has worked for a business in a shopping center for a year. They are a very close-knit, stable family that started a business in order to have higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stationery supplies.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz M. G. tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, y vive con su esposo y 3 hijos.  Tiene 5 hijos, 2 de los cuales ya se casaron y se fueron de la casa de sus padres.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maiz como los principales cultivos.

Luz se dedica a la agricultura como su principal fuente de ingresos.  Siembra maiz, papas, mora, habas, y a veces cebadas.  Tiene toda su vida en esta actividad, antes ayudaba a sus padres con los cultivos.  También tiene cuyes y ganado que vende con los cultivos en las ferias en San Miguel los días miércoles, jueves, y domingo.  Es dificil sacar los productos a la venta porque actualmente los precios son muy bajos.  Solicita el crédito para la siembra de maiz.

Su sueño es ayudarles a sus hijos en sus estudios para que sean profesionales en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Luz M. G., 50, is married and lives with her husband and three children. She has 5 children, but two of them are married and no longer live with their parents. She is a member of the "San Jose de las Orquideas" communal bank, which is located 15 minutes away from the city of San Miguel in the San Jose de Palmas community. Most of the community's residents are potato and corn farmers. Luz's main source of income is corn, potato, blackberry and, occasionally, barley farming. She has been a farmer all her life; she used to help her parents with their farming. She also raises guinea pigs and cattle which she sells in the San Miguel markets on Wednesdays, Thursdays and Sundays. It's difficult to sell right now because prices are very low. She is asking for funding for her corn crops. Her dream is to help her children with their schooling so that they will become professionals in the field of agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is a special loan client with Esperanza, her story is representative Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. She is located in El Seibo, an agricultural area, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their six children.

Ana Maria is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business as a seamstress by purchasing cloth. She will use the profits to invest in a refrigerator for her family as well as her long term goal of constructing her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Fabric for seamstress business

loans.name: Euloly

texts.es:
La Sra. Euloly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas” vive en el Barrio Intiyacu del  Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años y 03 hijos, 01  que aun depende de ella, por lo que Euloly, trabaja muy duro día a día, presenta estudios hasta tercer año de secundaria.

Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, siempre con el apoyo de su esposo, que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes, nos cuenta que se inicio con la venta de panes.
Con su primer crédito de 200 Nuevos Soles, compró: chizitos en paquetes, lejía, leche, té  en cajas, dulces y algunas golosinas. En la actualidad tiene sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su negocio a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo que el ama de casa necesita. 

Con este crédito de S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles ,comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Euloly, se siente muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, y desea seguir cumpliendo sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Euloly, 43, is a member of the "Las Brisas" communal bank. She lives in the Intiyacu neighborhood, Bellavista district, Bellavista Province, San Martín department. She is married and has three children, one of whom is still dependent on her and in the 9th grade, thus the reason why Euloly works hard every day. Motivated by her enterprising spirit and love for her family, she started her own grocery store, always supported in this effort by her husband. Gradually, she increased her experience and she became better-known and liked by her customers; she tells us that she began selling just bread. She used her first, 200 new sol, loan to buy packages of puffed cheese snacks, chlorine bleach, milk, boxed tea and some sweets. Currently, she has regular customers who come daily to buy because she stocks everything a housewife might need. She will use this new, 1500 new sol, loan to buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of pasta, boxed milk and preserved fish of various brands, crates of eggs and personal hygiene items to continue to provide better service to her customers. Euloly is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement and hopes to continue reaching her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: We Are One Group

texts.en:
Mamie G. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called We Are One. She is 34 years old and a single mother, with 3 children aged 3-16 years old who have educational levels from nursery-7th grade.
