Mamie and her family live and work in the Old Road community, a community that has both poor and middle class Liberians; it is about 3 miles from downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She was never able to go through high school due to lack of financial support from her parents.

Mamie’s business is the sales of general goods such as rice, oil, pepper, and other cooking ingredients. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail on a table to residents of Old Road in Monrovia.  She has been running this business for 5 years and hopes to own a shop in the near future.

Mamie started by selling oil around the community, but now sells on a table. She has a good relationship with her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Mamie needs this loan to purchase rice, oil, seasonings, etc. for resale. She dreams of educating her children and building a house for her family to live in.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mamie is the one holding the sign.  Adama K. and Hawa Z. are inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase rice, oil, seasonings, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Neptali Salomón

texts.es:
Neptali Salomón G. C. tiene 64 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, y tiene 5 hijos de 14 a 22 años de edad.

El socio pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maiz como los principales cultivos.

Naptali trabaja en el terreno y siembra granos.  Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace toda la vida.  Trabaja todos los días de lunes a sabado y vende los productos en la feria de San Pablo los días domingo.  Hace las compras de insumos de los distribuidores en el almacen en San Pablo.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos y semillas.

Desea seguir educandoles a sus hijos.  Uno de sus hijos quiere ser policia y otra piensa ser enfermera.  Neptali cuenta que tienen que estudiar sus hijos para que sean profesionales porque trabajar en el campo es muy duro.
texts.en:
Neptali Salomón G. C., 64, is married and has 5 children, whose ages range from 14 to 22 years of age. He is a member of the "San Jose de las Orquideas" communal bank, which is located 15 minutes away from the city of San Miguel in the San Jose de Palmas community. Most of the community's residents are potato and corn farmers. Naptali is a farmer; he's been one all his life. He works every day, from Monday through Saturday and sells his products in San Pablo's market on Sundays. He buys his supplies from distributors in San Pablo. He is requesting funding to buy seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to continue to provide schooling for his children. One of his sons wants to be a policeman and his daughter wants to be a nurse. Neptali tells us that his children must study to become professionals because field work is very hard.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Alex Mariel

texts.es:
Alex Mariel P. M. tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, y vive con sus padres y 3 hermanos.

El socio pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maiz como los principales cultivos.

Alex se dedica a ayudar a sus padres en los cultivos de maiz, papas, alverja, y habas.  Lo dificil de trabajar en el campo es que hay tiempos el los que no se puede sembrar ni cosechar por las pocas lluvias.  La familia también crece ganado vacuno para vender cuando se crezcan y se gorden.  Venden los productos semanalmente en las ferias en la ciudad de San Miguel.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para ayudar a sus papas en la agricultura.  Para el futuro, desea terminar sus estudios.  Actualmente está estudiando Ingeniería Agrícola en el Instituto 3 de Marzo.  En sus tiempos libres, le gusta ayudar a los instructores en el colegio para darles los estudios a los niños.
texts.en:
Alex Mariel P. M., 22, is single and lives with his parents and three siblings. He is a member of the "San Jose de las Orquideas" communal bank, which is located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the San Jose de Palmas community. Most of the community's residents are corn and potato farmers. Alex helps his parents with their corn, potato, pea and bean crops. What is difficult about field work is that sometimes one can neither plant nor harvest because of the scarce rainfall. The family also raises cattle to sell when they have grown and reached a certain weight. They sell their product weekly in San Miguel's market. He is asking for funding to buy seed, manure and fertilizers to help his parents with their farming. For the future, he wants to finish his schooling. He is currently studying Agricultural Engineering at the 3 de Marzo Institute. In his free time, he likes to help the teachers in the institute teach the children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Lourdes Evelin

texts.es:
Lourdes Evelin G. L. tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, y no tiene hijos.  Vive con sus padres y 2 otros hermanos.  Son 6 hermanos, los demás ya son adultos y se fueron de la casa de los padres.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maiz como los principales cultivos.

Actualmente Lourdes está estudiando Secretariado Ejecutivo en la Universidad de Bolivar.  Los fines de semana ayuda a sus padres en la agricultura a sembrar y cosechar sus cultivos de maiz, papas, habas, y arvejas.  De vez en cuando sale a ayudar a sus padres con las ventas de los productos en las ferias de San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, liquidos, y abonos para ayudar a sus padres en la agricultura.  Su sueño para el futuro es llegar a tener su propia profesion y conseguir trabajo.  También quisiera conseguir otra carrera en la universidad pero debido a la situación economica, eso no siempre es posible.  Le gustaría estudiar en otro pais pero actualmente los padres ya tienen que gastar entre todos los hijos y no es una posibilidad.
texts.en:
Lourdes Evelin G. L., 21, is single and has no children. She lives with her parents and two siblings. They are six siblings but the rest are already adult and don't live with their parents anymore. She is a member of the "San Jose de las Orquideas" communal bank, which is located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the San Jose de Palmas community. Most of the community's residents are corn and potato farmers. Lourdes is studying in Bolivar University to become an Executive Secretary . On weekends, she helps her parents to plant and harvest corn, potatoes, beans and peas. Sometimes, she accompanies her parents to the San Miguel market to sell their products. She is asking for funding to buy liquid fertilizers and manures to help her parents with their crops. Her dream for the future is to have her own career and to get a job. She would also like to study a second profession in the university but, due to the economic situation, this isn't possible. She would like to study in another country but her parent's already have to spend a lot with all the children so this isn't possible, either.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa O. G. tiene 25 años, es soltera, y vive con sus padres, hermano, y sobrino.  No tiene hijos.

La socia pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maiz como los principales cultivos.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultora desde hace toda la vida y siembra maiz, trigo, y cebada.  Cuenta que sembrar maiz es duro porque hay que cuidar mucho.  Asimismo crece gallinas y otros animales de casa.  La familia vende los productos en las ferias de San Pablo y San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la agricultura.  Sus metas para el futuro son crecer los cultivos para tener un buen desarrollo y tener una casita propia.  Le gusta aprovechar los tiempos libres para estar con su familia y pasear.
texts.en:
Rosa O. G. is 25 years old, single, and lives with her parents, brother, and nephew. She doesn't have any children of her own. She belongs to the communal bank "San Jose de la Orquideas", which is located 15 minutes away from the city of San Miguel, in the community of San Jose de Palmas. A large part of the community are farmers and grow potatoes and corn as their primary crops.

Rosa has been a farmer for her entire life, and she sows corn, wheat, and barley. She tells us that growing corn is hard because she has to take care of it a lot. She also raises chickens and other farm animals. Her family sells the products in the markets of San Pablo and San Miguel.

She is requesting the loan to work in agriculture. Her goals for the future are to grow her crops in order to have good development and her own house. She likes to take advantage of her free time to spend time with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For agriculture (seeds, fertilizer, etc)

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis A. tiene 56 años, su estado civil es casado, y vive con su esposa y hijos.  Tiene 11 hijos de 15 a 33 años de edad.

El socio pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maiz como los principales cultivos.

Jorge es agricultor y siembra de febrero en adelante cada año.  Su zona es más maicera, pero siembra también trigo y cebada en pocas candidades para consumir.  Trabajar en el campo es duro y es dificil llegar a mantener la familia por la falta de dinero en la agricultura. Solicita el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para fertilizar los productos.  Vende las cosechas a los comerciantes y a un socio de la ciudad de Guayaquil para que las cargue por otros lados a vender.

Sus esperanzas en la vida son llegar a tener alimentación para toda la familia y que todos sus hijos sean profesionales, avancen, y compren su casa propia.

Los días domingo en los que no son laborables, Jorge Luis sale a jugar volei en la comunidad y comprar comida para la familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis A. is 56 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their children. He has 11 children from the ages of 15 to 33. He belongs to the communal bank "San Jose de la Orquideas", which is located about 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the community of San Jose de Palmas. The large part of the community are farmers and grow potatoes and corn as their principal crops.

Jorge is a farmer and grows crops from February onward every year. His region is best for corn, but he also sows wheat and barley in small quantities for his own consumption. Working in the field is hard, and it is difficult to maintain his family with the lack of money in agriculture. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase fertilizers in order to fertilize the products. He sells the harvest to shopkeepers and a member from the city of Guayaquil so that he carries them to other sides to sell.

His hope in life is to have food for his entire family, and that all of his children are professionals, advance, and buy their own house. On Sundays that are not working days, Jorge Luis plays volleyball in the community and buys food for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is forty years old. She is married and has four children who are currently in school. She runs a grocery shop to support her husband provide for the family. She has been in business for twelve years now. She sells items such as tins of milo, milk, sugar, bread, tin fish, etc. Lucy procures her goods from wholesalers in the big city.  She seeks a loan to purchase groceries in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her save more to support her family, especially her kid’s education.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Zeleh Group

texts.en:
Varbah H. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Zeleh.  She is 46 years old, single, and has three children aged 12, 18, and 29.  One is in 5th grade, another is in 10th grade, and the other is in 12th grade.  In addition to her children, Varbah also supports her parents.

Varbah has a charcoal and dry goods business at the Waterside Market which is the largest market in Monrovia. Varbah provides high quality customer care, which keeps customers returning.

Varbah plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 27,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more charcoal and used goods.  She hopes that this loan will help her grown her business and allow her to import goods from other countries.  She also hopes that she will empower her children to go into business as well.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Varbah is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and dry goods for resale

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”,  Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 26 años y es madre de 01 lindo bebe, que aun dependen de ella, presenta Estudios Superiores, Auxiliar en Contabilidad. 

Carmen Rosa, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, hace 05 años viene dedicándose a la  venta de chupetes, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, que a día a día la frecuentan, por el sabor rico que le pone a sus chupetes.  Nos cuenta que en la actualidad se siente muy contenta, ya que su negocio le esta yendo muy bien. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles  compró frutas, cajas de leche, azúcar, etc.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles ,comprará ingredientes para la preparación de sus chupetes  como azúcar en kilos,  cajas de leche y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación de los chupetes, a diario cuenta con sus productos surtidos, para así poder captar una mayor clientela. 

Carmen Rosa, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Rosa belongs to the community bank "Las Brisas" (The Breezes) in the district and province of Bellavista, department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 26 years old, and is the mother of a beautiful baby boy, who depends on her. She has a higher education as an Accounting Assistant. Carmen Rosa is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. For five years she has been selling popsicles from her own home, in an environment that is very well-equipped for serving her customers, who visit her daily for the rich flavor of her popsicles. She tells us that she is currently very happy since her business is going very well. With her first loan of 300 new soles, she bought fruit, cartons of milk, and sugar, etc. With this loan of 3,000 new soles, she will buy ingredients for the preparation of her popsicles, such as sugar in kilos, cartons of milk, and fruit that she needs daily for the preparation of the popsicles. She needs an assortment of products daily to attract the best clientele. Carmen Rosa feels strengthened to keep working, and perservering day by day. She is thankful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Manuela Ramos Movement) for helping women like her have opportunities to develop themselves in the middle of their circumstances.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of popsicles

loans.name: Hugo Amado

texts.es:
Hugo Amado G. L. tiene 51 años, es soltero, y vive solo en la casa de sus padres.  Tiene una hija de 3 años que se llama Andreana Isabel.

El socio pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maíz como los principales cultivos.

Hugo se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio.  Siembra todos los productos, pero los que mas sobresalen son el maiz, frejol, y habas.  A veces tiene que superar las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.

Vende choclo asado en la ciudad de San Pablo.  Tiene un puesto con una tarpa en el que hace las ventas.  Hay muchos viajeros que pasan por San Pablo a otros lados a quienes Hugo vende sus productos.  Solicita el crédito para comprar quimicos para los cultivos.

Su sueño para su hija es que siga estudiando en el colegio y que termine los estudios.  Le gusta a Hugo hacer deporte en la comunidad cuando no está trabajando.
texts.en:
Hugo Amado G. L. is 51, single, and lives alone in his parent's house. He has a 3 year-old daughter named Andreana Isabel. He belongs to the rural communal bank "San Jose de las Orquideas," that is located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel, in the community of San Jose de Palmas. Most of the residents of this community are farmers, and they grow potatoes and corn as their principal crops. Hugo works in agriculture and trade. He cultivates all of the products, but particularly corn and beans. At times he has to overcome diseases that affect the crops. He sells roasted corn in the city of San Pablo. He has a stand with a tarp from which he makes the sales. There are many travelers who pass through San Pablo to whom Hugo sells his products. He requests this loan to buy chemicals for his crops. Hugo's dream for his daughter is for her to continue studying in school so that she finishes her education. Hugo enjoys participating in sports in the community when he is not working.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and liquids used in agriculture

loans.name: Shine Forever Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel S. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Shine Forever. He is 41 years old and is married with 6 children aged 2-11 years old and their educational levels are 1st-6th grade. He also cares for 2 siblings.  Emmanuel and his family live and work on Johnson Street, down town Monrovia, Liberia.   He was never able to go through high school due to the lack of financial support from his parents.

Emmanuel’s business is the sale of general goods such as sardines, sugar, oil, biscuits, etc. He buys his goods from wholesalers and sells at retail to residents of downtown Monrovia.  He has been running this business for 15 years.

Emmanuel started selling with 800 Liberian Dollars that was given to him by his uncle.  He talks to his customers in a good manner and always gives them a smile when serving them in order to encourage them to continue buying from him.  Emmanuel needs this loan to purchase more oil, seasonings, sardines, etc. for resale.  He dreams of given his children a better education so as to have a good future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Emmanuel is the one holding the sign.  Joseph S. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: For general store inventory

loans.name: Angel Vinicio

texts.es:
Angel Vinicio L. tiene 33 años de edad, su estado civil es union libre, y vive con su señora y 2 hijos.  Tiene una hija de 9 años y un hijo de 5 años.

El socio pertenece a la ventanilla rural "San Jose de las Orquideas" que está ubicada de 15 minutos de la ciudad de San Miguel en la comunidad de San Jose de Palmas.  La gran parte de la comunidad son agricultores y crecen papas y maíz como los principales cultivos.

Como los otros en la comunidad, Angel es agricultor.  Lo que más siembra es maiz y también crece frejol y papas en menores cantidades.  Recién sembró maiz pero solo pocos porque la mejor temporada para el maiz es en marzo.  Hace las compras de las semillas y abonos en las ciudades de San Pablo y San Miguel y manda sus productos a Guayaquil ya que tiene un socio alla que le ayuda a distribuir los productos.  Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos y liquidos.

Su esperanza es que sus hijos sean una profesión.  Quisiera tener su terreno propio para seguir sembrando maíz.
texts.en:
Angel Vinicio L. is 33 years old. He lives with his common-law wife and 2 children. He has a 9-year-old daughter and a 5-year-old son. Angel belongs to the "San Jose de las Orquideas" communal bank, located 15 minutes from the city of San Miguel in the community of San Jose de Palmas. Most people in the community are farmers who grow potatoes and corn as their main crops. Like the others in his community, Angel is a farmer. His main crop is corn, and he also grows beans and potatoes in smaller quantities. He recently planted some corn, but only a little, because the best season for corn is in March. He buys the seeds and fertilizer he needs in the cities of San Pablo and San Miguel, and he sends his products to Guayaquil, since he has a partner there who helps him distribute his products. He is requesting this loan to purchase compost and liquid fertilizer. Angel's hope is to see his children learn a profession. He would like to have his own land to continue planting corn.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing compost and liquid fertilizer

loans.name: Adela Patricia

texts.es: Adela tiene 39 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de carne de res. Ella tiene 2 hijos que están a su cargo y que cuida con mucho esmero pues se preocupa por proporcionarles lo más necesario. Este negocio inicio como un proyecto ya que en su cuadra no tenía mucha competencia y con el apoyo de su familia es que logra salir adelante con esta actividad económica. Por lo siempre le ha gustado trabajar de manera independiente. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima que es necesaria para abastecer su negocio lo suficiente para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella sueña con seguir adelante con su negocio para mantenerlo siempre activo.
texts.en:
Adela is 39 years old. Her business is selling beef. She has two children at home, and she cares for them with great dedication, but she worries about providing them with the basic necessities. Her business began as a small project, since there was not much competition on her block, and with the support of her family, she has been able to create a successful enterprise. Adela has always enjoyed working independently. She is requesting this loan to purchase raw materials which she needs to stock her business with sufficient quantities to offer her customers. Adela's dream is to continue making progress with her business so that she can keep it going on a permanent basis.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rigners Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu D. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Rigners. She is 36 years old and is married with 2 children aged 9 and 12 years old whose educational levels are 5th and 8th grades.  Kadiatu and her family live and work at the ELWA Junction about 5 miles from downtown of the capital Monrovia, Liberia.  She is a high school graduate as she was unable to complete her education due to poverty.

Kadiatu’s business is the sale of bread and butter. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail on a table to residents of ELWA.   She has been running this business for 2 years and hopes to own a shop in the near future.  Kadiatu started by selling with 1,500 Liberian dollars as working capital but now operates with about 4,000 Liberian Dollars.

She sells good bread and communicates with her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.  Kadiatu needs this loan to purchase more bread and butter for resale to improve her business.  She dreams of being an educated person in society in the future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kadiatu is the one holding the sign.  Lamah D. is in the inset at the lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more bread and butter.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima F. est un yoffois de 41 ans qui habite plus précisément dans le quartier de Mbenguene. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis juillet 2003. Il est marie et père de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 6 et 10 ans. Sa première profession était celle de cuisinier dans un hôtel de la place. Mais il a rompu avec cette activité et depuis 2003 il s’est substitue en technicien. Il fait des montages en électricité, du câblage et du reportage dans les cérémonies. C’est par passion qu’il est entre dans ce secteur d’activiste toujours dans l’objectif de satisfaire la clientèle. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs dans le but de renouveler un amplificateur et acheter 2 décodeurs qui sont ses outils de travail. Ce crédit pourra contribuer à l’amélioration les conditions de vie de sa famille a qui il doit soutien et assistance.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima F., 41, is a native of Yoff who lives in the Mbenguene district, to be precise. He has been a member of the Yoff credit union since July 2003. He is married and the father of 3 children, aged between 6 and 10 years. His first profession was that of cook in a local hotel. However, he quit that job and since 2003, he has become a technician. He sets up electrical and cable systems and records local events. Getting into this very active work is exciting for him and he is always looking to satisfy his clientele. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 frs so as to get a new amplifier and buy two decoders, the tools of his trade. This loan will contribute to improving living conditions for his family to whom he owes support and assistance.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: a new amplifier and two decoders for his work

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
Isaías, de 28 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus familiares junto a su madre Carmen de 53 y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.

Él trabaja junto a su madre en un quiosco de comida ubicado en uno de los mercados más importantes de la ciudad. Su negocio es muy concurrido por las personas que desean servirse un delicioso platillo nocturno, siendo la especialidad de su madre el arroz con fideos y papas fritas, platillo con el cual se ha hecho muy conocida entre sus comensales.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a los clientes, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es encontrar el tiempo necesario para realizar sus estudios universitarios. 
Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para implementar un restaurante para su madre, donde puedan brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Isaias con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es uno de los pocos varones, y siente que tiene el compromiso de ser muy responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en:
Isaías, 28, is an unassuming and hardworking young person who lives in his family's home with his 53 year-old mother, Carmen. What he desires most is to succeed in life. He works with his mother in a kiosk where they sell food, located in one of the most important markets in the city. His business is very busy because of the many people who want to have a delicious meal served at night. His mother's specialty is rice with noodles and fried potatoes, a dish with which she has become well known amongst the diners. What he enjoys most about the work is attending to the customers. He has been carrying out this activity for 3 years now, and what he finds most difficult is to find the time he needs to complete his studies at the university. In the future, he hopes to gather together the money needed to open a restaurant for his mother, where she can provide better service to her customers. This is his 2nd loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to make the payments on time. He does not want to create problems with the members of his communal bank where he is one of a small number of men, and he feels that he has a commitment to be very responsible. With the 1,000 Peruvian soles requested he will buy more ingredients to prepare his delicious dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food, ingredients for his meals

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y 03 hijas, 01 que aun dependen de ella. La Socia presenta primaria completa.

Ramona, es una mujer con ganas de seguir adelante, se considera una mujer luchadora y eficiente, lleva 06 años dedicándose a la venta de dulces como: Mazamorras de maíz morado, arroz con leche, como vio que le genera buenos ingresos decidió implementarse mas en el negocio, sus ventas los realiza a partir de las 10:30 am. Y sale por las calles, el mercado a ofrecer ricos dulces. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró, maíz morado en kilos, azúcar y algunos utensilios, nos cuenta que le va muy bien y tiene buena acogida, por el rico sabor de sus dulces. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio.

Con este crédito de S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para preparar sus dulces  como: Maíz morado, arroz y azúcar en kilos, manzanas y piñas, canela molida y otros ingredientes, para dar un rico sabor, en cuestión de utensilios comprará vasos y cucharitas de plástico.
 
Ramona, se siente una mujer tranquila y contenta con lo logrado. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sueños y metas, así como a otras mujeres que  quieren crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ramona belongs to the "Las Brisas" ("The Breezes") communal bank, in the Bellavista district, Bellavista province, Department of San Martín. She is 44 years old and married, and she has 3 daughters, one of whom is still dependent on her. She has completed an elementary school education. Ramona is a woman with the desire to get ahead, and she is known as a determined and efficient person. For the past 6 years, she has worked selling sweets, such as arroz con leche (rice pudding) and mazamorras, a pudding made from purple corn. Since she saw that she could generate a good income this way, she decided to devote more of her time to the business. She sells her products starting at 10:30 a.m., going out onto the streets and to the market to offer her delicious sweets. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian new soles, she purchased purple corn by the kilo, as well as sugar and some utensils. She tells us that her business is going very well and it is quite popular, thanks to the delicious flavor of her sweets. She is currently continuing with the same business. With this loan for 2,500 Peruvian new soles, she will buy supplies to prepare her sweets, such as purple corn, rice and sugar by the kilo, as well as apples, pineapples, ground cinnamon and other ingredients to provide delicious flavor. She will also buy some utensils such as plastic cups and spoons. Ramona feels like a satisfied woman, happy with what she has achieved. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement organization for helping her fulfill her goals and dreams, as well as for helping other women who want to grow and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients to prepare rice pudding and mazamorras

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo P. S., vive en el Barrio Laureles Sur, tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y su esposa es ama de casa, ellos tienen 8 hijos de los cuales todos dependen de él. Ellos son una familia humilde que se dedica a la venta de chatarra en el norte del país, para esto, ellos cuentan con una camioneta y un carretón de caballo que son los medios de transporte que les facilitan la movilización del material reciclable.

Dentro de los planes familiares están  el tener los recursos necesarios para brindarles a sus hijos la educación y espacio óptimo para habitar en comodidad y seguridad a futuro, para que estos sean personas de bien.


Ellos tienen planes de inyectarle un mayor capital al negocio, en la compra de un inventario más amplio de materia prima, agradecería se le apoyara debido a que también se le ha dificultado por la subida de precio que se ha venido registrando en los últimos meses debido a que ha afectado su bolsillo de manera considerable.
texts.en:
Reynaldo P. S. lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Sur, is 38 years old, and married. His wife stays at home with their 8 dependent children. They are a humble family dedicated to the sale of scrap material in the north of the country. They rely on a truck and a horse cart as the means of transportation for the recycled material.

In the family's plans are to have the necessary resources to offer their children the education and living space necessary to live in comfort, secure their future, and allow them to be good people.

They plan to inject more capital into their business to purchase a larger inventory of raw material. They appreciate the support because their efforts to do so have been hindered by the increase of prices they have seen in the last few months which have greatly affected their ability to pay out of pocket.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and transporting recycled material

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
La Sra. Paquita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 69 años y es madre D. 05 hijos, todos ya independientes y presenta estudios hasta sexto grado D. primaria.

La necesidad D. sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella deciD. iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. gallinas vivas, criadas en su propia casa. Con su primer crédito  D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró pollitos bebes, alimentos balanceados,  donD. comenzó vendiendo poco a poco y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes, que ya conocen D. la actividad que realiza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará, huevos para hacer poner a sus gallinas, alimento balanceado y vitaminas, para mantener sanos a sus animales y libres D. cualquier enfermedad.

Paquita, se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, cree que vale el sacrificio que está haciendo día a día, su sueño es ser una gran empresaria D. ventas D. gallinas. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  muchas mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Paquita belongs to the communal bank “Las Brisas”, in the Bellavista district, Bellavista Province, in the Department of San Martin. She is 69, married, and the mother of 5, all independent. She went to school through the sixth graD.. The need to help her children get ahead, and thanks to her spirit and the entrepreneurial energy that she has, she decided to start her own business of selling live chickens, raised in her own house. With her first loan of 300 new sols, she bought chicks, and well-balanced food. She began selling the chickens little by little, and became well-known by the customers who were familiar with the work that she was doing. With this 2,000 new sol loan, she will buy fertilized eggs for her hens, balanced food, and vitamins to keep her chickens free of disease. Paquita feels very satisfied with her work, although it is hard and she has to get up early. She believes that it is worth the daily sacrifice she is making towards her dream of becoming a big businesswoman selling chickens. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for offering her and many women the support so that they can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy eggs and balanced food to keep her chickens healthy

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen, tiene 44 años, vive en el Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. La Socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”. Es Casada y es madre D. 03 hijos, 01 que aun esta estudiando y depenD. D. ella, la Socia presenta Estudios D. Primaria Completa.

Carmen es  una mujer perseverante, con las ganas D. salir siempre adelante, decidió por voluntad propia vender comida en un ambiente limpio y acondicionado, ubicado en un puesto que tiene al frente D. un Hospital D. su Distrito, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, es reconocida por la sazón rica que le da a sus comidas, con su primer crédito D. 300 Nuevos Soles compró, arroz, azúcar en kilos, aceite en litros y utensilios para una mejor atención.

Se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, es ella quien personalmente atienD. a sus clientes con el carisma que siempre  le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ingredientes  para la preparación diaria D. sus comidas  como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos D. papa, pollos en javas, verduras y  parte D. dinero invertirá en utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Carmen, esta llena D.  vida y con ganas D. seguir adelante, su meta es seguir creciendo en el rubro D. venta D. comidas. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is 44 years old and lives in the Bellavista Province of the Department of San Martin. She belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Brisas". Carmen is married and the mother of 3 children, 1 of whom is still studying and dependent on her. Carmen has completed primary school, and is a persevering woman with the desire to always go forward. As such, she voluntarily decided to sell food in front of a general hospital in her district. She tells us that her daily sales are quite high, and she is known for her tasty food. With her 1st loan, Carmen purchased rice, sugar, oil, and utensils. She is very happy with her job, and personally working with her customers. With the loan she currently requests, Carmen will buy the ingredients necessary to prepare her food, such as rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, chicken, and vegetables. She will also use part of the money to purchase utensils. Carmen is full of life and eager to develop her business. She thanks Manuela Ramos for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her meals

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ligia Maria P. O., tiene 41 años de edad vive en los Laureles Sur, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 6 y 10 años de edad ambos cursan la escuela primaria.

Ella es comerciante y a futuro desea comprar un tramo en el mercado Oriental, ella sobrevive de su propio negocio, el cual es una pulpería la cual empezó gracias a la liquidación que le brindaron en una zona franca en la que trabajaba, ahora ella desea realizar este otro préstamo para continuar con la inversión a su negocio en la compra de mayor inventario de productos, esto les brindara a la familia  mejores condiciones económicas con el objetivo de proveerles del capital para futuras inversiones. La señora P. ha sido un cliente responsable que ha cancelado sus cuotas en tiempo y forma y agradecería se le continuara apoyando, para poder alcanzar el capital necesario para proyectarse a nuevas aspiraciones laborales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ligia Maria P. O. is 41 years old, and lives in Laureles Sur. She is a single mother with 2 children, ages 6 and 10. Both of her children are in grade school. Mrs. O. is a businesswoman. In the future, she hopes to buy a space in the Eastern Market. Mrs. O. survives by way of her shop, which she started with help of a liquidation. She is currently reqesting a loan to continue investing in her business and purchase a larger variety of products to sell. This would provide her family better economic and living conditions, and capital for future investment. Mrs. O. has been a responsible client and paid her loan installments on time. She would be thankful for continued support, which would allow her to continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods for her shop

loans.name: Maria Reveca

texts.es:
La Sra. María , tiene 41 años, vive en el Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin , Departamento de San Martin , la socia  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Flores de María II” , es casada ,  presenta estudios de secundaria completa  y tiene 04 hijos , 01  que aun estudia y depende de ella .

Maria, se dedica a la venta de Comidas Preparadas y lleva 10 años en el negocio, se encuentra ubicada en un puesto del Mercado Central, un lugar muy amplio y acondicionado para atender a sus clientes que diariamente acuden. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas,  es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida. Con su primer crédito de 500 Nuevos Soles, compró ingredientes para el preparado de sus comidas como, arroz en kilos, pollos en javas, plátanos en racimos, y parte del dinero lo invirtió en utensilios.  

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza.

Con este crédito  de S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ingredientes para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como, arroz en kilos, aceites en litros, pollos en javas, plátanos , maduros en racimos y también  algunos utensilios, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Marita como le dicen de cariño , se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante, su sueño es tener un Minimarket  y implementar su propia tienda de bebidas gasificadas , muy bien acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and lives in the Tarapoto district, in the San Martin province in the San Martin department. She belongs to the communal bank “Las Flores de María II.” She is married, has completed her secondary education, and has 4 children, 1 who is still in school and dependent. Maria has been selling prepared meals from a place in the Central Market for 10 years. Her place is very large and is equipped to serve the customers who come daily. She tells us that she has very good sales each day; she is well-known, and is very welcoming to her customers. With her first loan of 500 Peruvian soles she bought ingredients to prepare her meals such as kilos of rice, crates of chicken, bunches of bananas and also utensils. Currently she will continue with the same business, and she is very content with the work she does every day. She personally attends to her customers with her characteristic friendliness and charm. With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles she will buy ingredients for the preparation of her meals such as kilos of rice, liters of cooking oil, crates of chicken, bunches of ripe bananas and also some utensils, so that she can better serve her customers. Marita, as they refer to her fondly, feels full of life and has a strong desire to succeed. Her dream is to have a Minimarket, to set up her own well-equipped store selling soft drinks. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movimiento organization for helping her to start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy ingredients for the preparation of her meals

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Julio, tiene 33 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. El socio Julio forma parte del banco comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene un pequeño taller de confección de ropa de lana. El socio y su esposa se dedican a la  confección de chompas, pantalones, chalinas y buzos de lana. Julio requiere el préstamo de los 500 soles, que invertirá en comprar materiales como lana y tela.
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. 

(El distrito peruano de Huancarani es uno de los 6 distritos de la Provincia de Paucartambo, ubicada en el Departamento de Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Julio, age 33, is in a common law marriage and has two children. Julio is a member of the Once de Mayo – Huancarani Communal Bank of the Arariwa Association. He has a small shop where he makes clothes from wool. He and his wife use wool to make sweaters, pants, scarves, and jogging suits. Julio needs a loan for 500 PEN to buy more materials like wool and fabric. He is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and he promises to pay it on time. (The Peruvian district of Huancarani is one of the six districts in the Paucartambo province. It is located in the Cusco department, which belongs to the region of Cusco, Perú.)

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like wool and fabric

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela D. R., vive en el barrio laureles norte, ella es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, tras la falta de trabajo que existía en su ciudad de natal tuvo que emigrar a la capital, ahora ella reside en el barrio Laureles Norte, es madre soltera de 49 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad completamente independientes y que le apoyan económicamente.

Ella trabaja como conserje desde hace 6 años y dentro de sus mayores logros están el terminar de construir su vivienda y morar en un espacio óptimo, seguro y cómodo.  Es por esta razón que ella solicita de este crédito para terminar la construcción de un cuarto que inicio gracias a los préstamos de Kiva, así mismo ella desea continuar con las nuevas remodelaciones y para esto comenzará con la reconstrucción de la cocina de su hogar, estas comodidades le traerán mejores condiciones de vida para ella y sus hijos.

Agradecería se le tomara en cuenta para este préstamo debido a que es una mujer viuda, que tiene un trabajo humilde y que es gracias a  sus hijos que ha podido salir adelante, pero ahora necesita de una mayor inversión para llevar a cabo lo planteado.
texts.en:
Ángela D. R., 49, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is from Estelí but, due to the lack of employment opportunities in her town, had to emigrate to the capital city; now, she lives in Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is a single mother of three, completely independent, adult children who help her out economically. She has worked as a caretaker for 6 years and, among her greatest accomplishments, was finishing building her home and to live in a safe, secure and comfortable space. For this reason, she is asking for funding to complete construction of a room that she was able to start thanks to Kiva loans. She also would like to continue with some new remodeling which will consist in rebuilding the kitchen. These comforts will mean better living conditions for herself and her children. She would appreciate being taken into consideration for this loan because she's a widow with a very humble job. It is thanks to her children that she has been able to make some progress. She now needs a larger investment in order to accomplish all she has planned.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room and remodel the kitchen.

loans.name: Raby

texts.fr: Raby T. est une femme de 58 ans, elle est veuve et mère d'un enfant et a la garde de sa petite fille. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara-Ouest2 depuis 7 ans et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à 14 fois de suite. Son activité est la vente d'arachide, elle collecte son produit à partir des villages environnants pour le revendre au niveau de marchés hebdomadaires. Son objectif est de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins et d'assurer sa nourriture, celle de son enfant et de sa petite fille.
texts.en:
Raby T. is a 58-year-old woman. She is a widow and mother of one child and also takes care of her granddaughter. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de Vélingara-Ouest2 for seven years and has good experience concerning credit, having benefited from it 14 consecutive times. She sells peanuts; she collects her goods from neighboring villages to resell them at the weekly markets. Her goal is to be able to meet her needs and to secure enough food for herself, her child and her granddaughter.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build up her small business

loans.name: Las Momostecas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de señoras,  del paraje Pologuá de la Aldea San Antonio Pasajoc, municipio de  Momostenango  departamento de  Totonicapán, son personas que se conocen, desde hace 5 años han trabajado siempre juntas, en diferentes actividades que se organizan dentro de la comunidad Como por ejemplo Comité de Escuelas en donde estudian sus hijos actividades de la Iglesia en el cual lo integran de la siguiente manera: se cuenta con una justa directiva la cual tienen a su presidenta, Secretaria,  Tesorera: y  la demás son Vocales. Estas cinco  personas se dedican especialmente  a la Crianza de Animales Cerdos, Ovejas, Pollos y una se dedica al Servicio de Alfabetizadora en la Comunidad. Las personas trabajan en su hogar en el Paraje Pologuá, de la Aldea San Antonio Pasajoc Momostenango  se realizo la visita en cada una de sus viviendas y se comprobó la actividad que realizan y se verifico que  tienen mucha experiencia de lo que realizan, por lo que se le considera que son personas responsables y trabajadoras a pesar de no contar con lo suficiente recursos  económicos son personas emprendedoras.

 Las personas  necesitan ampliar sus Capital de Trabajo, por lo que se acercaron a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de Pologuá,  para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de sus familias
texts.en:
This group of ladies from the place Pologuá de la Aldea San Antonio Pasajoc, Momostenango municipality, Totonicapán department, are all known to each other. For 5 years they have always worked together in different activities that they organise within the Como community, such as Comité de Escuelas where their children study, and church activities. They work in the following way: they have a board of directors with a president, secretary and treasurer: the rest are members. These 5 people work especially in raising animals - pigs, sheep, and chickens, and one works for the Servicio de Alfabetizadora in the community. They work in their home in Paraje Pologuá, de la Aldea San Antonio Pasajoc Momostenango. They makes visits to each other's homes and they confirm that they have a lot of experience in the activities that they do. For this they are considered responsible people and hard-working, and apart from not having sufficient economic resources they are enterprising women. The ladies need to increase their working capital, for which reason they approached the officies of the assocation ASDIR de Pologuá to finance their economic activity and in this way improve their living conditions and those of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Idiatou

texts.fr: Idiatou D. est une femme de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 4 ans et demi et a été 9 fois de suite bénéficiaire de prêt et a toujours bien remboursé. Elle fait la vente de tissus teintés et ses bénéfices lui servent à soutenir son mari dans les différentes taches de la famille.
texts.en:
Idiatou D. is a 35 year old woman, she is married with 5 children. She has been a member of "Banc Villageois" for 4 and a half years during which she was awarded 9 loans that she has always well repaid. She sells dyed fabrics and uses her profits to support her husband in the various tasks he handles for the family.

Translated from French by Caroline Mrejen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her buisness

loans.name: Safiétou

texts.fr: Safiétou F. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 6 ans et a capitalisé beaucoup d'expériences en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 12 fois de suite. Elle développe un petit commerce de légumes, de cacahouète et de produits halieutiques. Son objectif est de participer aux différentes charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Safiétou F. is a 52 year old woman. She is married and the mother of 4 children. She has been a member of Villager Bank for the past 6 years and has benefited from her experiences with loans, having received 12 in a row. She is developing a little shop of vegetables, peanuts and seafood. Her goal is to contribute to the various family expenses.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her capitol investment

loans.name: Claudia Judith

texts.es: Claudia Judith L. D. A. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, capital del país. Vive junto a su esposo quien le ayuda en el negocio, y junto a sus tres hijos D. 9 y 4 años D. edad. Claudia posee una panadería, la cual desD. hace nueve años funciona en su casa, su esposo le ayuda a elaborar el pan, que posteriormente sale a repartir a todos sus clientes, incluso al mercado llamado La Tiendona, en donD. obtiene pedidos muy grandes. El deseo D. Claudia es crecer aún más en el negocio, D. manera que pueda atender mayor cantidad D. clientes, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda comprar harina por mayor, levadura y todos los productos que se utilizan para la elaboración del pan, en cantidades grandes para obtenerla a menores precios. Esto sería D. mucho beneficio tanto para su negocio como para su familia quien depenD. absolutamente D. la panadería, ya que esta es la única fuente D. ingresos que poseen, razón por la cual se esfuerza día con día para brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudia Judith L. D. A. is 32 years old and resides in the department of San Salvador, the country's capital. She lives together with her husband who helps her with her business, and their 3 children. Claudia has a bakery which has functioned in her house for 9 years. Her husband helps her to make the bread, and later he leaves to proviD. it to all their customers, including the La Tiendona market, where she obtains large orders. Claudia's wish is to grow her business even more, in a way that allows her to attend to a larger quantity of customers. For this reason she is seeking a loan with which she can buy flour, yeast and all the products she uses to make the bread, in large quantities to obtain smaller prices. This would be of great benefit for her business as her family depends absolutely on the bakery, as it is the only stream of income they possess. This is theb reason why she works each day to proviD. her customers with a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour and other ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Marta Yolanda

texts.es: Marta Yolanda M. D. Q. D. 67 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Arce, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual habita junto a su esposo, un hijo y dos nietos, estos últimos se encuentran al cuidado D. ella, debido a que sus padres residen en el extranjero. Marta se dedica a la venta D. medicinas populares y a la elaboración y comercialización D. manteles, productos los cuales ofrece D. manera ambulante por todas las colonias y cantones D. Ciudad Arce. A pesar D. su avanzada edad, Marta trabaja muy duro caminando grandes kilómetros, con el fin D. poder vender todo su producto y D. esta manera obtener mejores ganancias cada día. A pesar que es un trabajo muy pesado y bastante riesgoso, ella sabe sacar lo positivo D. la situación, incluso cuenta con clientes los cuales la esperan para comprarle medicinas y manteles, debido a que Marta ofrece muy buenos precios. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar tela para la elaboración D. los manteles, así mismo comprar mayor cantidad D. medicinas. Marta es una persona muy humilD., quien es conocida en su lugar D. vivienda por ser muy responsable y buena vecina, así mismo por tener el deseo D. esforzarse por su familia, D. modo que pueda brindarles todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Marta Yolanda M. D. Q. is 67 years old and lives in Arce city, located in La Libertad department. She lives there together with her husband, one son and 2 grandchildren, who are in her care owing to the fact that their parents live overseas. Marta works selling popular medicines and making and selling table cloths, products which she sells door to door in all the districts in Arce. Regardless of her advanced age, Marta works very hard and walks many many kilometres, with the goal of being able to sell all her products and in this way obtain better earnings every day. Apart from the fact that it is very hard work and quite risky, Marta looks on the situation positively, including having clients who wait for her to buy their medicines and table clothes, owing to the fact that she offers very good prices. She is seeking a loan with which she can buy thread to make the table cloths and purchase a larger quantity of medicines. Marta is a very humble person who is known in the area where she lives as being very responsible and a good neighbour. She herself wishes to work hard for her family, to give them everything that is necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase threads and medicines

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Glenda Guadalupe

texts.es: Glenda Guadalupe C. V. de 30 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo, quien es empleado de una empresa privada, y sus dos hijos de 10 y cinco años de edad, los cuales asisten a la escuela de Lourdes Colón. Glenda con el deseo de poder ayudarle a su esposo con lo gastos del hogar, inicio una venta de perfumes para hombres y mujeres, así mismo vende cosméticos de diferentes marcas, dicho negocio esta ubicado en su casa, lugar en el cual tiene mucho clientes quien acuden a ella para comprar sus productos, ya sea para uso personal y para dar como regalo a otras personas. Glenda solicita un préstamo, ya que desea aumentar su inventario, comprando más productos de belleza y de esta manera ofrecerle mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes. Es así como de  esta forma ella desea aprovechar esta época del año en la cual las personas tienen por costumbre dar obsequios a sus seres queridos y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Glenda Guadalupe C. V. is 30 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón, in the department of La Libertad, El Salvador. She lives with her husband, who works at a privately-owned company, and with her two children who are 10 and 5 years old. They attend the public school in Lourdes Colón. Glenda, wanting to help her husband with the household expenses, began to sell men's and women's perfumes. She now sells various types and brand of cosmetics. Glenda runs this business from home, where her many customers go to purchase what she sells, either for their own use or as gifts for others. Glenda is asking for a loan because she wants to increase her inventory and buy more beauty products. This will let her offer a greater number of products to her clients. She wants to take advantage of the Valentine's Day season, when many people are thinking of giving gifts to their loved ones. She believes she can increase sales this way.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago H. G. de 67 años de edad, reside en Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y le ayuda a Santiago con el negocio. Él posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos  y de primera necesidad, la cual ha tratado de mantener siempre con lo esencial para mantener sus ventas. Desde hace 20 años que el posee su negocio, el cual le permitió sacar adelante a sus hijos y poderles brindar una vida digna, por esta misma razón Santiago es una persona muy conocida en el lugar por cotar con muchos años de experiencia, así mismo por brindar precios muy justos y razonables a las personas. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todos los productos necesarios, para poder brindar siempre lo que las personas buscan, productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, pan y otros más los cuales son muy necesarios en el hogar. Santiago desea poder mejorar su negocio, ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos con la que tanto él como su esposa poseen.
texts.en:
Santiago H. G., who is 67 years old, resides in Ilopango, located in the Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife, who is a homemaker and helps Santiago with the business. He has a store in which he sells perishable goods and basic needs products. He tries to always stock essential goods in order to keep up his sales. He has owned his business for 20 years, and it has allowed him to improve his children's situation and offer them a respectable life. Santiago is well known in the area for having many years of experience and for offering fair and reasonable prices to his customers. He is requesting a loan, through which he will be able to purchase the products he needs to always have in stock what his customers are looking for: products such as rice, beans, sugar, salt, bread and other necessary household items. Santiago hopes to be able to improve his business, since it is the only source of income that he and his wife possess.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishable goods

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma  M. G. de 34 años de edad, reside en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus tres hijos de 11, 10 y 9 años de edad, los cuales dependen por completo de ella, ya que Irma es madre soltera, quien no recibe ningún tipo de ayuda por parte del padre de sus hijos. Es por esta razón que ella trabaja muy duro para poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus tres hijos, los cuales le ayudan en el negocio y también se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en el mercado de la Colonia Las Margaritas, ubicada en el Municipio de Soyapango, su negocio es uno de los más surtidos y que cuenta con mayor cantidad de clientes, tanto por su excelente servicio como por sus precios accesibles. Irma solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para invertir más en su negocio, aumentando la cantidad de cada producto, y de esta manera poder atender a mayor cantidad de clientes. Ella es una mujer muy responsable quien se siente muy agradecida por el hecho de poder contar con un negocio propio el cual le permita brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irma M. G., 34, lives in Soyapango, San Salvador department with her three children, who are 11, 10, and 9 years old. They are completely dependent on her because Irma is a single mother who doesn't receive any help from the father of her children. For this reason, she works very hard to provide her three children with all they need. They, besides going to school, help her out in her business, which is a small grocery store located ín the market of Soyapango's Las Margaritas neighborhood. Her store is one of the best stocked ones so she has many customers thanks both to her excellent customer service and for her fair prices. Irma is asking for funding to invest in stock items for her store, increasing the amounts on-hand of each item so that she can take care of a larger number of custoemrs. She is a very responsible woman who is very grateful that she can have her own business that allows her to provide for her children's every need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es: José Mario C. G. de 52 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Soyapango lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. José Mario posee un taller de marroquinería, en el cual se encarga de elaborar productos de cuero como carteras, billeteras y cinchos. Este es un trabajo artesanal el cual tiene gran valor, es por esto que José cuenta con varios clientes quienes le compran su producto por mayoreo, lo cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para vivir y sostener su hogar. Es por esta razón por la cual él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de cuero, de manera que pueda obtenerlo a menores precios y así obtener más ganancias. José es una persona quien trabaja mucho para poder brindarle todo lo mejor a su esposa, es por ello que se mantiene firme en su negocio tratando de sostenerlo y seguir adelante con el.
texts.en:
José Mario C. G., 52, lives in Soyapango with his wife, who is a housewife. José Mario owns a leatherworks shop where he makes such things as: wallets, billfolds and belts. This is a highly-valued artesanal work. José, therefore, has several regular customers who buy from him at wholesale which provides him with enough income to live and support his household. He is asking for funding to buy larger amounts of leather so that he can get it at a better price and thus earn higher profits. José is a person who works very hard to provide the best for his wife so he stands firm in his work doing all he can to support it and succeed with it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather.

loans.name: Nery Cecilia

texts.es: Nery Cecilia M. A. de 47 años de edad, posee una venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, ganchos para el cabello, mochilas y otros productos más. Desde hace 10 años que ella cuenta con este negocio, gracias al cual ha logrado sacar adelante a su hija y brindarle la ayuda necesaria de manera económica a su esposo, los cuales residen junto a ella en el municipio de Soyapango, lugar en el cual esta ubicado su negocio. Nery solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio y de esta misma manera comprar nuevos productos como papelería y accesorios escolares, lo cual se vende mucho. Nery siempre se ha destacado por ser muy visionaria, quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecino quienes aseguran que es una persona quien trabaja mucho y se esfuerza por mejorar su negocio cada día, todo con el fin de mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Nery Cecilia M. A., 47, sells clothing, shoes, cosmetics, hairpins, backpacks and many other items. She has had this business for 10 years and it has allowed her to raise her daughter and help her husband economically; they live with her in Soyapango, which is where her business is located. Nery needs funding to stock her business, in particular with new items, like stationery and school supplies, which sell very well. Nery has always been very visionary and has very good references from her neighbors, who attest to the fact that she is a hard-worker who strives daily to improve her business in order to better her family's economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stationery and school supplies.

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es: Julia Mercedes C. D. L. D. 33 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, junto a sus tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y a ayudar a su madre con el negocio, ya que ella es madre soltera, y es la única que trabaja por el bienestar D. sus hijos y no posee ningún tipo D. ayuda, razón por la cual sus hijos le ayudan con el negocio. DesD. hace 20 años que Julia posee una venta D. frutas y verduras, ubicada en el mercado Central D. San Salvador, uno D. los mercados  más grandes D. la capital del país, en el cual las personas en su mayoría compran por mayor los productos. Esto es D. mucho beneficio para Julia, quien trabaja arduamente para llevar el sustento diario a sus hijos. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar frutas y verduras por mayor, así D. esta manera podrá surtir sus productos asegurando mayor cantidad D. clientes.
texts.en:
Julia Mercedes C. D. L., 33, lives in San Salvador department with her three, minor children. The children are all in school and they help their mother with her work because she's a single mother and she's the only one working for the well-being of her children; she receives no help of any kind, so the children need to assist her. Julia has sold fruits and vegetables in San Salvador's central market, one of the capital city's largest, for 20 years. Most of the customers here buy at wholesale. This is of great benefit for Julia, who works hard to support her children. She is asking for funding to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale so that she can stock her products thereby assuring a larger number of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia M. Z. de 48 años de edad, reside en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su hijo de 17 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. María posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos comestibles y de primera necesidad para el hogar. Desde ya hace varios años que cuenta con este negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar, así como para poder pagar la mensualidad de su casa, la cual ha estado pagando durante 10 años, y que es la herencia que con todo su esfuerzo dará a su único hijo. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir aún más en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de productos que ya posee y  agregando otros los cuales sus clientes solicitan. Para María es de mucha importancia mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y así mismo sus ganancias ya que es ella la única que vela por el bienestar de su hogar y el de su hijo, a quien con muchos esfuerzos esta logrando darle todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
María Eugenia M. Z., 48, lives in Soyapango, San Salvador department, with her 17-year-old son, who is a student. María has a grocery store where she stocks food and basic needs items for the home. She has had this business for several years now and it provides enough for her to support her household, includng her monthly house payment, which she has been paying for 10 years. She makes this effort because this will be the only asset she will be able to pass on to her son. María is asking for funding to better stock her store. She wants to buy a larger variety of items than what she currently stocks, adding products that her customers request. For María, it's very important to improve the conditions of her business and thus her profits because she alone cares for the well-being of her home and her son, to whom she is managing to give, with great effort, all he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Dina Saraí

texts.es: Dina Saraí L. D. C. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo, quien se dedica a trabajar como motorista del transporte público y junto a cuatro hijos todos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Dina posee un tienda en la cual comercializa diversos productos como alimentos, golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos y otros más, los cuales son muy necesario en el hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos perecederos los cuales pueda ofrecer a sus clientes. Esto lo hace con el fin D. poder aumentar sus ventas y D. esta manera poder brindarles mayores beneficios a sus cuatro hijos. Tanto Dina como su esposo son personas muy trabajadoras y respetadas por contar con muy buenos valores y por ser personas quienes se esfuerzan mucho por el bienestar y estabilidad D. su hogar.
texts.en:
Dina Saraí L. D. C., 32, lives in Soyapango, San Salvador department, with her husband, who is a public transportation driver, and their four, minor childlren, who are students. Dina has a small store where she sells various products like food, sweets, detergent, basic grains, etc. which are needed in the home. She is asking for funding in order to buy larger quantities of her basic stock items to offer her customers. She does this in order to increase her sales to proviD. more benefits for her four children. Dina and her husband are very hard-working and respected people because they have very good values and because they are people who make every effort for the well-being and stability of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Niño Ismael Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Niño Ismael está ubicado en el departamento D. Huancavelica, su actividad principal es la artesanía y el comercio. Inicia su segundo ciclo con un total D. 12 socias

Carmen, es soltera y tiene un hijo D. 5 años, después D. terminar sus estudios Carmen se prestó dinero D. sus padres para invertir en un negocio D. ventas D. útiles escolares, su mamá la invitó a participar en el bancomunal porque es socia antigua. DesD. que está en FINCA sus ventas han aumentado, porque pueD. invertir más dinero en su negocio, ha aprendido a ahorrar. El préstamo que solicita ahora le permitirá comprar una fotocopiadora y surtir su negocio D. cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros, colores y todo tipo D. útiles, para iniciar la campaña escolar. El sueño D. Carmen es tener su casa propia y su negocio propio.

Vilma, es casada tiene 3 hijos D. 16, 22 y  24  años, es su bancomunal aprendió a ahorrar, inició su negocio vendiendo ropa, gracias a los préstamos recibidos ha podido comprar estantes, ahora tambien venD. joyas, regalos y perfumes, ahora quiere aprovechar la campaña escolar e invertir e nuevo préstamo en la venta D. uniformes.

Mariluz, es soltera tiene un hijo D. 4 años, se inició en los negocios vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, no tenía mucho capital y no recibía apoyo D. ninguna entidad financiera, una amiga le invitó a participar en los bancomunales D. FINCA, gracias a los préstamos tiene un poco mas D. capital, que lo invierte en la venta D. mercería como útiles, ganchos, peines, espejos y jabones. Con el préstamo solicitado comprará loncheras escolares y algunos juego didácticos. Su sueño es tener una joyería granD..
texts.en:
The Niño Ismael communal bank is located in the Department of Huancavelica. Its members' main activities are handicrafts and sales. It is starting its second loan cycle with a total of 12 members. Carmen is single and has a 5-year-old child. After finishing her studies, Carmen borrowed money from her parents to invest in a business selling school supplies. Her mother, who is a longtime member of the communal bank, invited Carmen to participate. During her time with FINCA, Carmen's sales have increased, because she can invest more money in her business, and she has learned to save. The loan she is now requesting will permit her to buy a photocopier and to stock her business with notebooks, pencils, pencil holders, drawing supplies and all types of useful products for the beginning of the school season. Carmen's dream is to have her own house and her own shop. Vilma is married and has 3 children, aged 16, 22 and 24. The communal bank, has helped her learn how to save. She started a business selling clothes, and thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to buy shelves. Now she also sells jewelry, gifts and perfumes, and she would like to take advantage of the school season and invest the funds from the new loan in school uniforms to sell. Mariluz is single and has a 4-year-old child. She started a business selling cosmetics by catalog. She did not have much capital and did not receive support from any financial institution until a friend invited her to participate in the FINCA communal banks. Thanks to the loans, she has a little more capital, which she has invested in merchandise to sell, such as school supplies, hair clips, combs, mirrors and soaps. With the current loan, she will buy student lunchboxes and some educational games. Her dream is to have a large jewelry store.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise such as school supplies

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo Q. es un hombre trabajador de una maquiladora y esta preocupado por el bienestar de su familia.
