When his wife washes the clothes, they get wet with the rains, and it is more difficult for the clothes to dry. They have to put the clothes insiD. the house, and it takes up a lot of space. Andrés sees what his wife struggles with, and that is why he wants to finish his project to give his wife a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a roof

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime Alemán tiene 13 años viviendo es su casita que recibió por su largo esfuerzo de haber trabajado esta es de interés social, aunque Jaime ya hace tiempo le hizo mejoras al frente de su casa  pues la pintura se esta deteriorando y dar mantenimiento a las paredes. El quiere un crédito para comprar lo necesario para empezar hacer las mejoras y dar una buena vista a su casa. 
El es una persona trabajadora y desde hace 23 años trabaja en un hotel muy conocido de la ciudad, de esta manera el recibe ingresos para el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Jaime Alemán has been living in his home for the past 13 years, which he received for his hard and long effort working. The home is from the public housing project. A while ago he did some improvement to the house, but now the front of the house's paint is deteriorating and the walls need up keeping. He wants a loan to purchase what is needed to begin home improvements and make his home look better. He is a very hard working person and for the past 23 years he has worked in a well known hotel in town, which is how he receives an income to keep his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home maintenance

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y dos de  sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo y comida en un puesto ubicado en los exteriores del mercado central del distrito de Cayaltí. Ella nos comenta que ya tiene más de 15 años en el negocio y que empezó vendiendo carne de pollo y frutas. Tuvo que dejar de vender frutas debido a la amplia oferta de la zona y entonces se decidió por vender comida.

Su rutina laboral empieza desde las siete de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde. Los platos que más ofrece son caldos de gallina y ceviche. Agustina desea ampliar su negocio de venta de carne de pollo pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es adquirir una mototaxi para seguir ayudando a la economía del hogar y a la educación de sus hijas que ya están estudiando en un instituto de la zona. Ella es una mujer alegre, laboriosa y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Agustina is a 55-year-old mother who lives with her husband and two of their four children in the Cayaltí district, an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She sells chicken meat and prepared foods from a stall located on the outer edge of the Cayaltí central market. She tells us that she has had this business for more than 15 years, and that she began by selling chicken meat and fruit. She had to stop selling fruit due to the large supply in the area, and she decided then to sell prepared foods. Her work day lasts from seven in the morning until one in the afternoon. The dishes she sells most are chicken soups and ceviche. Agustina wants to expand her chicken meat business, but she does not have enough capital to carry out this plan, which is why she is for the first time asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 soles. Her greatest desire is to acquire a moto-taxi (a motorcycle with added passenger seating) so she can continue helping with the household finances and the education of her daughters, who are studying at an area school. She is a happy, hardworking and enterprising woman.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken meat to expand business

loans.name: Freddy Zamir

texts.es: El joven Freddy
texts.en: Young Freddy

loans.use: Purchase materials for making home improvements (zinc, cement, sand, and wood)

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad Q. is a 37-year-old man who works as a car repair specialist. He is married and has three children who are the meaning of his life.

Mahammad started his business when he was 18 and since that time he has become very experienced in his job and has gained respect among local people. His garage is never empty.

The tools Mahammad uses are old and he needs to purchase new and more modern tools. For this purpose he applied for 1,600 AZN. Mahammad counts on your help.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for car repair

loans.name: Oneyda María

texts.es:
La señora Oneyda María N. E., trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chinandega, es Auditor fiscal, todavía está en la universidad estudia administración de empresas, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres.
Ella solicito el crédito para ayudarles a sus padres a realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda por que todos viven juntos y aportan un granito de arena.
texts.en:
Sra. Oneyda María N. E. works for the City of Chinandega as a financial auditor. She is still a university student who is studying for a degree in business administration. Oneyda is single, does not have children, and lives with her parents.

The loan she is requesting will be used to help her parents with some home improvements. Since they all live together, she would like to make a small contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor to make improvements to her parents' house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Banco Mujer El Angel Gabriel (1) Group

texts.en:
The name of this group translates as ¨The Women´s Bank The Angel Gabriel¨. This group of women live in the rural community of Corredores, Puntarenas, in the southern part of Costa Rica, located near the Panamanian border. The group members are involved in various productive economic activities including taxi driving, food sales, running a restaurant, natural medicine sales, sewing and running a corner store. The women plan to use this loan to make general investments towards the expansion of their businesses.

Margarita E. A. is a 44-year-old single mother of four. She is a taxi driver and plans to use this loan to make improvements to her taxicab. Her working hours are from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. but she sometimes works longer. She spends her days driving around the streets of Corredores.

Margarita’s goal is to expand her business  and she hopes to secure more clients and increase revenues. She respects the fact that the most important service she can provide to her clients is punctuality. She associates the name of her group with the bible. She hopes her group will expand in the future.

Erica N. B. is a 21-year-old woman who runs a restaurant with her mother. With this loan, she plans to invest in the family restaurant through the purchase of fast foods, cooking ingredients and various other restaurant items. Five days a week, Erica wakes up at 8 a.m., gets to work at 10 a.m., and works until 6 p.m. Her favorite part of the job is attending to clients.

Erica´s goals are to improve the restaurant and to provide higher quality food products in order to expand her client base. She wants her family to be prosperous and hopes to one day own a little house. Her main obstacles are financial: the high costs of living and of products coupled with a lull in the number of people eating out (as opposed to cooking at home) has made business a challenge for Erica. Nevertheless, she remains optimistic, stating: ¨with strength and a positive attitude, we will overcome these obstacles.¨ With respect to group dynamics, she observes that the members are part of a good group; they understand each other, help each other and are very sociable.

Jessica N. B. is a 23-year-old mother who sells natural medicines and cosmetics with her business partner. Though Jessica is not the owner of the business, she hopes to one day open her own business selling natural medicinal products.

In order to purchase medicines, Jessica travels roughly six hours, one way, to the capital city, San Jose. The cosmetics she sells from a catalogue by visiting potential clients in her community and offering them various items. Jessica will use this loan to purchase medicinal and cosmetic products to sell in her community. Some of her most popular items are natural products which facilitate weight loss.

Jessica´s aspires to finish her degree in Business Administration. She mentions the fact that the business is not her own as a limitation she must deal with.

loans.use: To make improvements to her taxi

loans.name: Salvadora De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Salvadora de Jesús Z., trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chinandega, es operaria de Limpieza, le toca barrer calles todas las madrugadas, al medio día y por las tardes.
Ella solicito el crédito para reparar su casita donde vive con sus cuatro hijos, pero solo dos dependen de ella, con el crédito que le facilitamos compro zinc, cemento hierro y clavos, siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora y muy trabajadora para poder llevar el sustento de todos los días a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Salvadora de Jesús Z. works for the City of Chinandega as a sanitation operator. She sweeps the streets at dawn, at noon, and in the evenings.

The loan she is requesting will be used to repair her small house where she lives with her four dependent children. Salvadora will buy zinc, cement, iron, and nails. She has always been a determined and hardworking woman who looks to support her young children on a daily basis.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc, cement, iron, and nails

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Mario H. E. es taxista tiene carro propio tiene 6 años de trabajar como taxista, el dinero los solicita para compra de un juego de llantas, es casado tiene cuatro hijos, ha tenido 3 créditos con Ceprodel y si le han impactado los crédito ya que se ha ayudado en poner en marcha su taxi y así no atrasarse en su trabajo y poder tener sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sr. Mario H. E. has been working as a taxi driver for six years and has his own vehicle. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase a set of tires. Mario is married and has four children. He has received three previous loans with CEPRODEL. The impact of each loan has helped keep his taxi business in operation so that he does not fall behind in his work and still generate an income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a set of tires

loans.name: Santos Alfredo

texts.es:
Es Sr. Santos Alfredo L. C. es conductor en n organismo internacional en el departamento de Estelí. El solicita un crédito el que será utilizado en la matricula de la universidad de su hija menor, ya que su hija esta cursando el quinto año de universidad y que así ella logre ser una profesional.

El empezó a trabajar como conductor en un organismo internacional que se dedica a la conservación y buen uso de el agua, antes que el se dedicara a esta labor era conductor en una institución del estado. Cabe señalar que el Sr. Santos L. a trabajado como conductor para dicho organismo desde hace tres años, el trabaja todos los días de lunes a sábado desde las 7 de la mañana y no tiene hora de salida ya que es un trabajó muy pesado y a veces tienen que trabajar fuera de horario para cumplir metas.

El espera que con dicho crédito su hija lleve a cabo y logre matricularse en el quinto año de su universidad y así logre ser una profesional y obtener sus metas en un fututo así como ser una persona totalmente independiente.

Santos Alfredo L.  es originario de este municipio, casado y con dos hijas una de ellas es independiente y su hija menor es estudiante aun y vive con el.

Este es el tercer crédito que ha tenido en un periodo de 6 años, Santos L. dice que con los crédito que a obtenido en Ceprodel a llevado a cabo algunos proyectos que por cuenta propia no los hubiese realizado ya que los ingresos mensuales de el son  bajo y no suficiente para realizar dichos proyectos por cuenta propia por lo que se muestra agradecido con Ceprodel.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos Alfredo L. C. works in the Department of Estelí as a driver for an international organization. He is requesting a loan to pay for the college registration fees of his youngest daughter. She is starting her fifth year of university and hopes to become a professional.

He began working as a driver for an international organization dedicated to water conservation and management. Previously, Santos worked as a driver for a state institution. It should be noted that Santos began working for his current employer three years ago. He works every day, Monday through Saturday, starting at 7am. There is no established time to go home because his workload is very heavy and sometimes requires him to work after hours to meet his deadlines.

Santos hopes that this loan will help his daughter complete her registration so that she can start her fifth year of college. She has future aspirations of becoming a professional and a totally independent person.

Santos Alfredo L. is a native of this city, married, and has two daughters. One is independent and the the other one is a student and still lives at home. This is the third loan he has received within the past six years. Santos says that with the loans he has received from CEPRODEL, he has been able to undertake a few projects on his own. Since these projects would not be possible because of his low monthly salary, Santos says he is grateful to CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for his daughter's college registration expenses

loans.name: Banco Mujer El Angel Gabriel (2) Group

texts.en:
The name of this group translates as ¨The Women´s Bank The Angel Gabriel¨. This group of women is from Corredores, Puntarenas, located in the southern part of Costa Rica, a rural town located near the Panamanian border. The two group members are involved in different productive economic activities including catalogue clothing and hot food sales. These women plan to use this loan to make general investments towards the expansion of their businesses. 

Xinia Maria M. is a 33-year-old single mother of three who sells clothing items from door to door in her community. She hopes to use this loan to invest in her business: specifically, the loan will increase her working capital and allow her to purchase more products, enabling her to service more clients and expand her business.

Xinia travels throughout her community, offering catalogue items to potential clients. Clients peruse the catalogue and place orders through Xinia who then purchases the requested items and later delivers them to the homes of her clients. Xinia receives payment upon delivery, which is why she is applying for a loan: to fund the purchase of requested items.

Xinia´s goal is to sell more products and increase her base of loyal clients. She mentions as an obstacle the fact that there are many other women in her community engaged in catalogue sales: the competition for clients is fierce. 

Maria Isabel C. is a 45-year-old mother of five who produces hot food items such as tamales (steam-cooked corn dough wrapped in banana leaves) and empanadas (stuffed bread or pastry). She will use this loan to make necessary investments enabling her to launch a sales business in her community.

Maria´s goals are to ¨prosper, expand and do better.¨ Joining this group signifies a new source of support for Maria.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora María Magdalena T. P. se dedica a venta de ropa, zapatos, prendas  de plata por encargo, es casada su esposo tiene un taller de mecánica, La señora no tiene tramo fijo pero sale  a ofrecer su producto a la casa de sus clientes, tiene 4 hijos, sus dos hijos varones le ayudan en el taller a su papa y sus dos hijas mujeres le ayudan a ella a regar su mercadería.

Este es su segundo crédito con Ceprodel, a pesar que tiene la ayuda de su esposo le gusta depender por sí misma y tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
María Magdalena T. P. works selling clothes, shoes and silver jewelry in response to customer orders. She is married, and her husband has a mechanic's workshop. María does not have a fixed sales route, but she goes out to her customers' homes to offer her products. She has 4 children; her two sons help their father in his workshop, while her two daughters help her prepare her merchandise. This is her second loan with Ceprodel; although she receives help from her husband, she likes to be self-sufficient and run her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing, shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Mi Progreso De San Jose Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mi Progreso D. San José, inicia su tercer ciclo con 16 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. artesanía, verduras, panes, lana, abarrotes en general, comida, animales menores y transporte.

Como es el caso D. la señora Juana que es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Juana venD. verduras en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza todos los días, Juana necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. verduras.

Mientras que Yuly es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Yuly venD. mazamorras en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, Yuly necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, gas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 1050 soles  haciendo un total D. 8,550 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, verduras, gas, lana, tintes, panes.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios, tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Mi Progreso D. San Jose" (My St. Joseph's Progress) starts its third cycle with 16 members. The members have different business activities such as the sale of crafts, vegetables, bread, wool, groceries, food, small animals and transportation. Such is the case of Juana, who is married, 50 years old and has five children, Juana sells vegetables in the market Nery Garcia, activity that she does every day; Juana needs a loan of 300 soles to invest in buying vegetables. On the other hand, Yuly has a partner, is 30 years old and has 1 child, Yuly sells "mazamorras" (a Peruvian pudding) from home, activity that she does every day; Yuly needs a loan of 600 soles that will be invested in buying sugar and gas. The members need different amounts of loans such as 300, 450, 600 and 1050 soles making a total of 8,550 soles in loans at the Community Bank. Their loans will be invested in buying rice, sugar, vegetables, gas, wool, dye and bread. The members' dreams are that their children become professionals, improve their businesses and have a house of their own.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, vegetables, gas, wool, dye and bread.

loans.name: Justo Pastor

texts.es:
El señor Justo Pastor A. L., Trabaja Para la Alcaldía de Chinandega, Es soltero y actualmente está estudiando, trabaja como operario de maquinaria   ( patrolero).
Este crédito lo solicito para realizar unas reparaciones en su vivienda y lleva cinco años trabajando con Ceprodel, ha tenido un excelente record crediticio, este financiamiento le ha beneficiado para mejorar su condición de vida y salir adelante sin complicaciones
texts.en:
Justo Pastor A. L. works for the municipality of Chinandega. He is single and is currently in school. He works as a (petroleum) machine operator. He is requesting this loan in order to make some repairs to his home. He has worked with Ceprodel for five years and has an excellent credit record. The financing he has received has helped him improve his standard of living and to make progress in life without complications.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials: metal beams, iron and zinc

loans.name: Gerardo Marcelino

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo M. L. es trabajador del Minsa Posoltega desde hace 21 años donde se desempeña como Técnico ETV para sector rural. Es casado y con un hijo bajo su cargo el cual esta en la universidad. 
Marcelino trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 4 años y con 5 créditos otorgados hasta la fecha, los cuales ha solicitado para mejoramiento de vivienda
texts.en:
Mr. Gerardo M. L. has worked at Minsa Posoltega for 21 years. He is an ETV technician for the rural sector. He is married with one son under his charge, currently a student at the university. Marcelino has worked with CEPRODEL for 4 years with 5 loans granted to the present, all solicited for the improvement of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MATERIALS FOR HOME IMPROVEMENT (CEMENT, SAND) PLUS LABOR

loans.name: Carmelitas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Carmelitas, inicia su segundo ciclo con 16 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. emoliente, comidas, mercería, verduras, abarrotes en general, ropa, golosinas, bebidas, leña y transporte.

Como es el caso D. la señora Elsa es viuda, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Elsa venD. emoliente, bebida caliente con propiedades curativas, actividad que realiza todos los días en el mercado 12 D. abril. Elsa necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar y hierbas.

Mientras que Olga es casada, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Olga venD. comida en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, Olga necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 750 soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 10,100 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, hierbas, ropa, galletas, gaseosas, verduras.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener casa propia, ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Las Carmelitas,” is beginning its second cycle with 16 members. The members all have different businesses like: selling drinks (special Peruvian drinks), food, haberdashery, vegetables, groceries, clothing, sweets, drinks, firewood, and transportation services. In Mrs. Elsa’s case, she is a widow, 40 years old, and has three children. Elsa sells drinks and hot drinks with healing properties. She works in the April 12 market every day. Elsa needs a loan of 1000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of sugar and herbs. Meanwhile, Olga is married, 34 years old, and has a son. Olga sells food from her home everyday. Olga needs a loan of 900 soles which she will invest in buying rice and sugar. The members each need different loan amounts like: 300 soles, 600soles, 750 soles, 1000 soles making a total of 10,100 soles of loans for the communal bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, herbs, clothing, cookies, sodas, and vegetables. The members dream of having their own homes, growing their businesses, and for their children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, herbs, clothing, cookies, sodas, and vegetables.

loans.name: Petronila Fátima

texts.es:
La Señora Petronila Fátima P., es soltera, tiene cuatro hijos, ninguno a depende de ella, se dedica a elaborar refrescos naturales, vende  hielo, gaseosas y pan en su misma casa de habitación.
La señora Fátima anteriormente le trabaja al estado, pero se retiro para dedicarse a  su propio negocio, llena tres años y medio de trabajar con Ceprodel, quien  a demostrada ser una persona emprendedora y responsable.
texts.en:
Petronila Fátima P. is single and has 4 children, none of whom are dependent upon her. She makes natural drinks, and sells ice, soft drinks and bread from her own house. Fátima used to work for the state but she retired in order to dedicate her time to her own business. She has worked with CEPRODEL for 3 ½ years, and has shown herself to be an enterprising and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRODUCTS TO USE IN MAKING NATURAL DRINKS

loans.name: Daniel Santos

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel C. A. trabaja para el minsa, el dinero los solicita para compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, Perlines, Cemento, hierro y madera para remodelar su casa, es casado le tiene 3 hijos dos en edad escolar, tiene cuatro años de trabajar con Ceprodel ha tenido 5 crédito con nosotros, y si le han ayudado mucho los crédito que a tenido ya que a podido ir poco a  poco mejorando su casa y comprando los electrodomésticos necesario para su casa.
texts.en:
Daniel C. A. works for MINSA. He requests the money for purchase of construction materials such as: zinc, beams, cement, iron and wood to remodel his house. He is married and has three children, two of them school-aged. He has been working with Ceprodel for four years. He has had 5 loans with us, and the loans he's had have helped him a lot since, little by little, he has been able to improve his house and buy necessary electrical appliances for it.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of cement, sand and iron

loans.name: Dimas Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Dimas G. A. es profesor de primaria de una escuelita, el dinero los solicita para compra de un terrero para hacer su casa ya que vive en terrero de sus suegro y quiere independizarse, estado civil acompañado es padre un bebe de 5años ya ha tenido 11 créditos con nosotros y si le han ayudado de mucho en su vida familiar a podido hacerse de todas sus electrodomésticos de su casa y ahora quiere compra este terrero y después hacer otro crédito para empezar a construir.
texts.en:
Dimas G. A. is a teacher in a small primary school. The money he is requesting is to buy a piece of land for a house. He lives on his in-laws' land, and he wants to become independent. He has a life partner and a five year old baby. He has had 11 loans with us, and they have helped his family life a lot. He has been able to get all the domestic appliances for his house. He now wants to buy this land and later get another loan to start building.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Pedro Joaquín

texts.es:
La señor Pedro Joaquín E. E.  es originaria del municipio de condega el va usar el crédito para comprar lo útiles  escolares  y matricula de sus hijos solicita el crédito porque no tiene todo el dinero para  hacerlo actualmente  y desea matricular a sus hijos sin que ellos tengan ninguna dificultad al empezar el año escolar también tomara parte del dinero para que su esposa  trabaje en su negocio como lo es venta de granos básicos su esposa trabaja con su papa en una camioneta.   

Pedro es trabajador de la universidad agropecuaria del trópico seco ucatse desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad tiene mas de 6 años de estar trabajando para la universidad y toda la vida se a dedicado a este tipo de trabajo el espera que el crédito le sirva de mucho ya que resolverá sus problemas persónales.
 
Pedro es casado   y tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar los cuatro están bajo su cargo estudiando actualmente  en el nivel de primaria sus padres no viven con el pero  se mantiene al pendiente de ellos  este es el primer crédito que se le otorga a Pedro y expresa que quedara agradecido con ceprodel por la ayuda que se le esta brindando ya que le ayudara a solucionar los problemas  que tiene por ahora y expresa que es la primera ves que el contrae una deuda y espera salir bien para seguir trabajando y no manchar su record crediticio y de esta manera dejar una buena imagen con ceprodel para que en un futuro se le siga atendiendo de igual forma.
texts.en:
Pedro Joaquín E. E. is from the Condega municipality. He will use the loan to buy school supplies and to enroll his children. He is asking for the loan because he does not have all the money to do so now. He wants to enroll his children so that they do not have any difficulty starting the school year. He will also take part of the money so that his wife can work in her business selling basic grains. His wife works selling potatoes in a van. Pedro is a workman for the Catholic Agricultural University of Trópico Seco (UCATSE). He has worked as a security guard for the university for over six years. He has done this type of work all of his life. He expects that the loan will be of much use; it will resolve his personal problems. Pedro is married and has four school-age children in his care. They go to school and are currently in the primary grades. His parents do not live with him, but he continues to look after them. This is Pedro’s first loan. He says that he will remain grateful to Ceprodel for the help they are offering him. It will help him solve the problems he now has. It is the first time that he has contracted a debt, and he expects to do well in order to keep working and not mar his credit record. That way he will make a good impression with Ceprodel, and they will continue taking care of him in the same manner in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for pre-registration, registration, and school supplies for his children

loans.name: Magaly Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Magaly del Socorro V., trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chinandega, es operaria de limpieza ubicada en el mercado el bisnes casada, su esposo también trabaja para la Alcaldía de Chinandega, tiene tres hijos todos en edad escolar.
La señora Magaly se ha ayudado enormemente con los créditos en Ceprodel porque  ha podido levantar poco a poco su casa, para brindarle a sus hijos un hogar digno.
texts.en:
Mrs. Magaly del Socorro V. works for the Chinandega mayor's office as a custodian. The office is located in the marketplace of El Bisne. Magaly is married, and her husband also works for the mayor's office. They have three children, all of school age. With loans from Ceprodel, Magaly has helped herself enormously, because little by little she has been able to construct her house, providing her children with a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheets of zinc, cement, iron, and two wooden doors

loans.name: Xenia Guadalupe

texts.es:
La joven Xenia Díaz es Maestra de Educación Primaria desde hace 9 años y la cual tiene a su cargo a los niños de preescolar, pertenece a la Escuela los Laureles ubicada en la comarca Sirama de donde ella es originaria, ella es casada, mayor de edad y con un niño de 2 años de edad.

Expresa estar contenta con la institución Ceprodel porque le ha permitido poco a poco mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y mejorar su nivel de vida con cada uno de los créditos que se le han otorgado, hasta la fecha han sido 3 crédito, ya que ella esta con Ceprodel desde hace 2 años.
texts.en:
The young Xenia D. has been an elementary school teacher for nine years and also takes care of preschool children. She works at Los Laureles school, located in the Sirama region, where she is originally from. She is married and has a 2-year-old son. She is very content with the Ceprodel institution, because it has allowed her, little by little, to improve the conditions of her home and her quality of life with each of the loans it has granted her. So far, she has received three credits, and has been with Ceprodel for two years.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials (cement, timber, and zinc)

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres,  Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 45 años y es madre de 02 hijos  todos independientes, la socia presenta Secundaria Completa.

Rosa Victoria, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comidas en su distrito, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero y ahora se dedica a la confección de vestidos y sabanas,  queriendo implementar su pequeño taller de costura y teniendo habilidad  para este tipo de actividad, no dudo en hacerlo y gracias al apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, logro implementarlo se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

En la actualidad continua con su nuevo negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa, para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de maquina, blondas de colores  alfileres, botones.

Rosa Victoria, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de salir adelante, su sueño es seguir creciendo y tener un local más amplio. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Victoria belongs to the communal bank "Honestidad y Trabajo" in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Caceres, and department of San Martin. She is single, 45 years old, and the mother of two children, both of them independent. Previously, Rosa Victoria made a living by selling food in her district. Little by little, she generated her own income and saved money, and now she makes dresses and sheets for a living. She wanted to set up a sewing workshop, and since she had the ability to perform this activity, she had no doubts about doing it. Thanks to the support of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she managed to establish her workshop in her own house, with an atmosphere very well suited for attending to her clients. She works with requests from her clients and tells us that her sales are going very well. Currently, she is continuing with her new business and already has a loyal clientele who goes to her house on a daily basis to make requests. She attends to them personally with the kind of friendliness that is characteristic of her. With this loan of 1,500 Nuevos Soles, she will purchase different types of fabric by the meter and supplies such as scissors, needles, colored silk lace, pins, and buttons. Rosa Victoria feels that she is an accomplished woman, with a great desire to get ahead. Her dream is to continue growing and to have a larger work space. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fabrics in different colors and sizes

loans.name: Evelyn Alicia

texts.es:
U. R. EVELYN ALICIA


Evelyn es una madre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto  a su esposo y a su hijo de 9 años de edad en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a vender jugos naturales de fruta en la plaza de armas de la ciudad en donde vive. Ella nos comenta que el negocio empezó hace 8 años y estaba a cargo de su madre, luego de un tiempo su madre la dejó a cargo de el y con mucho esfuerzo lo hizo crecer. Evelyn nos dice que poco a poco pudo comprar una carpa y una vitrina para poder mostrar pasteles preparados por ella misma, los cuales también gozan de buena acogida por parte de sus clientes.

Evelyn utiliza las ganancias obtenidas del negocio en la ayuda de la economía de su familia, su esposo trabaja en la empresa agrícola de la zona, y también apoya al sostenimiento de su madre. La creciente demanda por su negocio, propia de la época de verano, ha hecho que piense en ampliar su negocio, por lo que se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de frutas, vasos de vidrio y una nueva vitrina.

Ella es una mujer alegre, dinámica y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es poder tener su casa propia ya que viven en una alquilada.
texts.en:
U. R. EVELYN ALICIA Evelyn, 27, lives with her husband and 9-year-old son in Cayaltí district, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She sells fruit juices in her city of residence's main square. She tells us that the business was begun 8 years ago by her mother who eventually left her in charge of it; through much effort she has made it grow. Evelyn tells us that she was able to eventually buy a tent and a display case to display cakes that she makes herself; they are also well-received by her customers. Evelyn uses her profits to support her family economically. Her husband works for the agricultural company in the area and also helps support his mother. The growing demand for her products, typical of the Summer season, has led her to think about enlarging her business. For this reason, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to buy fruit, drinking glasses and a new display case. She is a cheerful, dynamic and hard-working woman. Her greatest wish is to have her own home because they currently live in a rented one.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fruit, drinking glases and a display case.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ya independientes, Lucy presenta estudios hasta tercer grado de Primaria.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas en su misma casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad.  Sus ventas lo realiza  diariamente  a partir de las 5.30pm. Lleva 07 años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.

Con su primer crédito de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles compró: arroz en sacos, pollos en javas, sazonador para aderezar los pollos, racimos de plátano y maduro.

Con este crédito  de S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Lucy, se siente muy tranquila y feliz y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Lucy, 49, is a member of the "Honestidad y Trabajo" (Honesty & Work) communal bank, which is in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and has 4, independent children. Lucy finished third grade. She has always been noted for her tenacious spirit and her wish to succeed in life through her own efforts. This led her to set up a food preparation and sales business in her home. Gradually, she became well-known among her customers and she tells us that, today, she does quite well. She is open for business daily from 5:30am. She has been in this line of work for 7 years and she is very pleased with what she does. She used her first, 300 new sol, loan to buy sacks of rice, crates of chickens, seasonings for her chicken, bunches of bananas and plantains. She will use this new, 3000 new sol, loan to buy ingredients like: sacks of rice, eggs, chickens for juanes (a rice and chicken mixture cooked inside banana leaves), dressed chickens for her anticuchos (skewered grilled meat snacks), as well as kitchen utensils to provide quality service. Lucy feels very tranquil and happy and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her reach her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meal preparations.

loans.name: Jovita Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Jovita Elena, tiene 36 años, vive  en el Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. La Socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo” .Es Casada madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando, presenta Estudios Superiores de Auxiliar en Docencia.

Motivada siempre por salir adelante, ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar , motivada siempre por su esposo , emprendieron su negocio de  venta de ladrillos llamado “Ladrillera Gasparin”, ya que cuentan con un terreno grande y con la materia prima como es la arcilla para la preparación de los ladrillos, iniciándose con un capital de 5,000.00 Nuevos Soles de las cuales poco a poco fue obteniendo muy buenos resultados y haciéndose muy conocida por vecinos , amigos y  transeúntes.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos, instituciones  y clientes fijos.

Con este crédito de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará  leña en tercios, latas, para hornear sus ladrillos, parte del dinero también lo invertirá en el pago mensual de su personal. 

Jovita Elena, se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así siempre.
texts.en:
Jovita Elena, 36, lives in Juanui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is a member of the "Honestidad y Trabajo" (Honesty & Work) communal bank. She is married and has two children, both of whom are students and still dependent on her. She studied to be a Teacher's Aide. Motivated to get ahead in life and facing the need to contribute to her family's economy, they started a brick selling business, called "Ladrillera Gasparin." They have a large plot of land that is rich in clay for brick making. They began with a 5000 new sol investment and gradually got good results becoming well-known by their neighbors, friends and passers-by. Currently, she continues with the same business, which is located in her own home; her main customers are her neighbors, institutions, and regular customers. She will use this new, 3000 new sol, loan to buy firewood and cans to fire her bricks; part of the money will also be used to pay her personnel's monthly salary. Jovita Elena is happy for the work and service she provides and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping people like her who want to work and succeed; she hopes they will always continue that way.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and cans.

loans.name: Maria Eloisa

texts.es:
La Sra. María Eloisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella, presenta Estudios Superiores Incompletos de Educación Inicial.

María Eloisa, lleva 15 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Trabaja con pedidos anticipados que sus clientes le solicitan y siempre regalando una sonrisa ellos se sienten muy contentos y satisfechos. En la actualidad, se siente una mujer realizada, con ganas de siempre salir adelante .que a podido sobresalir gracias esta muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones, blondas, etc.

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy feliz y esta muy orgullosa por lo logrado, su sueño es tener un local más amplio. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
María Eloisa, 41, is a member of the "Honestidad y Trabajo" (Honesty & Work) communal bank, which is in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is single and has two children, who are dependent on her. She did not finish secondary school. María Eloisa has been a seamstress for 15 years. Having knowledge and skills in this activity, she did not hesistate to set up her own workshop, in her home, in a well-equipped area to receive her regular customers daily. They know her and require her services. She works based on prior orders from her customer and she always has a ready smile for them; they are happy and satisfied. Currently, she feels that she is a fulfilled woman, who has the desire to succeed and who has already succeeded; she is happy and proud of her accomplishments. She will use the 3000 new sol loan to buy fabric of various colors and types, tools like scissors, large-spool thread of various colors, sewing and sewing machine needles, pins, buttons, blondas (lace-like material used in cuffs and collars), etc. Today she is happy and proud of what she has accomplished. Her dream is to have a larger shop. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business and other women who want to grow and succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Loisith

texts.es:
La Sra. Loisith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años y 06 hijos, 05 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando, presenta Estudios de Secundaria Completa.

Loisith, decidió  por idea propia vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada cerca a un colegio de su Distrito,  lleva 05 años en el negocio, un lugar muy bien amplio y acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida, con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró, pollos en javas, arroz, azúcar en kilos así empezó creciendo y poco a poco fue muy reconocida.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su negocio y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles , comprará pollos en javas, arroz , azúcar en kilos , aceite en litros .También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Loisith, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Loisith belongs to the community bank "Honesty and Work", which is located in the District of Juanjuí, Province of Mariscal Cáceres, Department of San Martín, Peru. She is forty-three years old, married, and has six children, five of whom still depend on her and are currently enrolled in middle school and high school. Loisith came up with the her business idea all on her own. She makes and sells prepared foods from a location situated near a school in her district. She has carried on this business for 5 years now, and she maintains a spacious and well-equipped workplace to suit her customers' needs as best she can. She tells us that her daily income is very good, on account of the special seasoning she uses on all the food that she prepares. Her main customers are either city residents, passers-by on the street, or regular customers who are already familiar with her food. She is able to count on a good turn-out of customers every day. With her first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles, she bought bulk amounts of chicken, rice, and kilos of sugar. This enabled her to begin growing her business, and bit by bit her reputation grew. Today she continues with her same business, servicing the customers who continue to visit her every day. She personally attends to her customers to provide them with the delicious flavors and friendliness that characterizes her enterprise. With this loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles, she will buy more bulk chicken, rice and sugar, as well as liters of oil. She will also buy new kitchen utensils to replace the old ones she currently uses, enabling her to offer nicer service to her customers. Loisith feels very confident in her ability to continue succeeding with her business, and she is very motivated to continue working hard for her success, so that she can achieve a calm, happy life. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the assistance it has given her in achieving her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará insumos para la preparacion de sus alimentos como arroz , azúcar en kilos , etc.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada tiene 54 años y  03 hijos, 01 que aun depenD. D. ella y esta estudiando.

Isabel, es una mujer luchadora y eficiente, es Técnica en Farmacia y trabaja en el Hospital D. su Distrito. Con la perseverancia y el anhelo D. tener un ingreso propio y teniendo los conocimientos en farmacia decidió implementar su propio negocio D. venta D. medicinas básicas, también se dedica a aplicar inyecciones. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, y que es mu y reconocida en su cuadra.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles , comprará medicinas como: Ibuprofeno, Nastisol,  Aspirinas, doloflan, otras medicinas básicas.

Isabelita, como le llaman D. cariño  se siente una mujer  contenta y feliz  con lo obtenido. Agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla, su sueño es surtir más su negocio con medicinas básicas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel belongs to the Honesty and Work Community Bank in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, in the Department of San Martin. She is 54 years old and married with three children, one of whom is a student and still dependent on Isabel. Isabel, an efficient and hard-working woman, has a technical degree in pharmacology and works at the hospital in her district. With perseverance, the desire to have her own income, and with her knowledge of pharmacology, she decided to start a business selling basic medicine and also giving injections of different medicines. Currently she is continuing this business and she reports that she is doing well and is becoming well-known in her neighborhood. With this loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles, she will buy medicines such as: Ibuprofen, Aspirin, and other basic medicines. Isabelita, as she is known by those who are close to her, feels satisfied and happy with what she has achieved. She is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for their help. Her dream is to supply her business with more medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic medicines to supply her pharmacy

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita es una mujer amante a las caminatas, tiene 55 años y es madre D. 4 hijos. Vive con su esposo y dos D. sus hijos en una modesta, pero acogedora casa en una zona al sur D. L. ciudad D. Lima.

DesD. hace 3 años se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza D. dos líneas muy reconocidas en el mercado. Adicionalmente venD. algunas golosinas y bebidas en un espacio que acondicionó en su vivienda. Pero su inclinación es por los cosméticos, así tenga que caminar largas horas en busca D. sus clientes, por lo que cada vez que tiene que repartir sus productos cierra su negocio D. dulces, pues D. lo contrario sus nietos se comen las golosinas.
Felicita está muy contenta con su actividad porque ha conocido a mucha gente, y se ha hecho D. una larga lista D. clientes regulares.
Es por ello, que para el futuro quiere comprar vitrinas para exhibir sus productos y otros accesorios D. belleza, en el mismo espacio donD. venD. sus dulces.

Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, y así como hasta ahora ha sido responsable en sus pagos, promete seguir siéndolo. En su grupo si siente a gusto porque son pocas personas y se conocen muy bien, sobre todo porque tienen muchas cosas en común. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en el incrementó D. sus productos D. belleza, además D. comprar más golosinas para seguir obteniendo ganancias con ambos negocios.
texts.en:
Felicita is a women who loves to go for walks. She is 55 and has four children. She lives with her husband and two of her children in a modest, but cozy house on the south siD. of Lima. For three years she has worked selling cosmetics for two well-known companies. Additionally, she sells snacks and drinks in a small space she has arranged in her house. However, she prefers to sell cosmetics, so she has to walk for long hours looking for clients. Every time she goes to deliver her products she closes her shop because otherwise her grandchildren eating the snacks. Felicita is very happy with her job because she has met many people and has built up a long list of regular clients. In the future, she wants to buy display cases to show her products and other accessories in the same space where she sells her sweets. This is her sixth loan with MFP and to date has been responsible with her payments and is promises to continue to do so. In her group she feels very happy because it is a small group, they know each other well, and they have a lot of thing in common. She will invest the money she is applying for to purchase beauty products and snacks in order to continue earning money from both businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene 66 años de edad es separada y tiene 3 hijos ya independizados. Vive junto a un nieto de 12 años en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Irene ha trabajado durante mas de 25 años vendiendo verduras y abarrotes en el mercado de la ciudad de Cayaltí. Actualmente ha dejado encargado su negocio a una de sus hijas ya que, debido a su avanzada edad, ya no puede distinguir las monedas. Aún así todas las mañanas se dirige al mercado a ayudar a su hija en la venta y atención del establecimiento. Este negocio le provee los ingresos suficientes para mantenerse.

Las lluvias que se han presentado en la zona han hecho que las paredes de su casa queden debilitadas, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la adquisición de material para reforzar sus paredes.

Irene es una mujer reponsable, trabajadora y activa. Sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una buena persona que siempre esta dispuesta a ayudar cuando se le necesita.
texts.en:
Irene is 66 years old. She is separated and has three adult children. She lives with her 12-year old grandson in the district of Cayaltí, which is about an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Irene has worked for more than 25 years selling vegetables and groceries in the market in the city of Cayaltí. She has left one of her daughters in charge of her business because due to her old age she cannot distinguish which coins are coins. Despite this, every morning she goes to the market to help her daughter care for the business. This business provides her with the income necessary to maintain herself. The heavy rains that have fallen in the region have made the walls of her house unstable, so she has applied for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 600 nuevos soles, which she will use for material to reinforce her walls. Irene is a responsible, hard-working, and active. Her neighbors and friends hold her in high esteem and consider her to be a good person who is always available to help when it is needed.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to rebuild walls of a home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build one room of family home

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 45 años, vive acompañada de sus dos hijos Carlos (24) y Gerardo (15) en una casa modesta de un barrio populoso al sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde los 22 años trabajó muchísimo, realizó un sin número de oficios con el fin de brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Su meta era crecer y tener un negocio propio, lo cual ha logrado obteniendo un terreno donde construyó  su casa poco a poco, a base de mucho sudor y sacrificio.
Ahora vive de los alquileres de las habitaciones de su casa, eso le ha permitido ser una mujer autosuficiente, por eso sabe que no debe detenerse y proseguir con los acabados respectivos de su vivienda.
Julia está muy orgullosa de lo que ha logrado y ahora quiere construir otros pisos para obtener mayores ganancias con las que pueda pagar los estudios de sus hijos y de ese modo también cumplir otro de sus grandes sueños, que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y se compromete a seguir siendo cumplida con el pago de sus cuotas. Ella estima mucho a sus compañeras de grupo, pues son personas muy responsables y eso le da seguridad de seguir trabajando con préstamos, ya que para ella éstos son indispensables para su progreso. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará cemento y mayólicas para el acabado de los servicios higiénicos de sus inquilinos, para que de ese modo se sientan más a gusto en su casa.
texts.en:
Julia is 45 years of age. She lives with her two sons Charles (24) and Gerardo (15) in a modest house in a populous district south of Lima. From the time she was 22 years of age, she has worked a great deal, and has made countless trades in order to provide the best for her children. Her goal was to grow and have her own business, which has managed to do, as well as built a home gradually, based on a lot of sweat and sacrifice. She now lives in her home and rents some of the rooms, which has allowed her to be self-sufficient. Now, she has come to know that she cannot stop the momentum and needs to continue with the repairs/finishes of her home. Julia is very proud of what she has achieved and now would like to build other apartments for higher profits, which will help her pay for her children's education and realize another one of her big dreams - to see her children become professionals. This is Julia's ninth loan with MFP credit and she promises to remain compliant with the payments of her loan. She finds her other peers (other women entrepreneurs) are also very responsible people, and that gives her a sense of security in continuing her working with loans, since this has become essential for her progress. With the money she is requesting now, she plans to purchase cement and tiles for finishing the toilets in her tenants' flats, so that they can feel more comfortable in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejora de los servicios higiénicos de las habitaciones que alquila (To fix/add finishes to the toilets in the rooms she rents)

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia es una mujer muy emprendedora, tiene 3 hijos; Jhonatan de 17, Luis de 14 y Miriam de 2 años. No está casada y debe afrontar sola las necesidades de sus hijos, por el momento vive en la casa de unos familiares.

Las circunstancias de la vida la llevaron a realizar diferentes actividades, pero donde se amoldó más es en la venta de ropa. Su modalidad de trabajo es visitar en sus casas a sus amistades, familiares y vecinos, y ofrecerles sus prendas directamente. Lleva cerca de 15 años en esta actividad y le ha resultado muy rentable. 
Hace 2 años tenía un puesto en el mercado de su localidad, pero tuvo que dejarlo porque su hija se enfermó, posteriormente le fue imposible recuperarlo. 
Yesenia es muy conocida en su barrio porque los precios que ofrece son cómodos, pues compra la ropa al por mayor y a bajos precios.
Para el futuro, quiere comprar un terreno donde pueda construir su casa propia para el bienestar de sus hijos.

Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y asegura ser puntual, como hasta ahora lo ha sido, en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no le gustaría defraudar a sus compañeras de grupo, con quienes ha ido progresando de manera solidaria. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en el incremento de su capital para comprar ropa de moda para la época de verano.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a very enterprising woman. She has three children: Jhonatan is 17, Luis is 14 and Miriam is 2. She is not married and she has to faace alone all her children's needs. For the time being she lives with some family members. Her life circumstances led her to deal in different activities, but where she felt more at home was selling clothes. She visits her friends, family members and neighbours in their homes and offers them her clothes in a straightforward manner, She has been for 15 years at this activity and it has turned out to be quite profitable. Two years ago she had a market in her hometown market, but she had to leave it because her daughter got sick, and later it was impossible to get it back. Yesenia is very well known in her neighbourhood because the prices she offers are good, since she buys the clothing wholesale and cheap. For the future she wants to buy a piece of land where he can build her own home for her children's wellbeing. This is her ninth credit MFP and she assures she will be punctual, as she has been until now, in her repayments, since she does not want to let her group partners down, with whom she his progressing shoulder to shoulder. The money she asks for will be invested in increasing her capital to buy fashionable clothing for the summer season.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise: clothing

loans.name: Ymelda

texts.es:
Ymelda es una mujer luchadora, desde niña ha trabajado arduamente, y ahora con el paso de los años, su cuerpo empieza a sentir las consecuencias de ese esfuerzo. Actualmente tiene 53 años, tiene 3 hijos, ya adultos, que viven con ella en su casa propia que aun está a medio construir.

Tras el abandono del padre de sus hijos tuvo que trabajar mucho más para poder brindarles lo necesario. Anteriormente realizaba manualidades y tejidos, pero no le fue muy rentable. 
Ahora está dedicada a la elaboración y venta de tamales (platillo a base de maíz) dos veces por semana, por lo que obtiene mayores ganancias, pues sus vecinos gustan de su sazón. 
Su mayor dificultad es que no puede asomarse demasiado al fuego, ni cargar peso, porque perjudica su salud, pues tiene problemas con los ovarios.
Ymelda se apoya en sus hijos y junto a ellos cree poder terminar de construir su casa para tener mayor tranquilidad en el futuro.

Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y es conciente de que debe pagar responsablemente cada una de sus cuotas. Por lo general, las reuniones de su grupo se hacen en su casa, donde ella los acoge amablemente. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina y para la renovación de su máquina de moler granos, pues la que tiene ya está muy gastada.
texts.en:
Ymelda is a hard working woman. She has worked strenuously since she was a child and now with the passage of years her body begins to feel the consequences of that effort. Nowadays she is 53 years old, she has 3 children, all of them grown up, who live with her in their own half-built home. After the father of her children abandoned her she had to work much harder to give them all they needed. Previously she has worked in crafting and weaving but that was not very profitable. Now she works in the elaboration and sale of tamales twice a week, which offers greater earnings, since her neighbours like her special seasoning mix. Her greatest difficulty is that she can not be very close to the fire, or carry weight, because it hurts her health, as she has problems in her ovaries. Ymelda finds support in her children and with them she thinks she will finish building the home and have peace of mind in the future. This is her ninth credit with MFP and she is aware that she must pay each one of her installments responsibly. Usually the meetings in her communal bank take place in her home, where she kindly receives them. The money she asks for now will be invested in purchasing kitchen implements and a new grain grinding machine, since the one she has is very worn.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen implements and a new grain grinder

loans.name: Inés Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Inés M. G. una señora de 52 años de edad, emprendedora de un negocio de venta de comida el cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$10,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 12 años. Este negocio está ubicado en el mercado Israel lewite contiguo al centro cívico de Managua. 

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de  productos para la elaboración de comida y remodelación del negocio.
Ella ha trabajado con ceprodel desde el año 2005 en ese periodo de tiempo lleva 12 financiamiento  por parte de ceprodel los cuales ha invertido en su negocio.

Ella es casada y madre  de 4 hijos a su cargo y dos de ellos  están en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella laboraba  Vendiendo ambulante buñuelos y pasteles.

Lleva 12 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 5 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando su mercadería, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Sra. Inés M. G. is 52 years old and started her food sales business with initial startup capital of 10,000 NIO. Subsequently she took out loans for the next twelve years. Her business is located at the Israel Lewite Market, which is adjacent to the Managua Civic Center.

The loan Inés is requesting will be used as operating capital for her business. She plans to buy products used in food preparation and will use part of the proceeds to remodel her business. Inés has been working with CEPRODEL since 2005. During this period, she has taken out twelve loans with CEPRODEL to invest into her business.

Inés is married and the mother of four dependent children, two of whom are in school. Prior to having this business, she worked as a traveling merchant selling donuts and pastries. It has taken twelve loans from CEPRODEL over a five year period to grow her business and diversify her merchandise. She thanks CEPRODEL for providing this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & remodel her business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is the owner of M.’s Senior Care Services, a geriatric care management company. Originally from England, Patricia started her career working as a registered nurse and she transitioned into the geriatric care industry after immigrating to the United States with her American husband in 1996.

Confident in her entrepreneurial, organizational and medical knowledge and skills, Patricia opened M.’s Senior Care Services four years ago in order to provide care management for the frail and elderly while maximizing her earning capacity by being her own boss. “I tell my prospective new clients that my business is like ‘being a daughter for hire’,” says Patricia.

Ready to take her business to the next level, Patricia plans to hire a part-time office administrator, build a website, invest in new geriatric care equipment, and upgrade her marketing materials. She has already hired a part-time gerontologist to work with her. However, Patricia was dismayed when her own bank turned her down for a business loan. The Small Business Administration referred Patricia to Opportunity Fund, her local micro-finance institution, where her business was analyzed and approved for a loan.

A $5,000 loan will help Patricia to achieve her goals, grow her business and realize her dreams. “Hiring our first full-time employee and dedicating more of my time to management are the baby steps I need to take to see my business take off. Within three years, I hope to see myself managing the office and employing two full time care managers to serve our clients.”

loans.use: To buy new equipment and marketing materials

loans.name: Maria Aleen

texts.en:
Maria Aleen E. is from Barangay 3, Tangub City. She is 41 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Maria Aleen owns and operates a business making and selling food, preparing and selling food for snacks like "puto" (rice cake) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Maria Aleen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria Aleen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lendith Ibane

texts.es:
La Sra. Lendith Ibane, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 25 años y es madre de 01 niña, que aun dependen de ella, la socia presenta Secundaria Completa.
Lendith, se dedica a la venta de panes y dulces,  lleva 05 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito. Lendith, como le dicen de cariño, poco a poco, fue ahorrando y haciéndose muy conocida por sus clientes, que hoy en día son clientes fijos en su puesto. 
Actualmente, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy orgullosa, por el trabajo que realiza. Con su primer crédito de 500 Nuevos Soles, implemento más su peque panadería, comprando harina en sacos, azúcar y sal.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos como: harina, azúcar, sal y saborizantes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de una nueva vitrina, para exhibir sus productos.
Lendith, agradece bastante, al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional y a otras mujeres como ella, que quieren salir adelante y ser empresarias.
texts.en:
Sra. Lendith Ibane is a member of the Communal Bank “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Honesty and Work), which is in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 25 years old, single, and the mother of a daughter who is financially dependent on her. Lendith completed her high school education. She has been selling breads and sweets for the past five years from the central market in the district where she lives. Over time, Lendith began saving and becoming well-known among her customers. Today she has established customers who come to her vending location. Her business continues to this day and she is very proud of the work she has accomplished. With her first loan of 500 soles, she kept her small bakery in operation by purchasing sacks of flour, sugar, and salt. With her current loan of 1500 soles, Lendith will buy ingredients and supplies such as flour, sugar, salt, and flavorings. Part of the money will be used to acquire a new display case for exhibiting her products. Lendith is truly grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing unconditional support to her and other women who want to get ahead and become entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients, supplies, and a display case

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es:
La señora Ana Gladis Díaz, es una señora  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de ropa y calzado. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$15,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 10 años. Este negocio está ubicado en Mercado Israel lewite entrada principal de la COTRAN 
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de ropa y Calzado para caballeros, damas y niños, que se vende mucho.

Es madre soltera, con tres hijos a su cargo, este se encuentra en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como domestica.

Lleva 15 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 5 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Gladis Díaz is an enterprising woman who manages a business buying and selling clothing and shoes. She began with initial startup capital of 15,000 NIO and subsequently took out loans for the next ten years. Her business is located at the Israel Lewite Market, near the main entrance of COTRAN (one of the primary bus terminals).

The loan Ana is requesting will be used as operating capital for her business. She plans to buy clothing and shoes for men, women, and children since she sells a lot of these items.

Ana is a single mother with three dependent children who attend school. Prior to having this business, she worked as a housekeeper. It has taken fifteen loans from CEPRODEL over a ten year period to grow her business and diversify her products so that she can compete in the marketplace. She thanks CEPRODEL for providing this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blouses, trousers, undergarments, and shoes

loans.name: Duvon De Fátima

texts.es:
La señora Fátima J. R., es una señora emprendedora de un negocio de venta de gaseosa, jugos, galletas y otros productos el cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$5,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de ahorro hace 15 años. Este negocio está ubicado Mercado Israel lewite terminal de los buses que viajan al occidente del país 

 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra gaseosas, jugos y galletas, que se vende mucho en esta época del año debido a las festividades de esta fecha.

Ella es casada tiene a su cargo un dos y se encuentran  en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella  Vendía ambulante en el mercado Israel lewite. 

Lleva 17 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 5 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Sra. Fátima J. R. is an enterprising woman who manages a business selling sodas, juices, cookies, and other products. She started fifteen years ago with initial capital of 5000 NIO that she accumulated with savings. Her business is located at the Israel Lewite Market, near the terminal for the buses traveling to the western part of the country.

The loan Fátima is requesting will be used as operating capital for her business. She plans to buy sodas, juices, and cookies since she sells more around this time of year because of the festivals that take place during this season.

Fátima is married and has two dependent children who are of school age. Prior to having this business, she was a street vendor at the Israel Lewite Market. She has taken seventeen loans from CEPRODEL over a five year period to invest in her business, which has grown and now offers a diversified selection of products. Fátima thanks CEPRODEL for providing this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas, juices, and cookies

loans.name: Adolfo Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Adolfo S. V., el tiene a su cargo tres  hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar,  es casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante 15 meses, en ese lapso ha invertido  dos créditos en la mejorar de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es una excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para el cambio de piso de la vivienda en que habita, para darles una mejor condición de vida sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sr. Adolfo S. V. is married and has three dependent children, two of whom are of school age. He has received loans from CEPRODEL for the past 15 months, which he used to improve the condition of his home. He has demonstrated that he is an excellent client.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase building materials needed to change the flooring in his home so that he can provide better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the floors in his house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia A. is from the district of Maloro, Tangub City. She is 44 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Amalia owns and operates a business offering motor transportation services. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Amalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Amalia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
