loans.use: To repair her existing vehicle

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 47 años y es madre de 02 hijos, todos ya independientes, presenta Estudios Superiores en Enfermería Técnica.

Isabel anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de refrigerios en los interiores  de  un Instituto Tecnológico, siendo sus principales clientes, profesores, alumnos y moradores, ahora se dedica a la venta de golosinas  ubicado en los interiores de un Instituto Tecnológico. Decidió iniciar el negocio por su propia iniciativa y porque le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, así mismo generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer. Hoy en día se siente muy contenta y tranquila, con el trabajo que realiza. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará golosinas como: chocolates sublimes, cañonazo; chupetines, chicles y caramelos en diferentes sabores y marcas; así satisfacer a sus clientes. 

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Isabel belongs to the “Honestidad y Trabajo” comunal bank located in the Juanjui district of the Mariscal Cáceres Province in the Departament of San Martín. She is the 47 year old single mother of 2 adult children and is a trained nurse. Isabel used to sell refreshments within the Technical Institute, her primary customers being professors, students and local residents. Now she sells snacks and treats within the Technical Institute. She started this business through her own initiative and enjoys the personal contact and opportunity to grow as a person and woman. Today she is very happy and satisfied with her work. With this loan of 3,000 Soles ($1,050) she will buy snacks such as chocolate candy bars, suckers, caramels, and chewing gum of varying flavors and brands to satisfy her customers’ demands. She feels very satisfied with her work and believes that it’s worth the sacrifice to reach her life’s goals. She is also thankful for the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” (Manuela Ramos Movement) for the support they give to her and other women wanting to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Snacks for resale

loans.name: Jimmy Rafael

texts.es:
El Sr. Jimmy T. A., casado y padre de familia de un hijo el que se  encuentran en edad escolar. El Sr. Jimmy acude a ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita comprar materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que necesita comprar perlines, zinc, pintura y clavos para el techo de su casa el cual esta deteriorado y en invierno el agua penetra en su hogar.
Cabe mencionar que desde que ceprodel me ha estado financiando créditos e podido mejorar mis condiciones de vida para mi familia.
texts.en:
Jimmy is married and the father of a family of one child who is of school age. Jimmy came to Ceprodel in order to request a loan to buy construction materials for home improvements. He needs to buy beams, zinc, paint and nails because the roof of his house has deteriorated and water gets into his home during the winter.

It is worth mentioing that, since Ceprodel has made loans to me I have been able to improve the living conditions for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
La  Señora Ana Isabel Seque ira, Labora como Supervisora de Colectores en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua.
 Ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y uno de ellos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante diez años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido veinte crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: verjas para las ventanas de su casa y para el corredor. 
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Ana dijo que gracias al financiamiento de ceprodel le han ayudado mucho a mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Ana works as a supervisor of collectors in the main marketplace of Managua.

She has two children, one of whom is of school age, and she is married. She has received loans from CEPRODEL during the past ten years, and in this period of time has invested twenty loans in home improvements thanks to the financing offered by CEPRODEL. She is an excellent client.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as: security bars for the windows of her house and for the entry passage.

Her goal is to offer more security and a better standard of living to her children.

Ana said that the loans from CEPRODEL have helped her greatly in improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement and enlargement of her home

loans.name: Marvin Santiago

texts.es:
El Señor Marvin M. Castellón, Labora como Técnico Docente en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.
 El tiene tres  hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante 12 mese, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y piedra  para la  construcción de un muro en la parte trasera del patio de  su casa.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marvin works as a technical instructor at the university called Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.

He has three children who are of school age and his is married. He has had loans from CEPRODEL during the last twelve months, and in this period of time he has invested his loans in home improvements thanks to the financing offered by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client.

The loans he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as: cement, sand, and stone for building a wall at the rear of the patio at his home.

His goal is to offer more security and a better standard of living to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement and enlargement of his home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Noel Rodríguez Méndez, Labora como Cajero en el Mercado Roberto Huembés de Managua.
 El tiene tres  hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante cinco año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cinco créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y piedra  para la  construcción de un muro en la parte trasera del patio de  su casa.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Noel works as a cashier in the “Roberto Huembés de Managua” market. He is married and has three school-aged children. He has worked with Ceprodel for five years and has been an excellent client. He has received five loans which he has used to make improvements to his home. He will use the money from this loan to buy building materials such as cement, sand, and stone to build a wall behind his house in order to offer his family greater security and provide a better life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Elena De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Elena D. Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 74 años y 07 hijos ya independientes. La Socia presenta Primaria Completa.

Elena D. Jesús, lleva varios 5 años dedicándose a la costura y al tejido, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, fue idea propia  se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa un lugar acondicionado, donD. atienD. a sus clientes.se dedica a arreglar blusas y vestidos , también teje vestidos D. bebes , manteles , etc. Y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, trabaja con pedidos D. sus clientes anticipadamente. Con su primer crédito D. 300 Nuevos Soles, compró telas en diferentes colores y tamaños y parte del dinero lo invirtió en lana, hilos D. diferentes especies para su tejido.
En la actualidad continua con su negocio y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuD. a su casa para realizar sus trabajos, es ella quien personalmente les atienD.  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este crédito D. S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones, hilos D. diferentes colores para su tejido.

Elena D. Jesús, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente
texts.en:
Elena belongs to the community bank called "Honesty and Work" in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín. She is a widow of 74 years of age and has 7 independent children. This bank member completed her primary education.

Elena has spent about 5 years working as a seamstress and crochet maker. Little by little she was able to generate her own income and to save her money. Her business is located in her own home in a comfortable place where she can attend to her customers. She repairs blouses and dresses, and also crochets baby clothes, tablecloths, etc. She tells us that she is doing very well and has advance orders from her customers. With her first loan of 300 Soles, she bought fabric in different colors and sizes and she invested part of the money in wool yarns of different types for her crochet.

She is currently continuing to run her business and she has loyal customers who come daily to her house with their orders, and she attends to them personally with her characteristic kindness.

With this loan of $425, she will buy cloth maD. of various fabrics by the meter, crochet tools, needles for hand- and machine-sewing, pins, buttons, and different colored threads.

Today, Elena feels herself to be a very accomplished woman with more drive to acheive and realize her dreams. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her to start her business and also for helping many women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric by the meter, wool, thread of different colors

loans.name: Bismarck Salvador

texts.es:
El Señor Bismarck C. C., Labora como Jardinero en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez.
 El tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, para el techo de su casa ya que el que  tiene esta perforado y en invierno el agua se pasa.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Bismarck C. C. works as a gardener in the Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez. He takes care of two school age children, is married, and has had loans with CEPRODEL for three years. During this period, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL, he has invested three loans in the improvement of the dwelling in which he lives. He is an excellent client.

The loan applied for is to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as zinc for the roof of his house. The roof has leaks, and in winter water gets in. His goal is to offer better security and better living conditions to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements and enlargements to a dwelling.

loans.name: Jessica Violeta

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 29 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a su hija de 12 años en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de comida en los exteriores del mercado de la ciudad de Cayaltí, ella nos comenta que la idea del negocio nació de una tía que la animó a empezarlo debido a la buena sazón con la que preparaba sus comidas. 

Actualmente Jessica ofrece a sus clientes diversos platos típicos de la zona como ceviche, papa a la huancaína, papa rellena, tortitas de choclo y tallarines. Todos los días atiende su negocio desde las nueve de la mañanas hasta las dos de la tarde. Por la tarde vende jugos de frutas en el mismo puesto.

El negocio siempre está lleno de clientes por lo que está pensando en ampliarlo. Por ese motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de vajilla y de una nueva carpa para mejorar el servicio que brinda.

Jessica es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable. Sus vecinos y clientes le tienen mucha estima ya que ha sabido salir adelante junto a su hija a pesar de su condicion de madre soltera.
texts.en:
Jessica is 29 years old. She is separated and lives with her 12 year old daughter in the Cayaltí district, located an hour away from Chiclayo. She has a food stall outside the Cayalti marketplace. She tells us that the idea for her business was born when one of her aunts encouraged her to start it because of her experience in preparing her food. Jessica offers her customers various dishes, typical of the region, such as ceviche, potatoes in spicy cheese sauce, stuffed potatoes, corn tortillas, and noodles. She runs that business daily from 9:00 am to 2:00 pm and in the evenings she sells fruit juices from the same location. She always has many customers. She would like to expand, so she has seen fit to request a 1000 PEN ($350) loan through “Edpyme Alternativa.” She will use the money to invest in dishes and a new canopy in order to improve her service. Jessica is a hard working responsible woman and is admired by her customers and neighbors for knowing how to get ahead, despite her being a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in dishes and a new canopy

loans.name: Melvin Leonel

texts.es:
El Señor Melvin Maleaños C., Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Roberto Huembés de Managua.
 El tiene tres  hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante cinco año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cinco créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y cerámica para su casa de habitación ya que esta actualmente es de tierra.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Melvin Maliaño C. works as a security guard in the Roberto Huembés de Managua Market. He is married and has three school-aged children living at home. For the past five years he has received loans from CEPRODEL. He has used the money, thanks to CEPRODEL, to improve the home where he lives. He is an excellent customer. The money that he is asking for is to buy construction materials such as: cement, sand and ceramic tile for his house: it is currently made out of mud. He is doing this to be able to give his children a safer and better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and enlarge his house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bertha Luz

texts.es:
La señora Bertha, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y trabajo, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años y 04 hijos, 02 que aun dependen D. ella y están estudiando, presenta estudios D. Secundaria Completa.

Bertha, Lleva 13 años dedicándose a la confección D. vestidos y poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta D. abarrotes. Como tenia la habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos decidió implementar su propio Taller D. Costura, ubicado en su misma casa. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les atienD.  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza.
 
 Con su primer crédito D. 300 Nuevos Soles, compró retazos, telas en metros, hilos D. diferentes colores, en la actualidad sigue con el mismo negocio.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes granD. y D. variados colores, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Bertha belongs to the "Honestidad y trabajo" ("Honesty and Work") Community Bank in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín, Peru. She is married, 47 years old and has four children, two of whom are still in school and dependent on her. Bertha has been making clothes for 13 years and little by little has generated income and saved her money. Previously she had maD. a living selling groceries. Since she had the talent for sewing, she didn't hesitate to start doing it for a living, and with the help of Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos she decided to start her own sewing shop out of her home. She tells us that the business is going very well, and she works on orders that her clients request in advance. She tends to her customers with the friendliness and charisma that she is known for. With her initial loan of 300 soles, she purchased meters of fabric, threads of different colors, and other odds and ends, and has continued with the business ever since. With the current loan of 3,000 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase meters of fabric of different styles and colors, scissors, big spools of threads of various colors, sewing needles, pins and buttons. Today she feels like a very accomplished woman with a strong desire to keep moving forward and realizing her dreams. She is very thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meters of fabric of different styles and colors, scissors, big spools of threads of various colors, sewing needles, pins and buttons

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en: K. Nguyễn Thị (20203020002) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. K. is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02). K. is married and has three adult children. To make a living, K. works in and operates someone else's manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. K. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3.000.000 Vietnamese Dong a month from these activities. K. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. K. is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA. She is requesting a loan of 5.152.000 VND, which will be used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Dương Thị P. (20203020003) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. Dương Thị H. (20203020005) is a 51-year-old female who is also requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 3. Trương Thị Thanh H. (20203020007) is a 24-year-old female who is also requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 4. Nguyễn Thị D. (20203020009) is a 48-year-old female who is also requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 5. Phùng Thị H. (20203020010) is a 33-year-old female who is also requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. K. Nguyễn Thị (20203020002) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. K. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02). Trong khi không pH. chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh D. chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng đất sét cho các D. nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. K. thực hiện công việc kinh D. này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, K. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. K. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh D. của cô ấy/ anh ấy. K. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Dương Thị P. (20203020003) là 23 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh D. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh D. là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Dương Thị H. (20203020005) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh D. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh D. là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Trương Thị Thanh H. (20203020007) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh D. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh D. là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Nguyễn Thị D. (20203020009) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh D. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh D. là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. Phùng Thị H. (20203020010) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh D. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh D. là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các D. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business

loans.name: Yeu

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeu M. is 44 years old and lives with another family member in the best territory of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is married with two kids who are going to school or work as temporary laborers. Her husband (pictured), Sol Kiple, is 40 years old and drives a motorcycle taxi. 

Yeu M. is a wedding chef. Yeu M. complains that her current income is not adequate to support her family. Hence, she would like to look for assistance via HKL. She will use her loan to invest in the grocery sales trade so she can get extra profit.

loans.use: To invest in grocery sales

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres  y Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 21 años y es madre de 01 bebe  que aun dependen de ella. La Socia presenta Estudios de Secundaria Completa.

Teresa, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron muy buenos resultados y hoy en día, se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas, lleva poco tiempo en el negocio, que hoy en la actualidad le esta dando muy buenos resultados,  se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. Se encuentra ubicada en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, con la amabilidad y carisma, que siempre la ha caracterizado. 

Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con un capital de  S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles  iniciándose  con 03  paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo más. 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles comprará más bebidas gasificadas  como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Teresita como le dicen de cariño, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando más necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así, su sueño es surtir más su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to the “Honestidad y Trabajo” ("Honesty and Work") Community Bank in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, Departament of San Martín, Peru. She is a 21-year-old single mother with one baby and has a high school education. Teresa is a woman who has been able to overcome many difficulties in her life and has a strong desire to make headway. Currently, she makes a living selling soft drinks, which she has only been doing for a short amount of time but is delivering very good results. Teresa feels very pleased with what she has achieved. She works in a well-conditioned environment out of her own home and tends to her customers with the kindness and charisma that she is known for. She administers the business without a schedule or boss. She tells us she started out with a small loan of 300 soles, which she used to buy three cases of soft drinks. She saw that things went very well, and little by little she was able to invest more. With the current loan of 1,500 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase more cases of drinks of different flavors, sizes and brands as well as mineral water both carbonated and non-carbonated. Teresa is very grateful to Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her when she most needed it, and she is responsible with her repayments and plans to continue to be so. Her dream is to better stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cases of soft drinks of different flavors, sizes and brands

loans.name: Sara Melita

texts.es:
La Sra. Sara Melita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella y está estudiando. La Socia presenta Secundaria Completa.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de anticuchos en las fueras de su casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad.  Sus ventas lo realiza  diariamente  a partir de las 5:00pm. Lleva 06 años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Sara, se siente muy orgullosa del trabajo que realiza día a día , y  agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sara Melita belongs to the “Honestidad y Trabajo” ("Honesty and Work") Community Bank in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín, Peru. She is married, 50 years old and has three children, one of whom is still in school and dependent on her. Sara has a high school education. She has always been known for her fighting spirit and a desire to make headway. By her own means she was able to start her own business selling kebabs outside of her home, and little by little she became better known among her customers and today tells us that her business is going very well. She makes her sales every day after 5 p.m. and has six years of experience in the business. Sara feels very pleased with what she has accomplished. With the loan of 1,500 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase ingredients such as rice, eggs and chicken, as well as cooking utensils so she can provide a better quality of service. Sara feels very proud of her daily work and is very grateful to Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her fulfill her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and utensils to prepare her kebabs

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La Sra. Vilma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 48 años y 03 hijos todos independientes. La Socia presenta Secundaria Completa.

Vilma, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes, lleva 08 años en el negocio. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este crédito de S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con muchas ganas de seguir adelante, su sueño es implementar su propio Minimarket bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en el cumplimiento de ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the “Honestidad y Trabajo” ("Honesty and Work") Community Bank in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín, Peru. She is single, 48 years old and has three children, all of whom are grown up and independent. Vilma has a high school education. She decided to sell prepared meals out of a well-conditioned space out of her home and has eight years of experience tending to her customers. She tells us that every day she has very good results because of the rich flavor of her foods. Her primary customers are the townspeople, passers-by and regular clients whom she knows, and she says her food is always well-received. Currently, she plans to continue with the business and is very pleased with the work she does from day to day. Vilma personally tends to her customers with the charisma she is known for. With the loan of 2, 500 soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase ingredients for the daily preparation of her meals, such as rice, sugar, oil, potatoes, chicken and vegetables, as well as some utensils to add to her business and provide a better service to her customers. Vilma has a strong desire to keep making headway, and her dream is to start her own mini-market. She is grateful to Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her become a great entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make her meals

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov S., 30 years of age, is a cleaner in the Ministry of Public Transportation. She has a partner in her husband, who sells fish paste to earn a living. The couple has been married many years and is blessed with four children, two of whom are married and the others are single.

Pov S. faces the fact that she has only a small income and her ability to pay daily expenses has been affected. She plans to operate a new business but she doesn’t have enough capital. Therefore, she requested a loan of $400 to buy a machine that she will use to squeeze sugarcane to produce juice to sell.

loans.use: To buy a machine to process sugarcane

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria del Carmen tiene el negocio de venta de línea de ropa la cual las ofrece en Masaya, Malaca toya y Diriomo sus productos los vende al crédito y cada semana se encarga de recuperar lo que coloco, tiene dos personas que le trabajan los que son su hijo y esposo es un negocio de familia, la señora quiere el crédito para invertirlo en el mismo y así tener una mayor demanda y tener un mejor ingreso para su familia ha tenido tres créditos con CEPRODEL, el negocio lo empezó con un crédito pequeño y poco a poco lo ha ido incrementando, es madre de tres hijos de los cuales solamente tiene uno a su cargo al que le da los estudios y es por el se la señora trabaja duro para que niño pueda estudiar.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen has a business selling a clothing line and offers her products in the towns of Masay, Malacatoya and Diriomo. She sells her products on credit and every week she goes back to collect. She has two people who work for her, her son and his wife, so it's a family business. Maria is requesting the loan so she can invest in her business and thus increase her demand and her family's income. She has had three loans with Kiva partner CEPRODEL and started the business with a small loan and grew it little by little. Maria has three children, only one of whom is still in school and under her care, and it's for this reason she works so hard, so that her son can keep studying.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing such as pants, blouses, socks, shirts, shoes, among other items

loans.name: Mrs. Netrea Thoen Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Netrea T. is a village bank president who has been selected by seventeen members, all of whom will use the loan for a different purpose. This village bank loan will go to Akreiy Ksat village in Kandal province. Mrs. Netrea T. is a beautician in the village, and her husband, Mr. Nara Nuon, is a cow middleman. They can earn less money; however this family tries to work hard with their career. So in order to improve living conditions for their family, Mrs. Netrea T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more cosmetic supplies for providing beauty services. She is a mother of a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic supplies for providing beauty services

loans.name: Darling De Jesús

texts.es: La señora Darling trabaja en la Universidad popular de Nicaragua ella es egresada de la carrera de Administración de empresas en donde ella no ha podido gestionar el titulo por falta de dinero ya que se lo están exigiendo en su trabajo, el crédito lo solicito para pagar un curso te titulación y así poder obtenerlo y poder tener su trabajo ya que es madre de dos niñas una de cinco años y la otra de siete añitos y ella es el sustento de sus hijas, con esto podrá tener una mejor base en su trabajo y así tener una estabilidad para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Darling works at La Universidad Popular de Nicaragua. She went through the university's Business Administration program but has not been able to get her degree due to a lack of money. Since her job is requiring her it of her, she is requesting a loan to pay for a final course to obtain her degree and then be able to keep her job. Since she is a mother of two daughters, ages 5 and 7, and she supports them on her own, with this she will be able to have a better foundation at work and stability for her family's welfare.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To take a class to get her degree

loans.name: Dory

texts.es:
La Sra. Dory, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 41 años y 02 hijos que ya son independientes. Dory presenta Estudios hasta segundo grado de primaria por motivos de salud no estudio.

Dory, es una mujer  Luchadora y con ganas de salir siempre adelante, se siente capaz de seguir trabajando esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, vende en el Mercado Central de su Distrito y sus ventas le salen muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes.

Se inicio vendiendo verduras y poco a poco fue ahorrando, de esta manera es que decidió implementar su propio negocio. Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con lo que hace. En su puesto, sus clientes  encuentran lo necesario para preparar sus ensaladas y jugos  es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con una sonrisa.

Con este crédito de S/ 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará sacos de yuca,  limones cidras y frutas en diferentes variedades propias de la región, plátanos y maduros en racimos para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Dory, expresa haber cumplido algunas de sus metas que tiene trazada en su vida. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y a desarrollarse como Mujer y Empresaria.
texts.en:
Dory belongs to the "Honesty and Work" Community Bank in the Juanjui District, Mariscal Cáceres Province, San Martín Department of Peru. She is in a common-law marriage, 41 years old, and has two children grown children. Dory completed school up until second grade but went no further due to health problems. Dory is a determined woman with a will to always get ahead. She is very happy with the work she does selling fruits and vegetables at the Central Market of her district. Her sales do very well since she is well known by her customers. She started out selling vegetables and little by little saved up and eventually decided to start her own business. She currently runs the same business and is very happy with what she does. With this loan of 2,500 nuevos soles she will buy bags of yuca, lemons, other fruit varieties from the region, and bunches of bananas and plantains in order to better serve her customers and help them find what they need. Dory says she has accomplished some of the goals she has set for her life. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business and develop as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to supply her business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy R. is a 29-year old man from the village of Panaon Misamis, Occidental. Joy is married and has one child who is still an infant. 

To make a living, Joy owns and operates a business that provides transportation services. The main source of business income comes from operating motor transport services. Joy has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Joy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicles in order to improve service. 

This loan will be the third loan taken out by Joy from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.


Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair vehicles used in his motor transport business.

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
D. Trương Thị is a 34-year old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. D. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Thái 2 - Nhóm 04 (Nhóm 04).

D. is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, D. owns and operates a business selling home products. The main source of business income comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. D. has worked in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,200,000 Viet Nam Dong (VND) a month.

D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. D. is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from SEDA. D. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  Cao Thị H. is a 46-year old woman who is requesting a  5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.
2.  Mẫn Thị T. is a 27-year old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her handicraft business.
3.  Trương Thị T. is a 33-year old woman who is requesting a  5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.
4.  Trương Thị H. is a 26-year old woman who is requesting a  5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

D. Trương Thị (20203020013) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  D. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Thái 2 - Nhóm 04 (Nhóm 04).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các sản phẩm gia dụng cá nhân cho du khách và người dân trong cộng đồng địa pH..  D. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, D. kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND.  D. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  D. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.
Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Cao Thị H. (20203020014) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

2.  Mẫn Thị T. (20203020016) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ.

3.  Trương Thị T. (20203020017) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

4.  Trương Thị H. (20203020018) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

Về SEDA:
Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam.

Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding their businesses.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim R., 49, lives with her husband and three children in Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been working in her rice field growing rice and raising animals. On average, she makes about US $2 of profit a day. Her husband has a business collecting sugar palm juice and refining it to sell in the market. Three of their children work as construction workers. Sim R. is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase cows to help her in the rice field.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Pin

texts.en: Pin C., 40, is married with no children. Pin C. rents a small shop near the public port where she sells food to the people who cross there. She earns $4 a day. Her husband is a civil service officer in the Ministry of Interior. Pin C.’s workshop is frequently in disrepair and her daily business has been affected. To solve this problem, Pin C. is looking for a loan of $1100 to decorate and repair her old store.

loans.use: To decorate and repair her old store.

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efrena R. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Efrena is married and has 5 school-aged children. Efrena owns & operates a specialized retail store which supplies a variety of different products such as bananas, coffee and chicharon (pork cracklings). She also sells gasoline for motorcycles in the local community. Efrena has been operating her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Efrena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Efrena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Efrena is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Efrena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn Thị (20203020015) is a 38 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. C. is the group leader of a 5-member group loA. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives A. individual loA., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Thái 2- Nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).

C. is married and has 2 school-aged children. C. owns & operates a food production and retail business. The main source of income is the sale of seafood such as fish and shrimp in the local community. C. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2.600.000 VND a month.

C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. C. is requesting her first loA. of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA which will be used to invest in renovating her business. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1. Hoàng Thị L. (20203020019) is a 24 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loA. to support her specialized retail store.
2. Hà Thị Quý (20203020022) is a 44 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loA. to support her food production and retail business.
3. Trương Thị A. (20203020023) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loA. to support her specialized retail store.
4. Cao Thị T. (20203020025) is a 53 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loA. to support her recycling business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loA. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


C. Nguyễn Thị (20203020015) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  C. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Thái 2- Nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hải sản như cá và tôm trong cộng đồng địa phương.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 2.600.000 VND.  C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Hoàng Thị L. (20203020019) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  Hà Thị Quý (20203020022) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to invest in renovating her business

loans.name: Loeung

texts.en: Loeung M. is 51 and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She makes and sells cow ties and also works as a farmer. She typically makes about US$1.50 a day. Her husband is a construction worker. He typically makes US$3 per day. They have three children: two go to school and one is a garment factory worker. Loeung M. would like to apply for a loan of US$200 to make a new investment. She will open a grocery store and sell groceries to the people who live in the community.

loans.use: To open a grocery store.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly S. was born in 1963. She has been married for many years to Smanel, 59, who is a taxi driver. They have 3 children. One is married and lives away from home. The other two are single and work in the garment industry. Ly S. sells clothes that she buys from her wholesale supplier. Ly S. faces possible health problems resulting from polluted water surrounding her house. She requests a loan to purchase fill dirt to improve the condition of her property. (Ly S. was not available when the photo was taken so her husband is shown instead.)

loans.use: To purchase fill dirt

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en: T. Trương Thị's main source of income comes from raising cattle for sale. She is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Yên P. - Bắc Ninh. T. is married and has three adult children. She has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 dong (VND) a month. T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. T. is requesting a loan for the first time from SEDA. She is requesting a loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. T. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. T. is the leader of a six member group accessing a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01)". ID: 20203020001 About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Hà Thị T. is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. ID: 20203020004 2. Nguyễn Thị L. is a 49-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. ID: 20203020006 3. Nguyễn Thị X. is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business providing recycling services. ID: 20203020008 4. Trần Thị N. is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. ID: 20203020011 5. Cao Thị P. is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business operating a service-based business. ID: 20203020012 About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. T. Trương Thị (20203020001) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên P. - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Hel

texts.en: Hel Y., 58, lives with her husband in Takeo province. She is a farmer and sells palm juice in the village. She is able to make about US $5 of profit a day. Her husband makes and sells jars. He typically makes US $2 a day. This couple has two children who are garment factory workers. Hel Y. is asking for a loan of US $375. Her husband needs to purchase sand, cement and other materials to make jars.

loans.use: To purchase sand and cement

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa E. is from the village of Tuburan. She is 63 years old. Josefa is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To earn a living, Josefa owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 6,500 PHP, which will be used for the same purposes. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Josefa from PMPC and the second from Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business and living conditions of her family. Josefa appears together with her husband in the picture.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Jennifer's Group

texts.en:
Jennifer K. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Jennifer is the group leader of a 30-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jennifer is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jennifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo K. is 50 years old, married, and has one child living at home. She lives with her family in the Takeo province. She buys and sells rice, typically making US$1.60 each day, and her husband does construction work. Her husband typically makes about US$6 each day. Keo K. would like a loan of US$600 to purchase more rice to sell in the market.

loans.use: Purchase more rice

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Tho S., 22, is a professional silk scarf weaver, making US$3 a day in the Takeo province. She is married and has one child living at home. Her husband, Yong Touch, makes approximately US$3 a day, working as a construction worker. Tho S. would like a loan of US$400 to purchase more silk so that she can weave more scarves.

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Mercilyn's Group

texts.en:
Mercilyn S., 38, is from Ozamiz City. She is the group leader of a four-member group with a loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mercilyn is widowed and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a retail store selling soft drinks, snack food, noodles, eggs, shampoo, toothpaste, cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce and other daily use products in the local community. Mercilyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mercilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercilyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mercilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda S. J. is a 49-year old mother with one son, Riciy, who is 32 and a welder. She is married to a fisherman, Ricardo S. J.. To add to her husband’s income, Belinda has run a fish vending operating in their village for the past 10 years ago but improving the family’s living condition still remains difficult. The couple has now embarked on a farming business. 

Belinda applied for a new loan amounting PHP 45,000.00 to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to “palay” (rice). She wants to buy these items in advance in order to get a lower price and to avoid borrowing money from her neighbor during the planting period. When she borrows from her neighbor, she usually pays back in rice grains after the crop is harvested which is very disadvantageous to her and her husband.

Belinda hopes that, through her loan, she and her husband can save their harvest and get a better price at market. She wants to help support her grand children's education, invest in another rice field, and build a better house for the family.

loans.use: to finance fertilizer and insecticides and to buy "palay"(rice)".

loans.name: Naomi's Group

texts.en:
Naomi A. is from the village of Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old and is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. Naomi is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a "sari-sari” (general) store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, coffee, Milo (a milk drink), eggs, sugar, salt, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Naomi joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Naomi is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Tạ's Group

texts.en:
N. Tạ Thị (20203020020) is a 50-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  N. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).


N. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, N. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs & spices in the local community.  N. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  N. is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA in the amount of 3,360,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by N. from SEDA.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị D. (20203020024) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 2,912,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Lộc (20203020026) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


3.  Cao Thị Hiển (20203020027) is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.


4.  Nguyễn Thị Lạc (20203020021) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.
