4.  Nguyễn Thị Lạc (20203020021) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math S. is a 30-year old single woman. She was once married but she divorced years ago. She currently lives with her younger sister and brother-in-law in a wooden house in Phnom Penh city. 
To make a living, S. sells mens' and womens' clothes in the local market. S. is a good salesperson because she is skilled in public communication. Her store is very busy and she has many clients. S. is applying for a loan so that she can take advantage of lower bulk prices by buying large quantities of clothing for resale.

loans.use: To increaes her inventory of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Aurora's Group

texts.en: Aurora M. is from the village of Ugad. She is 45 years old and is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Aurora M.. Aurora is married and has five adult children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seventeen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Aurora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Shinang Uom Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan, which consists of 17 people, is located in Akreiy Ksat village in Kandal province. Mrs. Shinang U. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. They all will use the loan for different purposes. She is a vegetable seller in the local market and her husband, Mr. Poura Mum, is a construction laborer. They can earn less money; however, this family tries to work hard with their careers. So in order to improve their family's living condition, Mrs. Shinang U. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell to expand her business. She is a mother of three children. Two of her children are enrolled in local public school and the other one helps the parents. Mrs. Sovana Oruch is the group guarantor.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to re-sell

loans.name: Maruush

texts.en:
Maruush is living with her husband who works in the city and moved from the countryside two years ago. She wanted to switch to clean fuel because it produces less smoke than other products and she wanted to contribute to reducing the city’s air pollution. Since purchasing the product, she has saved money on fuel and is happy that she purchased the eco-friendly fuel.  She said, “This product is very efficient to use”. She is also happy to receive reduced interest rates for the fuel.

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world.  Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius.  60% of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To purchase clean and energy efficient heating fuel

loans.name: El

texts.en: Mrs. El R. and her husband, Mr. Nos Him, are dried fish sellers. They both always go to sell their produces around the province in Cambodia, and are able to earn about $10 a day. The family takes care of six school-aged kids and three others who are married and employed. El R. lives with her family in the Bei Village in the Chrung Chumres I Sangkat in Phnom Penh City. Because of her business, she can help her children go to school and pay her family’s living expenses. El R. has requested a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children to ride to school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn G. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 32 years old. Marilyn is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Shiella

texts.en:
Shiella G. is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Shiella is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Shiella owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Shiella has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Shiella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shiella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment. Shiella is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Shiella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
L. Lê Thị (20203020034) is a 60-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - B. Ninh. L. is the group leader for a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).

L. is married and has three adult children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling beef products in the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. is requesting her first loan from SEDA. She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Nguyễn Thị L. (20203020035) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store.

2. Ngô Thị B. (20203020037) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,360,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. Trương Thị G. (20203020036) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

4. Nguyễn Thị B. (20203020038) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

5. Ngô Thị G. (20203020039) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.

6. Nguyễn Thị T. (20203020040) is an 18-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business running a general store.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

L. Lê Thị (20203020034) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - B. Ninh. L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Thái 1 - Nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ T.t bò trong cộng đồng địa phương. L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia M. comes from Jala-jala, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. Four of her children are minors and the oldest is a first-year college student. All of them still need her support.  The couple has strong faith to improve their standard of living.

Sonia and her husband operate a welding stall. She started this business when ASHI gave her an opportunity to obtain a loan. The business is a big help to the family in covering their expenses and setting aside savings for the future. Now they are planning to buy a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) to have supplementary income to consistently provide the educational needs of their growing children.

The couple is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy a tricycle. They believe that proceeds from this business will give them money to support the immediate needs of their family.

Sonia hopes that her business will become successful someday. Along with the winning business, she is dreaming about seeing her five children graduate from college and find a stable job. She also still dreams of having a durable and concrete house of her own and saving for her family’s future.

loans.use: To buy a tricycle

loans.name: Rosita's Group

texts.en:
Rosita F. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 60 years old. Rosita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en:
Ankhbayar is the father of an energetic three year-old son and lives in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar.  He is an international economist.  He would like a loan to purchase clean and energy efficient heating fuel in order to reduce the fuel he purchases and uses.  He is worried about the air pollution in Ulaanbaatar and he thinks that the public needs to take more efficient action to reduce the air pollution.

About XacBank Eco Products Program:

Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world.  Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius.  60% of the city population lives in tents called gers which consist of wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the cold season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To purchase clean and energy efficient heating fuel.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana P. is from the village of Libertda, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 53 years-old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Juana buys and sells bananas in the local community. Juana has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Juana joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Juana is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Juana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: S. is 42 years of age and currently lives with other family members who include her elderly mother, daughters, and a son-in-law. She was married, but divorced her husband when her kids were young. To earn a living, S. sells poultry that she slaughters herself. Also, she buys chickens and ducks in bulk at reasonable prices from rural people and raises them in her home for a while. S. has an old small house which is frequently in need of repairs and this affects her daily life. Therefore, she is seeking a loan through Kiva partner HKL to be used to decorate and repair her existing house.

loans.use: To decorate and repair her existing house.

loans.name: Trần's Group

texts.en:
Hệ Trần Thị (20203040058) is a 29-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Hệ is the group leader for a six-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 2 - Nhóm 10 (Nhóm 10).

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling lake-caught fish in the local community. Hệ has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

Hệ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hệ is requesting her first loan from SEDA. She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. Hệ plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Thôn 2 - Nhóm 10 (Nhóm 10).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & B.n các loại cá đánh bắt ở hồ trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hệ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hệ kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. Hệ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hệ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Trần Thị L. (20203040059) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn B.n quầy thực phẩm.

2. Trương Thị H. (20203040060) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Ngô Bá D. (20203040061) là 29 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20203040062) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.

5. Cao Thị H. (20203040063) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông B.o bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông B.o các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Jelina

texts.en:
Jelina A. is from the village of Minaog, Dipolog City but she operates her business in Poblacion, La Libertad, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 57 years-old and married with one adult child. To make a living, Jelina owns and operates a general store selling a variety of grocery products.  She also sells soft drinks in the local community. Jelina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jelina joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Jelina is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital for her soft drink selling business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jelina from PMPC and through Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group
loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy Q. is from the city of Malibangcao, Ozamiz. She is 42 years-old and married with one infant child. To make a living, Ludy operates a transportation service providing tricycle transport services in the local community. Ludy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ludy joined Kiva Partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ludy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ludy is requesting a new loan of 7,900 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle so she can provide better service. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Ludy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair tricycle.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon S. is from the village of Poblacion, 1 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old. Marlon is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marlon owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a mini-pharmacy selling different kinds of medicine in the local community. Marlon has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marlon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 60,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marlon is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Marlon from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Kiều's Group

texts.en:
N. Kiều Thị B. (20206020031) is a 23-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. N. is the group leader for a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Nhân 1 - Nhóm 05 (Nhóm 05).

N. is married and has one infant child. To making a living, N. owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. N. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,256,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,496,000 VND which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third loan from SEDA. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Trần Thị C. (20206020032) is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. Nguyễn Thị Bé (20206020033) is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. Nguyễn Thị H. (20206020034) is a 57-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20206020035) is a 32-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5. Hoàng Thị L. (20206020036) is a 49-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

6. Nguyễn Thị H. (20206020037) is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

N. Kiều Thị B. (20206020031) là 23 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. N. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. N. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.256.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

3. Nguyễn Thị H. (20206020034) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4. Nguyễn Thị T. (20206020035) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5. Hoàng Thị L. (20206020036) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

6. Nguyễn Thị H. (20206020037) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

Về SEDA:

Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann A. is a 27-year-old mother of two. Both are minors and grade school students. She is a native of Talim Island in the town of Binangonan, which is located in Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is happily living with her two children and her 33-year-old husband, Arnold A., who is a driver.

She has hopes of escaping the cycle of poverty. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and a KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2009 with hope of securing working capital to establish a business. Since then her business has continued to grow and provide good income for her family; therefore couple now request their 2nd loan in the amount of 10,000 pesos to use as working capital to continue their fish cage business. The loan will be used to pay for bundles of fishnet, bamboo, rope, fingerlings (small fish) and labor expenses.

Mary Ann is looking forward to increased orders for fish from the nearby town so that they can generate enough proceeds for her family. She dreams of sending her children to school until they finish college and finding a stable living. Also of building their own house because they’re only living with their parents now.

loans.use: to use as working capital to continue their fish cage business

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly S. is a modest citizen living in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, where she has made a living selling fish in the busy local market since 2001. She has a partner in her husband, who assists her in conducting the business. The couple now have five children who are attending school.

Ly S. has been planning to redecorate her old house for a long time but she doesn’t have the capacity to do that, as she has only a small income. Therefore, Ly S. is applying for a loan of US$ 1000 which will allow her to redecorate and mend her house. (Ly S.'s husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To redecorate and mend her house.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Lun V., 39, sells fried bananas in the local market in her Takeo province. She is married with four children, who are still living at home, and her husband works in construction. She typically makes about US$ 4 each day and would like a loan to expand her husband's business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for US$ 500 which her husband needs to purchase more construction tools.

loans.use: To purchase more construction tools.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly C., 42, is a professional handicrafter living and working at home in Takeo province. Since 1993, she has been using beads and other materials to make flowers on women's clothing to earn a living and typically makes US$ 2 each day. Decorated dresses are a Khmer tradition and people wear them during the 'Water Festival', 'P’chum Ben' or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive, of course. Most people prefer hand-made rather than machine-made.

Ly C. said she learned how to decorate dresses from her mother and she started doing that business when she was not yet married. Ly C. would like a loan of US$ 400 to purchase more beads and other materials for her work.

loans.use: To purchase more beads, etc. for her work

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel F. is from the village of Estaka. She is 33 years old and married. To make a living, Marivel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling surplus clothing products in the local community. Marivel has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marivel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marivel is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marivel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business and general living conditions of her  family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia P. is 48 years old and married. She is a member of the Malacaban Center 4 group of Rizal South Branch (RSB) and is an active member of her group and center. She lives in a coastal place, on Talim Island, Binangonan, Rizal, Philippines. She and Her husband have two children. Both are students and in need of her support. They come from poor families and they want a better life for their two children.

In 2009, she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, to obtain working capital for her primary business, fishing.  She also runs a variety store as a secondary business to earn more income.

Now on her second loan, she requests 10,000 PHP to continue the primary business, fishing. The loan fund will be used to pay for fishing equipment like rope, bamboo, fish nets, and the cost of labor for 3 persons to work for 2 days.

In the future, Lilia wants to invest in more fish cages to raise more fish and meet the growing demands in their village. She hopes to be successful in both businesses in order to provide a college education for her child.

loans.use: to invest in equipment for her primary business, which is fishing.

loans.name: Sherdil

texts.ru: Сафаров Шердил проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 23 года. Женат, не имеет детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Шердил торговлей занимается более 4 лет. Он в основном продает диски (DVD, CD) и аудио кассеты. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sherdil S. lives in the town of Kulob. He is 23 years old. He is married and has no children. His wife is a housewife. Sherdil himself has been in sales for more than four years. He mainly sells CD's, DVD's and audio tapes. He is asking for a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong L., 56, is a hard working woman who resides in Phnom Penh city. To pursue a daily income, Hong L. owns a small business selling dried fish in the public local market. She is a widow and mother blessed with three children. All three of them are married and working at different jobs. She has a daughter who earns a living selling groceries in her store located inside her home. The fish season is approaching and the price she pays to buy her fish is presently low. Hong L. would like to take this occasion to earn extra profit, and so she requests a loan to order fresh fish in bulk and then process them into dried fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk.

loans.name: Munhzul

texts.en:
Munhzul is an agronomist and lives with her husband and two children. So far, she is very happy with the product because of it's affordable price, high efficiency and eco advantages. She promoted eco fuel to her surrounding community including neighbors, relatives and co-workers. Her brother has already bought fuel from her recommendation. 

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world.  Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius.  60% of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy supplies of clean and energy efficient heating fuel

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San V. is 24-year-old, married and mother. She has a young child who is enrolled in primary school. Her husband is the main provider for family. He sells jewelry with his uncle around the province, in Cambodia. 

To earn a living, San V. sells breakfast foods to customers from nearby villages from her home. San V. is looking for a loan to decorate her shop and her house to better attract customers who come to eat her food.

loans.use: To decorate her shop and her house.

loans.name: Cerilo

texts.en:
Cerilo R. is from the village of P-2 Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 50 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Cerilo owns and operates a business providing motor transport "habal-habal" services (a habal-habal is a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers). Cerilo has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Cerilo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cerilo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair his motorcycle in order to provide better service. This loan will be his second from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair and maintain the motorcycle used in his business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora S. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Nora is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Nora owns and operates a business operating a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as noodles, shampoo, candies, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Nora has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Nora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Nora is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes I. is from the village of Calaran, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Mercedes is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedes owns and operates a service-based business, providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Mercedes has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mercedes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Mercedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. Mercedes is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more needed materials. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide her services

loans.name: Mabel's Group

texts.en:
Mabel B. is from the city of Baranggay 5, Tangub City. She is 29 years old. Mabel is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mabel is single. To make a living, Mabel owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products such as cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce, eggs, sugar and salt in the local community. Mabel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $22 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Mabel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Mabel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Mabel is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Мамарахимова Сафаргул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 39 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Сафаргул более 5 лет занимается земледелием. Она выращивает пшеницу. В этой деятельности ей помогает муж. Кредит просит для закупа семян и удобрений, чтобы посеить новый урожай.
texts.en:
Safargul M. lives in the Yavan region. She is 39 years old. She is married and has four children. Safaragul has been doing agriculture for more than five years. She grows wheat. Her husband is helping her in this business. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow new crops.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria V. is a 37-year-old woman from the coastal town of Talim Island, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. She is the mother of a 4-year-old child, Ian Roy. She is married to a fisherman, Modesto, who is 40 years old.


In 2009, Victoria joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She was full of hopes of uplifting her family from the cycle of poverty. For her new loan, she is requesting 10,000 PHP as additional working capital for her fishing business. She uses fish cages to catch fish and then delivers the different kinds of fish to nearby towns, where it is purchased by customers.


Now that she has the chance to realize her dreams, she hopes to buy more fish cages to catch more fish to sell in the nearby village. Like most families here in the Philippines, they are dreaming for the best in life and also a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more fish cages.

loans.name: Lidia Saraí

texts.es: Lidia Saraí G. R. de 19 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Morazán, vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad en casa alquilada. Lidia se dedica a elaborar hamacas, en variedad de colores y estilos, los cuales posteriormente sale a comercializar a las zonas de turismos del departamento de Morazán. Su trabajo es muy bien pagado, ya que los precios de las hamacas pueden ser algo costosos por ser elaborados a mano, a pesar de esto no es una venta muy constante, ya que no siempre se logra vender. Es por esto que Lidia, solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar por mayor, el hilo que se utiliza para hacer las hamacas, esto con el fin e poder obtenerlo a precios más bajos y así ofrecer las hamacas a menor costo. Lidia es una mujer muy constante en su trabajo quien desea poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que esto trae grandes beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia Saraí G. R. is 19 years old and lives in the Morazán department along with her husband and two-year old son in a rented house. Lidia works making hammocks in a variety of colors and styles which she later sells in the tourist zones of the Morazán department. Her job is very well-paid since the hammocks can be somewhat expensive because they are handmade. Despite this, she does not have steady business and does not always manage to make sales. For this reason, Lidia is requesting a loan with the goal of being able to buy at wholesale the thread she uses to make the hammocks. This will allow her to get the thread at lower prices and offer the hammocks at lower prices. Lidia is a very persevering woman in her work and hopes to be able to improve her sales since this will bring great benefits to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread for making hammocks.

loans.name: Santos Andrés

texts.es: Santos Andrés M. L. de 26 años de edad, reside en San Isidro, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Desde hace tres años que él vive solo en su casa propia, la cual fue heredada por su padre y que esta ubicada en la zona rural de San Isidro. Santos posee una granja en la cual se encarga de criar ganado y luego comercializarlo. Gracias a sus excelentes estándares de calidad, Santos cuenta con muchos clientes, esto ha pesar de que cuenta con poco tiempo de dedicarse a este trabajo como propietario de su negocio, aunque posee mucha experiencia debido a que se ha dedicado toda su vida a este oficio junto a su padre. Santos solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar mayor cantidad de alimentos para su ganado, y así mismo comprar más ganado. A pesar que vive solo, el desea poder mejorar su calidad de vida, es por ello que espera poder mejorar su negocio y de esta manera sus ganancias. Santos es un joven muy visionario y emprendedor, quien desea tener una mejor vida tanto para el presente como para su futuro.
texts.en:
Santos Andrés M. L., 26 years old, lives in San Isidro, located in the the department of Morazán. For three years he has lived in his own home, which was inherited from his father and is located in the rural area of San Isidro. Santos owns a farm where he raises and sells livestock. Thanks to his excellent quality standards, Santos has many customers in spite of having little time to dedicate to this. He has a lot of experience due spending his entire life in this business together with his father. Santos is requesting loan in order to purchase a larger quantity of feed for his livestock and thus purchase more livestock. In spite of living alone he wants to improve his standard of living and that's why he hopes to be able to improve his business and income. Santos is a very visionary and entrepreneurial young man that wants to have a better life in the present as well as in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Delmi Del Carmen

texts.es: Delmi del Carmen A. de 35 años de edad, reside en el hermoso pueblo de Perquín, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán. Ella es madre soltera quien trabaja arduamente por sostener a cuatro hijos quienes son menores de edad, y se dedican a estudiar, vive junto a ellos y su madre, quien le ayuda a cuidar de los pequeños. Desde hace 5 años Delmi posee un comedor, el cual esta ubicado frente al parque municipal de Perquín, así mismo se encuentra bastante cerca del punto de transporte publico, esto le brinda muchos beneficios, ya que se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida. Ella se dedica a elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales le dejan una ganancia diaria de las cuales debe obtener para solventar todos los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos y así mismo para sostener el negocio. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar, verduras, carne, bebidas y todo lo necesario para mantener su venta de una manera estable y que le permita obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Delmi del Carmen A. is 35 years old, and lives in the beautiful town of Perquín, located in the department of Morazán. She is a single mother who works tirelessly to support her 4 minor children, who study in school. She lives with them and with her mother, who helps her care for the small ones. Delmi has had a restaurant for 5 years, which is located in front of the municipal park in Perquín. The restaurant is very close to the public transportation stop; this provides many benefits, as it is located in a busy area. Delmi makes breakfasts and lunches, and this gives her daily earnings that she needs to cover the household expenses and the expenses of her children, as well as the costs of running the business. For this reason she requests a loan to buy vegetables, meat, drinks, and everything she needs to maintain her sales in a stable manner so she can have good earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat and drinks.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María Concepción P. D. F. D. 52 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su única hija D. 12 años D. edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar y a ayudarle a su madre con los quehaceres del hogar. María posee un bazar en el cual comercializa ropa, zapatos, listones, juguetes y muchos otros productos. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado D. la Colonia Monserrat, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Es D. esta manera en como María se gana la vida desD. hace varios años, logrando mucha experiencia en el oficio y obteniendo clientes muy fieles a ella, los cuales siempre están complacidos con el servicio brindado. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos, aumentado su inventario y obteniendo nuevos productos, sobre todo aquellos que están acordes con las temporadas que se van dando, como por ejemplo el día D. la amistad. Tanto para  María como para su hija las ganancias obtenidas son fundamentales para su sobrevivencia, es por ello que depositan su esperanza en el dinero obtenido para mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio y así mismo las D. su hogar.
texts.en:
María Concepción is 52 years old and lives in the San Salvador Department. She lives with her 12 year old daughter, who goes to school and helps her with the household chores. Maria sells clothing, shoes, ribbons, toys, and many other items in the “Colonia Monserrat” marketplace, located within the San Salvador Department. This is the way Maria earns a living, and has been doing this for a number of years. She has lots of experience and has established loyal customers who are always satisfied with her service. Maria is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of new products in order to increase her inventory, particularly products appropriate for the upcoming seasons, such as friendship day. Her earnings are essential for her and her daughter’s well being, so she is hoping to get this loan in order to improve her business and her home life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy additional clothing and sundry items for resale

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es: Agueda M. M. de 56 años de edad, residen en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su único hijo. Ella posee una venta de cosméticos, y cremas para el cabello, así mismo comercializa ropa para mujer. La venta esta ubicada en su propia casa de habitación, lugar el cual cuenta con muy buena ubicación, ya que su casa esta en la esquina de la calle principal, y se encuentra muy cerca del punto de buses del transporte público, lo que provoca que muchas personas transiten por el lugar a toda hora del día. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de cosméticos, así mismo desea poder comprar ropa en diversidad de colores y tallas, de manera que pueda obtener mayor cantidad de clientes. Agueda es una persona muy trabajadora quien siempre ha deseado seguir adelante con su negocio y poder crecer como comerciante, de esta manera ella espera mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Agueda is 56 years old and lives in the San Salvador Department with her only son. She sells cosmetics, hair creams, and ladies’ clothing out of her home. Her home is in a good location, on the corner of a main street, close to the public bus depot, and many people pass by daily. She is requesting this loan in order to invest in larger amounts of cosmetics and clothing in a variety of colors and sizes, so that she can increase her number of customers. Agueda is a hard worker who has always wanted to get ahead with her business, grow as a businesswoman, and improve her financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in cosmetics and clothing for resale

loans.name: Nyoka

texts.en:
Nyoka J. is currently in the business of selling beans and charcoal from her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Nyoka is 40 years old and is a widow.  She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store and educate her children.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth P. D. L. D. 50 años D. edad, resiD. en Ilopango, departamento D. San Salvador. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, y su hija menor D. edad quien estudia. Sandra posee una librería, y así mismo comercializa otros tipos D. productos como: carteras, bolsones, cajas para regalo y cosméticos, todo con el fin D. poder contar con mayor cantidad D. clientes y obtener ganancias extras las cuales son muy necesarias para ella. Sandra solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar papelería al mayor, D. manera que pueda obtenerlo a menores precios, así mismo comprar más cosméticos. Todo  esto lo hace con el deseo D. poder mejorar sus ventas, aumentando su inventario, ya que D. esta forma ella podrá obtener mayor clientela vender más sus productos.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth P. D. L. is 50 years old and lives in Ilopango, in the Departament of San Salvador, El Salvador. She owns a house where she lives with her husband, who is a bricklayer, and her daughter who is in school. Sandra has a stationery and office supply store where she also sells products such as wallets, bags, gift boxes and cosmetics. She sells various items in order to attract a greater number of customers and gain the income that she needs. Sandra is asking for a loan with which she can buy paper goods in bulk, so that she can get them at lower prices. She would also like to buy more cosmetics. In general she would like to increase her inventory in order to attract more customers and improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paper goods and cosmetics

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita M. is a widow who supports her family by selling fish. She lives in Brgy. Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental with her three children who are now young adults. One is working and the rest help her in her business.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since June 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family's living conditions more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $220.

Angelita is now borrowing 29,500 PHP for her fish vending business. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP that was paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Angelita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Patricia Marisela

texts.es: Patricia Marisela A. R. de 34 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos menores de edad. Patricia posee un taller de corte y confección, en el cual se encarga de elaborar prendas de vestir para mujeres, hombres y niños. Ella se encarga de trabajar por pedidos previos por parte de sus clientes y así mismo elaborar cortinas las cuales comercializa en su casa. Patricia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar tela por mayor, esto con el deseo de poder elaborar más ropa y cortinas, así mismo con el fin de atender mayor cantidad de clientes, lo cual es de mucho beneficio para ella. Patricia es una persona trabajadora y muy humilde quien desea darles una mejor vida a sus hijos, ayudándole a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar y de esta manera tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Patricia Marisela is 34 years old and lives in the city of Soyapango, located in the San Salvador Department. She lives with her husband and their two young children. Patricia has a tailor shop where she manufactures articles of clothing for women, men, and children. She is in charge of filling customer orders and also makes curtains which she sells from her home. Patricia is asking for a loan so that she can buy cloth in bulk so that she can make more clothing and curtains and be able to service more customers. This will be of great benefit to her. Patricia is a very humble and hard working woman who wants to give her children a better life by helping her husband make ends meet.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth in bulk

loans.name: Beticia

texts.en:
Beticia V. is a 68-year-old widow from Jala-jala, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. She has given birth to an only son, Joey V., who is a 39-year-old fisherman. At her older age and being a widow is not easy for her to face the difficulty of poverty, but through the support of ASHI in her life, she has never felt alone in achieving her dreams.


In 1992, Beticia joined the KIVA partner and MFI, Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), which means ”To rise up from poverty”. When she received her previous loans, she invested the money in selling detergent and soap bars, and she hopes to expand her business soon by purchasing more stock. Now on her 6th loan, she has requested 25,000 PHP as additional capital for her primary business of selling detergent and soap, while she tends to a fishing business at the same time.


She is optimistic that both businesses will grow because she already has regular customers requesting orders from her.


She dreams of having a space in the market where she can sell her detergent and soap bars, and more fish from her fishing business. She also dreams of building a durable, concrete house and having successful businesses that can provide them a good life that is far away from poverty.

loans.use: As additional working capital for her business of selling detergent and soap bars

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is currently in the business of selling bread at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of sugar to sell.  Mary is 21 years old and is single.   She has one child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to purchase bags of sugar to sell

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca A. D. M. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Ahuachapán, junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. La señora Rebeca, posee una venta D. ropa usada, la cual es importada D. Los Estados Unidos. Su negocio esta ubicado en las cercanías D. la Alcaldía D. Ahuachapán, lo que le brinda una excelente ubicación ya que es un lugar muy concurrido por las personas. Tanto Rebeca como toda su familia cuentan con muy buenas referencias, ya que se refieren a ellos como personas muy trabajadoras y amables quienes siempre están dispuestos a esforzarse más cada día, Rebeca solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, sobre todo juvenil, la cual es la que más se venD.. Ella espera mejorar las ganancias, ofreciendo mayor cantidad D. variedad D. prendas D. vestir D. manera que pueda captar la atención D. mayor cantidad D. clientes.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 47 years old and lives in the Ahuachapán Department, along with her husband and three children who attend school. Rebeca sells clothing that is imported from the United States. Her business is located in the vicinity of the Ahuachapán City Hall, which is an excellent location because it is so well known by many people. Rebeca and the rest of her family have very good references and are known to be hard working and friendly people who are willing to work harder each day. Rebeca is requesting a loan so that she can invest in larger amounts of clothing, particularly children’s clothing, which is her biggest seller. She expects to increase her revenue by being able to offer a greater variety of clothing items and be able to attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in clothing for resale

loans.name: Erasmo Antonio

texts.es: Erasmo Antonio B. V. de 29 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 5 y 4 años de edad. Él posee una carpintería, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, lugar en el cual trabaja por las noches y fines de semana, lo cual demuestra que Erasmo es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable quien vela día y noche por el bienestar de su familia, sin importar el doble esfuerzo que tenga que realizar, esto debido a que durante el día, de lunes a viernes, él trabaja como empleado de otra carpintería, en la cual se encarga de atender a los clientes que visitan el lugar. Erasmo solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda hacer sustitución de paredes de adobe por paredes de block en su casa, esto debido a que las fuertes lluvias del invierno pasado deterioraron las paredes de su hogar, y antes que inicie la temporada de lluvia el desea poder contar con paredes nuevas, las cuales le brinde mayor seguridad a sus hijos y su esposa. Erasmo es un ejemplo de emprendurismo y dedicación, ya que trabaja arduamente para poder seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Erasmo Antonio is 29 years old and lives in the San Salvador Department, along with his wife and children, ages 5 and 4. He has a carpentry shop, collocated within his home, where he works in the evenings and on weekends. This demonstrates that Ernesto is a hard working young man who toils day and night for the well-being of his family, despite him having to put in double the effort. He works as an employee at another carpentry shop, Monday through Friday, where he attends to customers. Erasmo is requesting this loan so that he can replace the adobe walls in his home with cinder block, since the strong rains last winter caused his walls to deteriorate. He would like to have his new walls installed before the rainy season begins so that his wife and children can feel more secure. Erasmo is an example of enterprising and dedication, as he works diligently to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rebuild the walls in his home

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce I. is currently in the business of selling local alcoholic beverages and charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients to use to make alcohol to sell.  Joyce is 20 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has one child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy more materials to use and make alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Democrita

texts.en:
Democrita G. is a 60-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy. Miranda, Bolobitoon, Hinigaran City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her eatery and general store.

Democrita’s husband Ernesto helps her run the business. They have six children who are between the ages of 19 and 32. Some of their children have their own work, and one child is currently going to school.

Democrita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her eatery and general store business. Now she earns an average monthly income of $175 from her business activities.

Democrita is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which was also funded by Kiva lenders, was used to fund the operations of her eatery and general store business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is taking out her 16th loan, in the amount of 23,000 PHP, which she intends to use on her business. Democrita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.es: Anatalia G. T. de 50 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Delgado, ubicada en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella vive en un lugar muy humilde, junto a su esposo quien trabaja como motorista del transporte público y junto a dos hijos. Ella posee un negocio en su propia casa, en el cual se encarga de elaborar tortillas y pupusas, dos tipos de alimentos los cuales son muy típicos de la comida salvadoreña. Anatalia se encarga de elaborar y cocinar las pupusas y tortillas en una cocina de barro, y con leña, lo cual es muy escaso en estos días, por esta razón ella cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales compran en el lugar por ser pupusas y tortillas elaboradas de manera artesanal. Anatalia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz, así mismo para comprar toda la materia prima para elaborar las pupusas, en mayores cantidades. Este negocio es muy rentable, ya que a pesar que cuente con muchos clientes siempre se logra obtener ganancias diarias, es por esto que Anatalia desea poder seguir adelante con el y de esta manera mantener la estabilidad económica de su familia y brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para solventar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Anatalia G. T. is 50 years old. She lives in Delgado city, which is located in the San Salvador department. She lives in a very humble place with her husband, who works as a public transportation driver, and their two children. She has a business in her own house. She makes tortillas and “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables), two typical Salvadorean foods. Anatalia makes and cooks the pupusas and tortillas in a clay oven with firewood, which is very scarce these days. The reason that she has a lot of customers who buy from her place is that the pupusas and tortillas are handmade. Anatalia is asking for a loan to be able to buy a greater quantity of corn. She will also buy all of the ingredients to make greater quantities of pupusas. This business is very profitable. She has a lot of customers, and she always gets daily earnings. Anatalia wants to be able to get ahead with the business. That way she will provide economic stability to the family and give her husband the necessary help to pay the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn and other ingredients to make pupusas

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Elsy Guadalupe

texts.es: Elsy Guadalupe V. D. L. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en Ilopango, departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Elsy posee una tienda D. productos perecederos en su propia casa D. habitación, negocio en el cual se encarga D. comercializar productos D. primera necesidad. Este negocio nació con la esperanza D. poder obtener ganancias extras, a través D. las cuales fuera posible brindarle estudios a sus hijos y así mismo una vida mejor. Elsy solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos perecederos, aumentado la cantidad D. los que ya posee y obteniendo nuevos, D. esta manera ella podrá obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales sean D. gran beneficio para sus hijos y para todo su hogar, ya que será posible contar con una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Elsy Guadalupe V. D. L., age 42, lives in Ilopango in the San Salvador department. She lives with her husband and two children. The children go to school. Elsy has a store, which carries perishable products, in her own house. She sells basic needs products. This business was born with the hope of being able to get extra income to give her children an education and a better life. Elsy is asking for a loan to be able to buy a larger quantity of perishable products. That will increase the quantity that she has and add new products. That way she will be able to get greater earnings, which will be of great benefit to her children and the whole household. It will then be possible to have economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
